Eld6EIOfDwEq_qJhAbsg1A.text: Very good local Mexican place. Came in and. Was treated to great service. Had the flautas. Worth the time to check out.

vAtK_hoYcavh5Ht5UcsOpA.text: Great food, super friendly service! Can't reduce review stars but wish they had margaritas, if they did I would increase to 6 stars. Green (hot) sauce is very tasty. Keep up the good work!!

korMdlW5wpZ1mY6uxMUdEg.text: I had the adobada torta with the and the fish taco. Torta was amazing, however I think it could have used a bit more meat.  The fried cod taco I think cost too much, however the fish and sauce are delicious, just not worth the price and my corn tortilla fell apart.  Good service in a shopping center restaurant. maybe come back to try the desserts.

_2iFYKL2sfV-6D_sOg8idQ.text: I have been a regular customer of Phat Phranks since it opened in April of 09. Just had the Chile Verde wet burrito. I should have done this a long time ago! Fantastic flavors in the chile!

xUB5YXSsmb3BmFsxqK-lkw.text: Has good reviews and I was not disappointed. You must try the churros with caramel and chocolate.. So good! I will be back!

-BRwosX5JYdWTr1pdSglyA.text: I promised to go here And I did. Went for the fish tacos, my sister got the Flautas we shared and it was absolutely excellent! The flautas were cooked perfectly & complete with top notch guacamole. Rice and Beans rocked & The fish tacos were great too, fish was mouth watering and I loved the way they chopped the cabbage. Oh BTW to the poor dunce with the one one star review, (fish tacos traditionally come with cabbage so your "trip around the world" obviously didnt include Tijuana). Frank was an absolute pleasure and has definitely won the hearts of myself and my family! See you soon!

tOAa8y2yyC7wa56Ilm_LPQ.text: This was one of the bad dining experiences you have every so often in life. It was recommended to me so I thought I'd try it. There were a couple of red flags right off the bat. The first was that it was 5:30 in the evening, prime dinner hour and we were the only ones in there, however after a few minutes people did start coming in, it was never busy though. The second was the back.kitchen door was wide open and it was hot outside. The third was the person taking the orders was in a mood lethargic and really wasn't into helping us at all. When prodded she answered basic questions about the food. There was three of us, my son, his girlfriend, and myself. My sons gf and I ordered pork burritos and my son ordered a brc burrito. When you pay there is room for a tip. I always tip but I want to see the service first as this was a fast food restaurant. The same girl that took our order brought us our food kind of tossed it on the table and told me that there were holders on the wall to get the plastic silverware ( not understanding why I should tip for this). My son was ok with his burrito but his gf and I did not like ours at all. I didn't get the meat in mine my sons gf did and said it was tasteless. The rice was mushed together with some kind of seasoned salt and the beans were out of the can. One of the people that worked there asked how everything was and I told him not good. I didn't like the food and was going to head to McDonalds for something better. He called both the girl taking the orders and the cook out. The girl taking the order said she though my son and his gf ordered the same thing a brc burrito and I ordered the one with the pork, yet she tossed my sons gf the pork burrito. The cook looked at me and said Ne not liking the food was a matter of opinion and she hopes I enjoy another Mexican restaurant. I will and do because I love Mexican food. I only gave it one star because the food was cooked and so far none of us has gotten sick. Oh yeah one more thing the cook has long hair that should be kept in a net. Thank God I didn't have any of it in my food. This disaster cost me $28.00 I actually feel really bad that I paid them. It is not worth it. If you want good Mexican food go to Chili Verde. Also I feel bad about writing a bad review but this was exceptional.

zFK7qv--u9aOFfrQJxvkVA.text: Good food but very rude lady at register, will not be coming back here, too many good places in vegas that have better customer service.

lQaryM9vl-OFOr-aA1Ko-A.text: Decided to eat here for my lunch date with my husband and the food was great! I got the chicken flautas and he got the carne asada torta! The food was delicious and the prices was reasonable. We will be coming here for our lunch dates every week

qC75nHpunP9d3MoB3WS6Bg.text: Some of the best food I've had in awhile. The staff was awesome and fast, it was so yummy I can't believe it took me 2 years to try this place is so close to my house. A new favorite! :-)

Z59Hsj35lLN6WlXawurfKw.text: Best Mexican I've had in years.  Phrank was working the register and cleaning.  We chatted for a bit and seemed like a really nice guy.  I live close so going back soon.

1Do4fT7GGqbtX5RqWON98Q.text: went 2 years ago when they first opened 2 female employess acted real bored "I bet they were family members" never hire your family. cant give more than 1 star because when I got home my tacos were filled with "Cabbage" who the hell puts cabbage in their friggin tacos. I have been all over the world and never had cabbage put into a taco shell. what indigenous part of Mexico does this?????  tried to go back to just tell them to hold the cabbage but they are always closed for Pete's sake just go out of business....

JAq9wfJcJTa_ulSbbCAQTA.text: Tried it and I gotta tell you this was an exceptional outing.  Everything from food to service.     Place closes at 5 and I popped in 4:10-15ish (some places give you THAT look you know) and place was lil slow as to be expected.  Frank the owner was there and I gotta tell you he goes above and beyond to provide an experience.  We ended up chitchatting some before, during and even after my order.  I left nearly at close time and never got any bad vibes.  He's real cool, real humble and I found out we both made our way to the 702 roughly the same time, out from SoCal.     All that aside the food was great, got an adobada torta (based on his recommendation) and I gotta tell you the pork was done perfect and their secret sauce put it up there.  Perhaps the best torta I've had to date.  I say this cause I was listening to Pandora a lil while and I went from a whole torta to half a half (you'll know what I'm saying) in a matter of minutes.  I seriously devoured that torta!  I also ended up getting their pork nachos (which I've never had that way) put some of their home made hot salsa and went to town on it too.  In all the torta is a definite 5/5 it was simply awesome... the nachos could've used a lil something something else too but for my taste get 3.5-4/5 not bad.     Next time I'm trying their fish tacos which he said has the same secret sauce or depending on what time I go might get their breakfast burrito.  I'm jotting this one down as a definite go-back.

ms54W9aTHywZ3DwFzry1iQ.text: Been coming here for a few years now whenever I'm in town. Service is excellent every time. I have eaten just about everything on the menu over the years and haven't found anything that wasn't delicious. Highly recommend to anyone craving good ol mom and pop mexican food. Compares to my favorites in SoCal anyday!

C6vbeR_CGcySLByxE9PlLw.text: This place is great! It may look like just an ordinary "Robertos" type mexican restaurant, but it's far from that. The food is awesome, it actually tastes like it's homemade and made with love. It also had an authentic mexican feel to it, like it was made from family recipes.  Phrank or Frank however he spells his name, is a character. While there he had a Snoop Dogg reference for almost everything on the menu. Like, "This burrito is off the hizzle." So any man that can quote a rapper and make delicious food is good in my book.  I had the nachos, because Phrank told me they were "bomb!" So I had to go with that. I was kinda hesitant because I'm not a big fan of chili verde sauce, only liking it from a few places. The nacho chips we re slathered with this delicious green sauce and topped with cheese. Phrank was right...they were bomb! My girlfriend had the special of the day which were the fish tacos. She's had her share of fish tacos and she admitted that these were the best she's ever had. The fish was crispy, the cabbage had texture and the cream sauce they put over it was outstanding. Even the beans and rice it came with didn't have that "straight out of the can" taste to it. Phrank also gave us a sample of the ceviche he makes, and it was great. A lot like lomi salmon at some hawaiian restaurants. It had a strong lemon taste, but you could still taste every single ingredient in the dish. It was top notch.  Like their quote says, "Not The Best, Just None Better," This place is one of the best "Strip Mall Mexican Restaurants" I've been to. I'm glad I live so close, there were a lot of things I wanted to try.

tuH4CDgjRce_E3BUkbX8PQ.text: So Phat Phrank's new hours are 7am - 7pm M-F, 10-3 on Saturdays, closed on Sunday. But the best news of all is that breakfast items are available all day (at least on Saturday!). So I finally got a chance to try it! And I can testify that Phrank is a VERY nice guy, the food is stellar, and the service was extremely friendly. Sometimes food is so good, I actually laugh out loud, and I can say my chourico breakfast burrito today made me do just that. What an enjoyable experience! This place is busiest during the weekdays, so check it out after 4pm during the week, or anytime Saturday, and I hope you love it as much as I do.

Qkzfb7fcG6xouXSiv2EFgw.text: First time here. Really great food at very wallet friendly prices. The whole family loves the food. Carne asada wet burrito. Adobada wet burrito and a two taco plate with rice and beans with three cokes. Under $30 and very delicious and home made. Pretty rock star.

5EdcZBNjHmSiruaYCGGFYQ.text: The food was decent but nothing was amazing. I have had better versions of all the items I've tried but the prices are decent and the service was good. I'd come back to give them another shot.

rSiuaQKZrCq9p9plBxmK0A.text: After reading the reviews I had to try this place. I'm glad I did, everything we ordered  was full of flavor, the fish taco, the Cotota sandwich, chili verde plate and Adobado torta. I'm looking forward to eating there again. I also had the chance to talk to "Phrank", super cool dude.

2uzGSlmCNjhVwbmnUMfbrQ.text: This was an upscale version of a taco shop. For the most part same taco shop fare but higher prices and more adjectives in their menu, such as, "flawless" and "delectable".  The owner took our order. I asked him what he recommended and he said people like the fish taco and the tortas. I then asked him what his favorite was and he replied "I like them all it is like picking a favorite granchild" to which I said "but everyone has a favorite." He eventually told me until the article last week (which I have no idea of) barbacoa was the most popular. So I tried the two taco plate, one fish and one barbacoa.  The barbacoa was a little dry and not a lot of flavor, also the portion of barbacoa for the price in the taco was pretty small.  The fish taco was pretty good, fried cod I think, it was a pretty big piece of fish and it was fried well, a little greasy, but crispy. The plate also came with a small portion of rice and beans.  I got the hot salsa - owner said not as hot as habaneros, but it still had a pretty good kick.  Also, a medium Jamaica drink (free refills) - I paid a little under $12 - which I think is expensive for a taco shop.  The food came on paper plates, which I would expect, but again for the price it seems like you should get more.  It just didn't seem that authentic - but I am more of a Tacos El Gordo type of girl personally.

ZjweZ9fU3t73ERRxu1JE5A.text: I hadn't been to Phranks in a long time. I am so glad I came back. I love that they make everything from scratch. Amazing salsa, and the best torta you have ever put in your torta whole. I can't say enough about the torta (an award winner I believe). Good size, love the slaw...you have to try it.

uUqcKmOARyfdwN2gizEjPA.text: Ordered one fish taco, the adobado torta, and the wet green carne asada burrito with a side of the ceviche and everything was delicious. It was our first time and we felt welcomed and well served! Will be retiring for more delicious food and recommending it to friends  thank you for a great experience

AhxV5oOo9El_e_Nkh3YlFQ.text: Ok the food is amazing i cant deny that, but for me i am all about customer service, as we walked in the 2 employees were sitting down,they looked at us and did not greet us their facial expressions said it all  ,the other fat ass got up huffing an puffing to the kitchen,  we ordered 2 drinks ,they got the drinks wrong  ,we were the only customers in there both burritos were good but  like i said the employees are rude ,no manager present avoid this place until they get new employees

8OAm5pV5T9DuDiwUj-CyfA.text: I'm so glad I saw this place on yelp! We stopped in for a quick lunch and it was excellent. Very welcoming environment, and great customer service. The food was top-notch. I absolutely love places like this. I might just have to move to this side of town so I can come here at least once a week! Haha

Q4KutGRC563rlmTpJ7ukZw.text: I've never had cabbage  in a taco Asada before but welp that's what they do here .... not quite sure what this restaurant is attempting to go for... I ordered 3 tacos and paid 13.00 for them (I did ask for cream on top so I guess that's where the up charge came from) anyways I ended up doing a pick up order. When I got home to try the food I was surprised to see cabbage in my tacos... Cabbage ladies and gents... I never thought I would have to mention "by the way dont put cabbage in my steak tacos"...... but I guess you have to do that with this restaurant... anyways I ended up just picking the cabbage off... the steak wasnt as good as I thought it would be ....a weird seasoning was used.... pretty much expensive tacos for nothing... and also the fact that I paid basically 3 dollars a taco .... I paid 6 and change for 4 tacos at Tony's Tacos on Fort Apache by far the best tacos on the west side smh and it doesn't come with cabbage (the way it's suppose to be)  FYI the only tacos that should come with cabbage are fish tacos and specifically finely shredded cabbage not obnoxious chunks that were in my asada burrito... most def don't know what all the hype was about, were y'all really being serious about these reviews.. I trust yelp for everywhere I go in this town cuz I'm still somewhat new here and I was failed by my fellow yelpers.

9IWj6RfaJR91y1KZ9bS8kw.text: Best. Damn. Breakfast. Burrito!   Just 10 minutes off The Vegas Strip, this family-run gem is hidden in a strip mall off Decatur & Sunset behind an ARCO gas station. In my opinion, it should be front and center, with marquee arrows pointing to their location flashing, "EAT HERE!" "EAT HERE!"  Location: Quaint dining room with 2- and 4-person seating. Love the jazz motif...! A little unexpected for a Mexican joint, but tastefully exhibits Frank's love and respect for jazz music. (Something I can appreciate as a classically trained, former pianist.) A great spot for a quick bite. Considering my sweetie and I came after the lunch rush (around 2pm), the restaurant had a steady flow of patrons for the 45 minutes we were there. Oh, and the restroom was clean. I don't like to eat anywhere if the restroom isn't up to par.  Food: I only tried one item on the menu because I wanted a breakfast burrito (at 2pm) and it was the BEST DAMN BREAKFAST BURRITO I've eaten in a long time! #1) Phrank's serves breakfast all day. One star is specifically for that - being mindful to us all-day breakfast lovers. #2) No frills: My burrito came out piping hot in a deliciously fresh tortilla with scrambled eggs, melty cheese, extra crispy bacon, & potatoes... and not filler potatoes, like some restaurants tend to do, where hash makes up 3/4 of the burrito... these were thinly sliced chips - just enough. #3) My sweetie had a carne asada taco. He said it was nicely seasoned, great flavors, and he loved their salsa. #4) Horchata. Order it. 'Nuff said.   People: From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with a smile. The woman behind the counter was friendly and helpful! (I'm sad not to have asked her name.) As we were preparing to leave, we were asked by a man if we enjoyed our food. Of course, I let him know... "I'm going to Yelp about this being one of the best damn burritos I've ever eaten!" The man happened to be Frank himself and we stopped to chat with him for a while about the food, his restaurant, and exchanged names of a few jazz artists we enjoyed. It was a delight to meet him and exchange pleasantries with the table of friends and family from which he stood.    Right before we left, the woman behind the counter thoughtfully offered to refill my Horchata since we were hitting the road back to CA (uh... yes, please!), and Frank and his family wished us safe travels.  Long story short: The breakfast burrito is enough to bring me back on our next visit to Vegas (and write this super-long review). The service and the people make me dream we lived closer. ;-)

WOr6b53R8TghH33p1gvOUQ.text: Nothing special really. It was good, but I guess I'm a meat snob. The Adobada is not traditional and almost looks like Machaca, and the Barbacoa has no sweetness to it and is slightly on the dry side. BUMMER.

O9VZR_igFHfxIFcnJMd1qQ.text: This place is legit.  Not to be compared in any way with a Robertos other than interior seating style, Frank serves up an amazing variety of tasty Mexican eats.   Frank can often be seen working in the restaurant. You'll know him by his big smile and warm demeanor. It's clear he opened this restaurant because he loves to feed people with the delicious meals he provides - he'll often make quick rounds through the tables with a "thumbs up?" look, making sure you're happy with his eats.   My favorite - Adobada Torta. Thin, soft bread (almost like a Mexican style pita bread), warmed to a nice crisp on the flattop. Crispy and flavorful Adobada pork is generously added with a fresh, cooling slaw. A nice combination of crunch, fat, heat, salt, and fresh. A good sized meal even for big-eaters, this is my "go to" at less than $8.  Zero complaints about this place. I'd love to see him open up a spot with more tables and a "dinner" atmosphere, but until then, this is the lunch spot you can't miss.

zMwoFwV9NW7Qgm1LVw186Q.text: There's only one word I can think of when it comes to Phat Phrank's. AMAZING.  I could leave it as that and have you all wonder or I can let you all know why it's so AMAZING.  I've had their fish taco plate, other than the beans and rice sides the fish tacos were AMAZING. By far the best fish tacos I've had anywhere.  The fish were large crispy on the outside tender on the inside pieces, light and not greasy. The combination of all the fish with cabbage, green onion, cilantro, tartar sauce, and in my case lime and their hot sauce was AMAZING. My mouth is watering as I reminisce. I'll be back for you fish tacos.  Their carne asada torta was...  Oops sorry for the drool.  Their Carne asada torta was very delicious too. Well I might have reached my quota for using the word amazing but don't worry the carne asada tortas are equally as amazing as the fish tacos. I've seen other tortas that are bulky, bready, and just look good because of the huge size not flavor. Size isn't gigantic and not bready, so every bite was just of everything I wanted, something very tasty. There's probably even more ingredients than bread. I'll be back for you too LOL.  I didn't have this but a friend had their enchiladas because it was mentioned in the lvrj as Phat Phrank's signature dish. Now that looked like meal right there. I'm sure it has to be really good too just from what I've already had.  Plus it had a fried egg on it.  Anytime you throw a fried egg on anything it's instantly good.  Location is perfect for me, I'm always in the area though honestly I never knew they were there until a UYE.   I like the musical instrument on the walls and how it's clean. Seats maybe 20-30 people.  Service was very good, friendly. Phrank and the lady that was there often checked on us, refilling drinks, bring food out quickly, conversing with us and making it an experience not like here is your food and now get out when your done. lol.   They no longer have raspberry ice tea.   Can't wait to go there tomorrow. Wait their not open on the weekends!? This has to be a typo and they close at 6 PM. MAN I can't win.  All good, fresh and delicious food need a break too. AMAZING.

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish taco plate

Vv6QyOpk3lseVw-t-zdw6A.text: Don't get it. At all. Came at 11:30 and the service was very slow. The cashier seemed lost and couldn't tell us what toppings came on the tacos. It seemed like she kept messing up the tickets to the kitchen because they had to keep asking her about the orders. Sure enough, I was supposed to get a carnitas, a carne asada and a barbacoa taco. Pretty sure I got 2 carne asadas and one chicken. Lovely. Didn't want to complain because it would probably take forever to correct it. The tacos are large and the meat portion was more than fair. The taste was... eh. Didn't hate it, didn't love it. Coworker felt the same way about his order, the torta. Next time the Mexican craving hits, it'll be back to my old faithful, el dorado cantina.

judF8Y23LCbznJQKJoRw1g.text: Four star food and a bonus star for the excellent customer service!  I have wanted to try this place for ages. It's always hard to get off work in time to get here before they close at 6. Finally, I made it out of work in time to stop by for some food.   I came in and was greeted by the very friendly owner. He took my order and made some idle chit chat and then went back to cook up my grub. I tried the chicken taco and breakfast burrito with bacon and also took a small bite from my fella's carnitas torta. The chicken in the taco was incredibly moist and filled with lots of cabbage, onion and cilantro. I'm a big fan of all the fresh veggies that are included. Even better with the flavorful and spicy chile. The breakfast burrito was perfectly sized and every bite had the perfect amount of egg, bacon, potato and cheese in every bite. So great when I added the green chile or spicy red on top. The torta was great too. I would probably ask for no mayo if I was ordering for myself, but that's just a personal preference. The meat was really juicy and flavorful.    Phrank was very friendly and chit chatted with me before during and after our transaction was over. Such a great customer service experience and the food is good and cheap to boot. What more can a girl ask for. Looking forward to making this a regular spot on my food rotation.

4ZKVQsW5iA3QDNfLjL6C-A.text: First time here. Had he adobada torta and it is perfectly flavorful. The secret sauce is delicious. The meat is perfectly crispy and the bread is thin and crispy enough to add to the flavor explosion. Super friendly too.

pb6AhQgJfz28HhZu_fmdYw.text: So amazing! My boyfriend and I were craving a good breakfast burrito. We are pretty picky about our breakfast burritos but the reviews were good and prices looked decent so we figured we would try this place.   We both got the carne asada breakfast burrito add guacamole. The burrito was a perfect size. And the portions of meat, potato cheese and guacamole was perfect. The potatoes are a little crunchy which I loved!  They have a good variety of different burritos. I can't wait to come back here and try something different.   The service was amazing. The staff was funny and energetic. It looks like a place where u order then they call your number and you get up and grab your meal but we sat down and they brought our food to us. 3 different staff members asked how we were and wanted to make sure we had everything we needed. The owner was working and out talking to everyone. Making everyone feel welcome and comfortable. He came over and made sure we got refills before we left. Honestly all around this place was great! Such a good spot to go to before your own the road or if you don't want to spend too much money but want a good meal. It's very casual so if your looking for something fancy this isn't the place for you. SO GOOD!!

Definitely worth the stop and we'll for sure swing by again when we come back to Vegas.

q6eDrU515pL32M-XUNo-YQ.text: Despite the friendly welcome, the food was very fat,the tortilla was swimming in the oil, and the presentation (plastic plates) terrible. I'm sorry but we did not enjoy at all.

DtNW8BcJAqY6CkE1TXiAQA.text: I give the food quality 4 stars but that is about it. I have been to this restaurant 4 times and the wait times for food, whether there are 3 or 20 patrons, continue to grow.  Today I waited 24 minutes for food. 8SFimH0-JZVclijVRAud9Q.text: The food was very fresh and delicious.  The girl taking our order was very kind.  We wanted either carnitas or adobado, but since neither was available, she comped our chips.  We were happy to find Phat Phrank's!

pXQ5XYde6uZ-qpFe92kglQ.text: Excellent Burrito. Top notch. The owner was very friendly and the place was clean. I have been a few times, but wanted to say something good in a city full of bad Mexican food. Will come back when I am in the area.

zJ4r9a3YxM7TIU5BXYvyHg.text: Stopped by on my lunch break, I've been looking for a good fish taco place for awhile now so I was hopeful this would be it. Ordered a fish taco and a chicken taco. The fish taco was ok, nothing exciting just your run of the mill fish taco. Lots of lettuce and no tomatoes in the pico de gallo and only 1 tortilla (most restaurants serve them with two). At over $4 for a single taco (no beans or rice or even tortilla chips) I thought it was pretty overpriced. The chicken taco was pretty boring, again no pico de gallo and tons of lettuce. The shredded chicken was lacking flavor so I piled on the salsa. Breakfast looked more reasonably priced and seems to have good reviews so I'll probably give it a try one day. Kinda disappointed!

_53NR3_sdaI8IpzpYhz2gw.text: Great food, period!.. The owner and staff are beyond nice.... good selection and very authentic, not greasy like Roberto's. Carne Asada fries are beyond good!!!  Will definitely be a regular for me.

Qq6dfGkzcyQLvrctSfv4KQ.text: This place was tasty but in no way remarkable. The food is perfectly adequate in flavor and portion but doesn't stand out as a 'must eat'.  The service was friendly and quick. If I'm looking for a cheap fast meal I'll take Phat Phranks over fast food or Roberto's any day. The only negative was the horchata was bland and tasted like it was a mix.

nct9Ajch2fiVk6uGUFcxQA.text: This place is over rated. This is not authentic at all. Very small portions and bland. The bathroom was our I'd seat covers. No salsa bar. Tapito the tables. Over priced.

zQWLf_FLazOYXuRj0VZFTQ.text: Waited 30 minutes for 1 takeout order. The taquitos were burnt. The person ringing up had to write down orders with paper and pen, with lunch rush line to the door. Food was nothing exciting. Average at best, but that's the norm for Vegas Mexican food. Guacamole was good, everything else average. Also, they're grade is a C which I rarely see. I wouldn't have gone there knowing that.

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt. Nothing special.

jQUMfk0gqXQjJg5I4c4y8A.text: I was finally able to try Phat Phrank's after much word of mouth. They close at 6 and don't open at all on weekends, so it was never on my radar. But I can see myself picking up dinner from here now that it's on my way home from work. If yelp allowed half stars I'd give 4.5.  I had carne asada and adobada tacos. They were both served in corn tortillas that held up well to the filling of meat, cabbage, onion, cilantro and scallion. The hot salsa might be hot to other people, it has a rich, smoky flavor beyond the heat.  The rice and beans grew on me, especially with a little salsa added. Both of them are fairly simple preparations.  Flavors overall are very clean. Their adobada is fried to a crisp and adds just enough savory goodness. The carne asada feels a little greasy at first bite but is melt in your mouth good by bite three.  Frank is a gracious, smiling host whose passion is apparent in the very first impression. He clearly takes pride in his work and enjoys serving his guests.  I'll be back, and if the rest of the menu is as good as those first two tacos, I may bump them up to 5 stars.

YMpf9Dk2wkJbQyKIRv9nig.text: I've been reading about Phat Phrank's in several local newspapers and magazines and finally decided to give it a try. It's in a small strip mall off Decatur and the 215, down the street from Rhythm Kitchen and owned by a Cali transplant named (you guessed it...) Frank. While they do have some traditional Mexican dishes, this restaurant isn't your typical 'authentic' taco shop. It's a more modern take on Mexican/Southern Cali food.  Their tacos are a little larger than some street tacos elsewhere, using 6-inch tortillas instead of the 4-inch ones. The two tacos I had (carne asada and adobada) came with a good sized portion of steak and pork, respectively, with a little cabbage and cilantro on top, with your choice of 4 salsas on the side. While the carne asada taco wasn't the best I've had, it was still very good and the adobada was so tender, but crispy around the edges and packed with intense flavors.  And the churros... mmmmm... the churros. They are reason enough to stop by Phat Phrank's. Four of them stacked on a plate and drizzled with caramel, chocolate and vanilla. Big enough to share, but I refuse to.  The customer service here is second to none, with the staff bringing your food out when it's ready and Frank walking around chatting up all the patrons and checking to make sure everything's ok. He even brought out a sample of his ceviche for me to try. Tomatoes, cilantro, onions, and chopped fish cooked in citrus juices. It also had a good bit of heat to it.  They also have a breakfast menu (which I haven't tried) with breakfast burritos, huevos rancheros, and spam+chile, among other things.

m7JHwgtP_qakBQvYTcYH8g.text: It is an amazing place. The food is incredibly delicious and the staff is so very friendly. the only downfall to phat franks is that its In Vegas and I'm Cali :-)  I won't visit Vegas without coming here love love love it.. We specifically travel to Vegas around the times this place is open. The Tortas and Fish tacos are absolutely amazing, as well as, all the other menu items. You can't go wrong, the owner is a wonderful person and the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. Looking forward to are next visit...

CrDnyqvoKD8wEhFK1yzMLA.text: I've been here four times and it's always great.  Very friendly service, fresh ingredients, great salsas.  Fish tacos are some of the best you'll find at a taco shop.

rQdqObvyeaEYuWiNmjI44Q.text: Best kept secret in Vegas that needs to be let out of the bag for everyone to experience! Their torta's are off the hook and like none other. "Phrank" and his family are down to earth good people that actually appreciate each and everyone of their customers. What a breath of fresh air to have that from any business these days. Go there, get something to eat, you will not be disappointed.

dgcAqBBInK5ecntxEDsPIA.text: I'm not sure why this place has so many great reviews. The food was edible. That's about it. Nothing stood out. Personally, I think I could get a more authentic fish taco at Rubio's and a better tasting carnitas burrito at Chipotle--and at 1/2 the price. There wasn't enough flavor or spice or anything, really. Was asked what kind of salsa do I want? Um, I don't know, how about all of them? How do I know which one is best if I can't try them all? Total turn off. My burrito was dry and I didn't like having to beg for more soda. For God's sake invest in a salsa bar & let people get their own soda! One more tip: don't run out of utensils. Especially when customers don't appear to be lining up. When business is that slow, you shouldn't really run out of anything or make your guests wait while you restock the forks.

GruxeTSoZ-ajk_I6Wr484w.text: Like many others, I gave this place a try based on the overwhelming amount of great yelp reviews.  Maybe my expectations were too high.  Ended up spending $8.37 on a standard bacon breakfast burrito.  Not sure if I was charged extra for my cup of water or for the 2 little salsa containers.  Customer service wasn't super welcoming.  It seemed like there were a bunch of regulars there at the time so the lady seemed very attentive to them.  Took a little while for the food to come out and in the end I can't say the burrito knocked my socks off.  It was decent at best.  Originally, I gave this review 2 stars but I would probably give this place a chance for redemption - with their lunch menu!

pBOdW6QF-6lov88cFONS2w.text: When in Vegas...  Looking for a legit Mexican food spot?! Phat Phrank's is the REAL DEAL. Believe the hype, it's real. Phat Phrank's was found (luckily) on our Yelp app by searching "breakfast burritos" - imagine two people from Hawaii (where we have zero legit Mexican options) who just got off the airplane at 7am. My hubby is from Cali and misses good Mexican food on the daily. So, of course, I'm not going to say "no" to breakfast burritos. And a five-star worthy breakfast burrito?! C'mon, #feedthehubby  When we pulled in, there were zero cars in the lot and zero customers. Not gonna lie, I was suspect. But, trust #YelpNation to get it right. Jacob greeted us with a smile and recommended basically ALL of the breakfast burrito meat choices. My hubby and I both decided on carne asada breakfast burritos. Winners!!!! They were tasty, not greasy, fat, and I am totally in love with the thin fried potato - my mouth is now watering, just great. Jacob also gave us all the salsas to try and they were all super tasty. He was super friendly and made our meal at Phat Phrank's that much more enjoyable. To top everything off, we got a holy yumminess of 32oz Horchata #happybellies  This place is a serious gem and I wish we could have stopped by for lunch or dinner. But, there's no doubt, Phat Phrank's is in our rotation from now on "When in Vegas..."

a_Qd8XQGS1oVRRULUJmXwQ.text: Grabbed a Chile Verde burrito here today. It was really good and the customer service was excellent. Cool, casual lunch spot--breakfast burritos are also very good.

Jt68o9Gunpz74CC6xbxxsw.text: First class from the hello to the meal and always with a great good bye.Frank and his family are just a great team with awesome food have ordered so many items and each one spot on authentic great food.If your in the area or even a drive away you will appreciate the food and service at Phat Phrank's period.

JBMVh65Tn21N4oprckgmig.text: The only thing bad about my experience here is that I found it the day before I'm leaving. My wife got the chili verde burrito and I got the carnita torta and both were amazing. We live in Hawaii and unfortunately the Mexican food there is horrible for the most part. My wife is from Arizona so she has been feening for some good Mexican. We found this place on yelp and drove out the day before. I've never had a torta before and almost ordered the carne Asada fries but while talking with Phrank he explained to me what they were and let me swap my order. Maybe the Carne asada fried would have been better, I don't know but I love the carnita torta and next time I'm in Vegas will be getting it again.   Also me and my wife talked a little with Phrank and he is a pretty awesome guy. Just sayin. We were actually in a pretty bad mood coming in here but Phrank is one of those just warm people to talk to. We only talked with him for maybe 5 mins but he put us in a better mood and that torta from heaven put me in an even better one. Thankfully my work brings me to Vegas (well not really thankfully) a lot so I'll def be back

_Q7DjCkULoLOFScyYjlEtQ.text: Best breakfast burritos in Las Vegas.  Yeah I said it.  They have ruined me.  I used to be able to get breakfast burritos other places and enjoy them.  Not anymore.  No more Roberto's drive thru for this girl.  When the craving hits I have to drive across town to Phranks.  The breakfast burritos are about the same size as other places but whats inside is a whole other level.  The eggs are cooked to order and not over cooked.  No rubber eggs here.  The potatoes are sliced thin and seasoned.  I think the potatoes are what really sets it apart for me.  They are so good.  I usually don't get meat in mine but have hubby gets bacon or carne asada and gives it 2 thumbs up.  Ask for green sauce.  It is spicy, garlicky goodness.  They need to bottle it.    I've had lunch a few times.  Fish taco plate and Phat Phranks Nachos are my go to items.  Both are good.  I love the chili verde on the nachos.  I wish they put more on the nachos than just cheese and chili verde.  A super nacho with that verde sauce would be amazing.  I'm sure I could add on if I asked.  I'll have to try that next time.

UJRycRpkpTsFXO6QBUwFFw.text: They have the worst  customer service my job is in walking distance and I  refuse to return... Staff needs to be fired

j7bngJkNShaFBJxc1gBhuQ.text: Well damn, that was the best adobada torta I've had in a while.  Was greeted by Phat Phrank himself.. Good guy. The torta has so much flavor my taste buds went wack.. or maybe it was the delicious red salsa that comes with it.  Either way, spicy was the way to go.

6O9lW1Hs52vOhUGM0XfvRw.text: This is a tasty Mexican hole in the wall.  The green chilly burrito was very tasty.  I requested it wet which meant it had more Chilly on top.  The food tastes fresh and the meats were all well marinated and prepared.

6EwQzSUZ6RXQI8PsJ5Cb5Q.text: Had a lunch with my wife. She had a torta which she liked. I had a chicken taco and enchiladas plate. Fast food quality but restaurant prices.

jUJ2_Eh2Bl72h1ejtIUkkQ.text: I ABSOLUTELY LOVED VISITING PHAT PHRANKS!!!  I went during lunch last week, and had such a great experience here.  The woman at the counter was extremely friendly, helpful, and patient answering my questions and offering suggestions.  There was no one in line behind me, so I felt I had plenty of time to look the menu over and ask questions, etc.  I got the famous Adobada torta-  the seasoning on the pork was spot on and a huge plus for me was not having any fatty pieces of meat in my sandwich because I really hate that when I am eating any type of food.  I told my friend that the torta was one of the best food items I have ever had.  The sandwich is big and will definitely fill you up- lots of pork no doubt.  Not like other places where they fill your torta with all lettuce and you have to search for the remaining ingredients.  The torta also has a cilantro sauce and the bread is toasted!!  We also tried the fish tacos-  these were good too, but they did not compare to the torta.  Nothing that really stuck out for me on the fish tacos, but I have absolutely no complaints either.  Large fried pieces of white fish on a tortilla with cabbage.  I equally loved the chips and guacamole-- homemade chip (bonus) and a very nice serving size of guacamole at a very reasonable price.  The flavor of the guacamole was delicious- smooth and a lovely creamy guacamole taste.  Can't go wrong! I think people complain about the chips because they are more all natural rather than loaded or over salted.  I see no problem at all with that.  Have an open mind and try something new!  On my way back to the airport Sunday, all I could think about was Phat Phranks and how I wanted to have another torta. Sadly, they are closed on Sundays.  Can you send me one or two or five please!?!?!?  I have nothing but an Adobada torta on my mind.   You can bet I will be back next time I am in Vegas- there is no doubt about that.

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $5.99 Chips and guac, homemade unsalted chips.  Nice size serving of guac

SZ2kdsqCuiyR0SpS6Er20A.text: I searched yelp for somewhere to get a bean burrito, and I was impressed by this place's rating. The burrito ended up being about as lackluster as the surroundings (in a strip mall right behind a gas station). I got the bean, rice, and cheese burrito with fresh jalapenos and green salsa added. I probably should have added lettuce and sour cream to make it a little more interesting, but at more than $7, the price was already pretty steep for such a basic meal. I was also disappointed that they were out of guacamole.

8P0X4C5-p_cCQ9nAqJE2lw.text: We came to phat phranks for some Mexican food, more like a 3.5 star restaurant. We ordered the huevos rancheros, breakfast burrito and some flautas. The huevos rancheros came with either red or green sauce, I picked green because it has pork in the sauce. The dish was really greasy for my taste, the beans, eggs and the fried chips were swimming in grease. It wasn't a traditional huevos rancheros. The fried potatoes were delicious And the dish was okay, just too greasy. The flautas were crispy and tasty with fresh guacamole. The service was good.  I had to give it 3.5 stars due to the greasy meal and also, we were charged for tap water. I'm not sure if that is a Vegas thing, but it was a bit unusual for me to see that.

BD_OT3plicUa_uX7ZnmfEQ.text: Their food is extremely good very authentic and super friendly! It gets very busy so anticipate a wait time but definitely worth the wait!

iOeXHCtkWLfrr4v4iL2u-g.text: Came here for lunch today to try out this new Mexican restaurant.  A few nuisances annoyed me, but otherwise a very good place for lunch during the day.  When I first arrived, I noticed immediately no visible menu or pictures of the food to decide what I would be eating.  Instead, I'm greeted with a room of musical instruments on display and a small laminated menu of foods.  On the menu, again no visible photos to see what id be ordering.  If people were in line behind me, I'd feel almost pressured to make an unjust decision.  For this reason mainly I deducted one star in my review.  Items Ordered:  Two Fish Tacos Combination Plate $9.99  The fish tacos with there highly recommended secret sauce reminded me instantly of Rubio's.  Same great taste I've become very fond of and the rice / beans made just like grandma use to do when I was a kid.  Very authentic Mexican flavors and definitely left a lasting impression.  I would come back again, but the invisible menu and having to rely on staff for refills really turned me off.  Very awkward way of business to treat a Mexican food joint almost like a deli.  That's my two cents, but excellent food!

-zexCxqjl6zkygS_UiJFJg.text: I went to lunch with some coworkers. We weren't sure about this place since it was new. Wow! We were pleasantly surprised. I had the Chile Verde burrito and it was yummy. It had just enough spice to it. It came enchilada style with the Chile Verde sauce (just how I like it). They have 3 salsas (mild, med, hot). The hot is pretty hot just like it should be.  I highly recommend this place. But go early. We got there at 11:30 and our food came really fast. We were leaving at 12:15 and the line was out the door.

sn0SFVOvvYGLojR9VOwlFw.text: The Verde Pozole was good.... Good food good people I recommend this place all day!! Carne Asada Tacos are good also everything is that I have had here. GO CHECK IT OUT...

ZT2UTY2hJe3Xk7bqKhVzBg.text: I'm giving this one star because zero stars isn't an option.  We came here because the yelp reviews seemed decent.... The lady taking our order was a bit rude but we were still polite. We both ordered a chicken breakfast burrito, a Coffee and a water, about $20 total. These burritos consisted of store bought rotisserie chicken, potato chips from a bag and dry scrambled eggs in a tortilla, served on a paper plate with two packets of terrible green salsa. The coffee was just as bad and only they had powdered creamer. They also charged for a cup of water without mentioning they charge for it. This was our last meal leaving vagas before the long drive back to our state.....we're never coming back to Phat Phranks.

QapTNknPk3_Ss6e9dHmk-g.text: Very tasty.  Got the Chips and Guacamole and the chips are incredible.  Made in house, hot and crunchy. HIet0_Lx-4025gnlpLYZZQ.text: This. Place. Is. Fantastic.  I only order the torta that I'd pictured on the wall next to the register. Just order it. I've brought friends and family here to try this sandwich and everyone loves it. The salty meat mixed with creamy avocado sauce on that delicious and addicting bread is just amazing. Writing this reviews makes me want to get one now. My only complaint is that I wish they were open later so I could eat here more often!! Can't say enough great things about that sandwich. It's the best!!

SIv44wm5CMUJQ-_GnwEMaw.text: I ordered a chorizo breakfast burrito and fish taco, my coworker had 4 carne asada tacos, and my other coworker had a barbacoa beef plate. The fish taco was great. But at over $4, quite pricey. The chorizo breakfast burrito was ok. Light on the chorizo in my opinion. There's no salsa bar nor did my waitress give me any type of salsa/hot sauce with my meal. Actually no one asked if I wanted green or red or anything. My coworker got some red sauce brought out with his tacos. He said his tacos were ok, but nothing special. My coworker that ordered the barbacoa beef said he would have rather eaten at qdoba. So that says a lot about his meal. Given the reviews, I expected a lot more from this place. If you're charging $3 a taco, it better be a pretty damn good taco. In my opinion, taco y taco is much better.

qDVAqX9fk0XWtqTF-ThaPQ.text: The fish tacos were bomb! Decently priced and great service. Would definitely come again

TUUV5SMF93f-9GlHpORn7g.text: Family owned, clean and friendly, avoid the usual chains and have some quality Mexican, just had the best breakfast burrito, very tasty!

0Rr2KzIDavf7YgD-IlBlWw.text: First time eating here. Won't be the last. Came in with my lady. Ordered carne asada fries, adobada burrito, barbacoa tacos and cheesecake chimis.  Asada fries were good, nothing that sets it apart from other asada fries.  Adobada burrito was the best pork I've had at a Mexican restaurant within this price range.  Barbacoa tacos were exceptional, well flavored and fresh veggies.  Cheesecake chimis were the bomb. Ate mine in 2 bites.  This is one of the best Mexican restaurants at its price range. I will be coming here again for sure.  Owner is super nice too.

je8aWgV7hw1fusE8m9y-QA.text: Below average vibe, cheap feeling inside, sub-par enchiladas and cashier lady was totally rude. The price wasn't cheap enough as the other, therefore I have to say I'll definitely never return. It's unfortunate, but it is what it is.

o10HReWs2jvDv_FOmNH-6g.text: I pass this place on the way to work and wanted to give it a try. I walked in to a small crowded room with no seating available. With no one at the counter I looked over the menu. I went with the special, a Carne asada torta with fries and a drink for just over $10 with tax. With a few people behind me I stood by the door to be out of the way. I wasn't given a number so I waited until a girl who was walking around finally came to me and asked what I ordered. The food was ok but not that outstanding. Not planning a return anytime soon.

L82JaL2tzJAlC4LRnapzDQ.text: I just moved to Vegas from NY - was looking for some good local food. I could tell by the outside that it was probably a very good locals spot for Mexican food so I went in and ordered the torta and it was amazing. The owner is super nice and welcoming - definitely makes you want to come back

9xSfQZBImtPA03dzNf41tQ.text: I rarely leave reviews on Yelp but this particular experience was too noteworthy not to share.  I ordered a breakfast burrito with 2 meats, chips and salsa and rice.  When I arrived I was told my bill was $16 which seemed much higher than the prices advertised on their online menu which Yelp redirects you to when choosing  menu.  When I started questioning the prices the server said I was wrong and gave me a printed out menu.  I told her these prices do not match what is online.  She shrugged.  I took out my phone and told her she charged me $2.00 for rice add-on when the menu states $0.75 and her excuse was they charge double when it is ordered as a side as opposed to adding on to an entree.  There is no mention of this deceptive practice on either menu (online or printed out).  Furthermore the price of the breakfast burrito is listed as $5.99 and I was charged $7.99.  When I showed her this, she said, "Oh we are locked out and cannot change that menu any more."  I said these are significant discrepencies of over $3.00 for what should have been a $12-13 meal.  Her response, "You don't have to come back."  I asked who the manager is and the heavy set blonde responded said she was, I told her she needs to fix her business since this is unacceptable.  Her attitude was disgusting from a customer service perspective, first telling me I was wrong on the pricing and then making an excuse that they can no longer modify the menu as if that was my problem.  GUESS WHAT?  If your menu is out of date and you can't modify it any more for failure to pay your bills, you go to Yelp and you list your menu with all of its deceptive caveats online so that you don't piss off future customers before you tell them they "don't have to come back!"

pIYzXkajD2hoNAcQOW4R5Q.text: When you pull in Phat Phranks you notice it's rather unassuming.  There are 10 tables in the joint and a lot of locals come here for lunch and also for take out. Always a good sign.   They serve breakfast all day so my girlfriend went with huevos rancheros divorciados.   Green sauce and red sauce make them just that.  The salsa Verde has some good latent heat. The eggs are very flavorful.    I ordered a fish taco and the special sauce is fabulous.  The cod was fresh and tasty with a very good portion.  Plenty of tasty cabbage and a must order.   Not to be missed are the Carne Asada fries.  THE BEST I HAVE EVER HAD.  Extremely flavorful and artfully created they are a must order.   This place is a family joint so expect to see Phat Phrank coming over to make sure everything is perfect.  Definitely worth the trip.

mRZmSztBrbIXLinWEGJNOQ.text: I have literally never been to a better fast-casual Mexican place. While I do love local favorites Fausto's and Roberto's, this place takes the cake. Everything I have tried on the menu is amazing (I especially love the wet burritos and the fish tacos).   I usually visit for lunch and the owner is always working the register - when it's not super slammed, he'll come by your table to talk to you about the food. Real, genuine friendliness - something not easy to find in this town.   Looking for good mexican food, or just good food, come here. You won't be disappointed!

D6ouTdq1hQtcpn_umBBZRA.text: Speaking "frankly" (I seriously couldn't resist,) this place is good but not great. Pros: Owner is cool, totally locally/family owned, food is fresh and tasty and prepared to order. I didn't love the portions for the price (I'm fine to pay more for good food, but usually expect to get filled up at a Mexican place for $6-7 (Cafe Rio, Qdoba, Chipotle...) and this place didn't quite deliver. Food is tasty and healthy, though, so in a pinch I might be back (they're just down the street from my office.)

L1yQ5GwR7933MXPAJaZUBw.text: So tasty! I swung by because I was in the area on a weekday and tried the carne asada torta. So good! The menu is really inventive. He offers a chile relleno burrito, which is next on my list to try. Super friendly owner. But it's a bummer this place is only open on weekdays until 6pm (despite what Yelp says, it is no longer open on Saturdays) and is not close to my work. I may have to force roadrunnerfood.com to pick up and deliver for me. I foresee many cravings for this food.

boBT1v98Z6OQZzAd-vkUNQ.text: Somebody slap me! Is this place really this good? This light green "special sauce" has crack in it and I'm hooked. Will gladly make the 30 min drive here on a regular basis. Fish tacos and tortas for days yoooo!

e6omNmRiQz_REZweHQOn7w.text: The food is great however when a walkin customer has to wait over 15 minutes because of call in orders, I will go somewhere else.

b2LZs3wgpkvnFGSy29482g.text: This place was so yummy! My husband had huevos rancheros and I had burrito. The owner is super nice

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy

IZNGKUFQScRERqa18S9qZA.text: We tried this place based on the 4.5 stars, but we were all disappointed.  2 people got plates - carne asada, and chile verde, and 1 got chile relleno plate w fish taco.  The plates were all mediocre, and the relleno had a slightly burned taste, although it wasn't burned.  Made me think it was the oil it was fried in.  The fish taco was very good, and if I were in the area I might stop by for one of those, but that's all.

pS4WOTxBzKvh2a-smW73Ug.text: Came here after hiking Red Rocks and I think we found our new post hike restaurant. Friendly atmosphere and great customer service. I had the combo salad which was spot on delicious and my boyfriend had the asada burrito. Food was really good and not greasy at all. Chicken was super delicious, moist and flavorful. Overall fantastic experience and we will definitely be back the next time we are in town.

WVuCU26Wjx9xG0anKblIJw.text: This a 5 star burrito joint with some seating area...portions are fair(not huge but not tapas)    The chicken burrito really is good, I kno what you are thinking, but Ive been told that so many times, just trust me.   Its made with boiled chicken chunks, not overcooked shredded  chicken left in a sauce all day  over a warmer to over cook some more.  They use a base of tortilla, beans, and cheese.  You pick the meat and adds $, burritos can be served wet(red/green sauce on top)or dry.  The adobada is amazing also, its served a bit crunchy on the ends which makes a flavorfull difference.  Even the bean and cheese burrito is awesome.  Only slight negative, if you order to go, please eat within 10 minutes, or you'll immediately see(oil and fat begins to discolor and soak tortilla) why burritos are so good!!!

ocFeP9QaaaYH3hPFYqC_Vw.text: So we got referred here by a co worker and I'll say this..although Ive only had the fish tacos and barbacoa taco and churros it was really good..their fish taco is on point now I.didn't really enjoy the barbacoa but I'll definitely come back to phat phranks for the fish taco..the owner is also really nice and he recommends to try their breakfast burritos which I love and the huevos rancheros with their chili Verde...I can't wait

-d4sfWIrO-kAMea-xgZZRw.text: My first experience here wasn't bad ... I just thought the food was OK on average. Nothing to special about it. It's pretty much your typical American Mexican joint. From the name, I guess I was just expecting a lot.   Location - located on a strip mall right next to a gas station and other food joints. Corner of Decatur and Sunset.  Atmosphere - the place is small but it's pretty clean and cozy. It was pretty busy when I went during lunch hour.   Food - I'm a nocturnal type of person so I always wake up late. I was craving some type of Mexican breakfast and I came across this place. I had the Chorizo breakfast burrito with a side of Barbacoa taco. Like I mentioned earlier, I thought the food was average. Prices are decent and it's something you'd expect from a place like this. I've had better ones at a local Roberto's ...   Service - no complaints on service. It's the typical order from the counter, pay and they'll being the food to you type of shindig. It was pretty prompt and the lady was quite nice.   Overall, I'd probably give this place another go. Maybe for something quick or maybe to try their famous chocolate drizzled churro. If you're looking for Mexican food or some type of Mex fusion, I'd go somewhere else...

DvJNKTrBJMXf3tnOB9x95Q.text: The chicken torta is soooooo good! I'll definitely be bringing my coworkers and friends here! Very good food and excellent service!

gn9s8GmFHV87kqt8JolXZQ.text: After seeing the chile verde burrito from Phrank's listed in LV Weekly's Top 10 Mexican Meals, I had to try it. I happened to be in the area due to a Yelp event, so I called in a phone order and picked it up.  Shout out to their stellar customer service: the lady who took my phone order was sweet, quick, and efficient. And when I called back for their address, she gave me thorough directions, unsurprised that my GPS was coming up with errors. I really appreciated her help.  I finally got my opportunity to dive into my burrito, and it was enjoyable. The ratio of rice and beans was favorable- I prefer not to have too many in my burrito, if at all, and they were flavorful but light. The majority of the burrito was stuffed with shredded chicken, and there was a good amount of cheese, too.  As for the chile verde component of my order- well, the chicken was flavorful and had a kick to it. But it wasn't noticeably "chile verde", it could have quite easily passed for simply a spicy chicken burrito. This coming from a girl who regularly goes to Albuquerque and knows chile verde very well- I'm even open to interpretations, but this just didn't have the tomatillo-chile kick to it that I was expecting after the rave reviews. That's not to say it was bad, I was quite satisfied with it and felt it was priced well (about $7), but it was not the quintessential chile verde dish I was led to expect.

MWUEhnCeuYZPIjKiDfewdA.text: First off, I'd like to give a shout & say thanks to Misti for the review! Your experiences are very helpful to the community.  I was around the area one night to gas up at the station inside that business plaza. Immediately, my eyes feasted upon the Popeyes adjacent to the gas stop, so my mind fixated on a meal there. Luckily, I decided to yelp nearby eats! & good thing I did! I read up some reviews on Phat Phrank's, and after some thoughtful reviews I stepped inside.   Frank really is a music enthusiast, I've spoken to him on it.. but music is not what this review is about!   2 Words: Fish tacos.  I've tried something different every visit (being a regular): carne asada tostada, trainer salad (recommend if you're going "green"), barbacoa tacos, but oh sweet fishies, their fish tacos hook you! Get it...? Hook you..? No?.. I tried.   Frank tells me that their breakfast burritos are recommended. & that's exactly what I'm getting next! I mean.. after 3 fish tacos, please! :]  P.S. We know you're thinking about opening weekends, and we all agree. Please do (even just for lunch or dinner) ! :D

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Music enthusiasts!

pCsmKM-xC2NEGfJcmpnWJw.text: I just started going to Phat Phrank's when my office moved nearby... and I'm bummed I didn't know about it sooner! Their fish tacos are my absolute favorite (that secret sauce!!), but anything with adobado is amazing too. If you're feeling like Mexican but want to keep your summer bod in check, the trainer's salad is really tasty. And good for a solid amount of leftovers too. Only downside: the parking lot is a nightmare at lunch, but that's not Phrank's phault.

UgA9AD2zNF-3gMgHBdNuXQ.text: WOW. Brilliant place. Had the Carne asada fries, adobada torta and buritto. Great service surpassed by even better flavoring. Must try and hands best in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Cpoxeb8ReTaZ3yBu-Xu_XA.text: Phat Phrank's has quickly become my go-to place to tasty Mexican here in Vegas. It's a family owned place where the food is made with a lot of care and I love that! "Phrank" is always around and smiling and his staff will do all that they can to ensure your satisfaction. At this point I've tried quite a few things... my favorites:  *Nachos - I'm actually not a nachos person, but his are done the way nachos should be! Tons of delicious shredded pork... an order is definitely a meal for 2 people! *Breakfast Burrito - the best breakfast burrito I've had in Vegas, by far! It comes with eggs, yummy crispy potatoes, cheese, and your choice of meat. He mixes everything to ensure every bite is perfect. When I'm having a bad day, I call ahead and pick one up on my way to work! *Fajitas - I have FINALLY found delicious fajitas in Vegas! I had the chicken ones for lunch today and really enjoyed them. The chicken was shredded (as opposed to the creepy pre-cut strips with faux-grill marks you find at say Chili's) and had 3 colors of peppers and onions mixed in. I'm not usually a fan of chicken, but this had an amazing amount of flavor.  *Churros - caramel and chocolate sauce.. mmmmmmm  I can also highly recommend their catering services ! "Phrank" helped us pick out a freaking feast for well under $10 a person. We had platters of enchiladas and tacos, guacamole, and ceviche. Everything was delicious and was ready right on time. We picked it up ourselves, but it was well packaged and transport -ready.   Overall, don't let the strip mall exterior fool you - this is Mexican (albeit heavily Americanized) at its best ! It's affordable, fast, and delicious. It's basically like  Roberto's that isn't a chain that serves food that tastes good! The only sad thing is they aren't open on weekends...

iPhJ_tw2-Nw_qHcuMD2nJA.text: Breakfast burrito oasis! Off the strip, open early, and we've only had great experiences. Start and finish your Vegas trip here!

Y2UavERWSGmP76ky6YZLiA.text: Phat Phrank's was a lovely lunch spot.  It's a simple restaurant a little off the strip but WELL WORTH the trip!  The fresh guacamole had ample amounts of avocado and is seasoned just right.  The braised pork  (adobada) is super flavorful with a little bit of a bite.  Their hot sauce spices it up nicely.  The fish tacos were on point.  Lightly fried fish, home-made creamy sauce, and loads of fresh cabbage and green onions made the perfect combo on a soft corn tortilla.  Hubby usually doesn't like fish tacos, but he blessed these, and added an extra to his order.  We're giving this a five because you get really GOOD food and SOLID service.  I'll be back!  If I lived around here, it would be a regular lunch spot for me.  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Homemade guacamole with loads of avocado.
Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish taco lunch plate, abobada burrito, and chips and guacamole.

hKoCIWZpp99O59VvT5DueA.text: Frank (Phrank?) was really great the first time I stopped in, when they weren't too busy. He hooked us up with good service and was very personable. I like the place so much that I even offered to photoshop one of his signs and send it to him personally, which I did shortly after leaving. I told him to suggest a meal, and he did, so ended up ordering a couple of awesome tacos.  The 2nd time I visited wasn't so pleasant. I don't think Frank even recognized me, not to mention I didn't get my drink that I ordered. I left my order number (these things they give you when you order) on the table along with some of my belongings and went to use the bathroom. By the time I came back, my order number was gone, my food wasn't there, and I had to interrupt an order that was being taken by Frank to tell him what was going on. He got the attention of his workers and they brought my food on a tray, but I ordered it to-go. Three errors in one sitting, and I tipped extremely well straight away and left the restaurant feeling like I wanted my tip back. Probably won't be going back to Phat Phranks again after this trip. Sorry Frank!

rYmOpmK8POSILIZsGU2N6g.text: Thanks fellow Yelp'rs for the great reviews. This lived up to all the great reviews. The adobada torta was phenomenal. The carne asada tostada was great too. Friendly staff - great service. We'll definitely be back. Worth the drive to get off the strip!

WOS2X9IYoG7W4gXBvPCQyg.text: 3.5 stars = good fast tacos. I tried the chicken and carne asda tacos. Chicken taco was all white chicken breast which is a must for me, and it was juicy and good. The carne asda lacked a bit of flavor and was a little dry so I threw the salsa on top and then it was good as well. I must have gobbled my two tacos, and rice and beans down in less than 5 minutes, lol. Service was not above and beyond but she did her job I suppose. I will go back and try some other things on the menu, and hopefully I can re-rate this place at another time. Give it a try.

95BH6xVXwRmoDvUJfvs97A.text: I had the adobada torta and it was damn good.  The bread was really thin and crispy.  It had something tasting like bleu cheese on it which I have never had on Mexican food but I liked the taste.    You order at the counter then get a number and they bring your food out.  The portions aren't gigantic but filling enough.

maRrPi_NRPzyGN_XhB00Ug.text: A friend recommended this place and I'm glad they did! We went in today and were greeted by the owner who was so nice and upbeat.   I ordered fish taco plate which came with beans and rice. A lot of places I go to their beans and rice just don't do it for me, but phranks beans and rice were really good. He also gave us all the salsas to try since he knew it was our first time, hot,medium,mild. When you tell me something is hot it should have kick to it and yes it did!  The fish tacos were great. Great batter,nice crunch, delicious sauce, and just right amount of green cabbage and cilantro to compliment the fish.

Has8xoPLtAwhJJ-8snhY8g.text: Really cute family place with great prices.  We loved the food and took their recommendations on what to order.    Mr R got a breakfast burrito with carne asada and I got the adobada plate. Loved them both. The pork especially was very good with the green salsa.

53c2Zi0_P8_vK1TJ2zFONg.text: I think some people that are giving this place 4-5 stars need to revisit and adjust their reviews.  This restaurant is of no higher quality than Roberto's and that's not saying much.  Despite Phat Frank's accommodating personality, I don't see the quality here.  I stopped here for lunch last week only because I happen to be in the Sunset and Decatur area and the listing had some good reviews from people I actually know.  Well, I don't trust any of you anymore...OK I'm kidding, sort of.  Selection:  "Steak" Burrito upgraded to "wet" with red sauce.  I was not a fan of this offering due to the fact that the "steak" was more like ground beef, the burrito was barely warm (bordering on room temperature) and the red sauce was essentially watered down ketchup and had no kick to it whatsoever.  Overall the meal was a disappointment.  I'm not sure how a burrito that is made on the spot is sent out room temperature but that's what I got.  Phact:  I won't be back.

QuWI-EssTJMBGtONwzGPow.text: I thought I had reviewed this place already - but I guess not!!!  Here is the deal - 5 stars for the food!!!   1 star for the customer service.  You are lucky if they even acknowledge you - let alone be friendly to you.  Unfortunately I doubt this place will last because who wants good food being treated like you are unimportant to their livelihood.  It seems like a family ran joint but they could care less about their customers.  The walk up to a counter with nobody present and wonder what you are supposed to do will catch up to them.  Phat Phrank - If you are reading this the 2 ladies working both times we visited are failing you.  Wife / Sister whoever they are - you should cancel them and get some upbeat and grateful folks running your amazing food establishment!!!    D.

6B9WkTIUbDZUmIREbL_HLQ.text: Fish taco plate was pretty awesome! It totally hit the spot for my Mexican crave after landing Las Vegas.  Phrank took time to explain the menu for us. My mom from Japan kept calling him a movie star. Great hospitality & great food. Muchas gracias!!   !

ytGmwCCFuCTlBA5L6gzAXg.text: I always get the carne asada breakfast burrito from here. So good!! Put the mild sauce on that thang too!! If you want something quick that's tasty and not pricey go here!!

43UPPTMngFNfoaC9h_6whQ.text: Food was great-  seriously recommend the fish tacos-  amazing! However: Floor was slippery like it was covered with grease. The plating was very sloppy and felt hurried. Similarly, the staff seemed very lethargic and didn't really give a vibe of approachable.

5dYxfstja4OLYf6DqqdWBA.text: Best Mexican food in all of Las Vegas, no better Taco or burritos, #phatfranks is a noble guy, I know him personally, I've become a hardcore regular in this place, try the Adobado anything! Adobado taco, add a Lil mayo  Adobado burrito  Adobado sandwich will melt your perception of Mexican food!

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Speechless

S_PDzlL-q25RKE2epSFT8w.text: I love that Frank comes out to everyone and makes sure everything is good and they are enjoying their food. Their medium salsa is ammmmmmazinnnng! Their meat is great quality!

ZMA0OqJDakmvSWGszc7Srg.text: This is one of my favorite quick Mexican spots to go to. It's close to one of my jobs so it's hard to find good places around it. Plus it's now open on Saturday's wish it where on Sunday's but many places aren't around that area.  I really recommend there adobada torta! Seasoned very well and so tender and juicy

iBl_Tm5-2AxyQJaDreu1YQ.text: Move along folks - nothing to see or taste here.   This is their 6th year of being in business, but why did it taste and feel like it was only their first week in business? Super uninterested and stand-offish service, wobbly broken table and beyond mediocre food - I was thoroughly not amused here.  The deal-breaker for me were the fish tacos - if you're going to charge a premium price per taco ($4.39), it should be hooked up with decent flavor and quality? Nope. The fish itself was a decent portion size, but the breading was identical to the fish sticks from the freezer aisle - pretty weak. The "Cabbage Tuesday" as yelper Ardie Y. comically and accurately puts it - was over done in abundance and upon inspecting the the bits of scallion and cilantro mixed in, it was browning and drying out. Not to mention, the "special" sauce was lacking much flavor. The overall tacos were a huge disappointment; I would prefer a Rubio's fish taco over these and they are also a far better price for what you get!   I also sampled the Huevos rancheros for $7 and semi-stale, boring chips but with a generous amount of guacamole for $5 - I would also rate both dishes as average. Nothing to see here folks. Here's the worst part - quickly after my last bites, I immediately felt a pain in my stomach. Was the salsa too spicy? Not to my chili eating tastebuds it wasn't. (Shrug)  In all honesty, the vibe of the whole place threw me for a loop. I was hoping for down to earth, welcoming and eager service with a memorable, flavorful lunch, but all I ended up getting was a stomach ache and looking forward to getting the heck out of there real quick.

fHYnk-UuFrzcNHNiFFygUQ.text: I'm a Cali kid, Mexican food is a must! Brought my family here and the food was good. A little pricey but good. Three carne asada fries ( the kids food) breakfast burrito and a Chile Verde burrito and drinks for all. The total was $60. A little pricey for me. I'll be coming back but with out the kids. Lol.

7-ozz1AxFxLNYQqxIb4qNA.text: I just ate at Phat Phrank's for the first time today, and in the middle of the meal, I decided that I couldn't wait to come back and bring my husband. I got the carne asada plate that came with corn tortillas. After eating my taco, I was so happy because it reminded me of a restaurant in AZ that I loved when I was a little girl. The owner managed both the register and made his way to each table to make sure his customers were happy with their meal. He was friendly and created a very welcoming environment!

350dFg89ynNvYPOqBZ4WcA.text: The reviews and here are unreal or something because the food here was not good at all. I only liked the fish tacos.  We have ordered one bacon breakfast taco and one sausage breakfast taco, they were not good. We have also ordered that chili pork verde or something..  not good.  I didn't like the Barbacoa tacos either..  kinda chewy and no fat in there.  Only the fish tacos were good.

wdPra9riPuC9UUqlpmh8xA.text: I dropped family off for an early flight from McCarran and used that as an excuse to stop somewhere and have breakfast.  I ended up here because it was bookmarked and because the other place I was going to try didn't open until 7 either and I wasn't going to wait there that long.  See it was an early flight.  When the doors were unlocked, I went in and had my choice of where to sit.  It's not a large place.  The server brought my menu and after some thought, I got the Huevos Divorciados, divorced eggs.  It comes with potatoes, refried beans, and tortillas.  The divorced of the eggs is one red and one green.  The green is topped by some good chile verde and the red is gotten from a red sauce that has a bit of a kick.  On the wall on the west side of the room is an area where they have the plastic ware you dispense for yourself and there are napkins there, too.  The breakfast was good but the plate was detracted by how poorly it looked on arrival.  The potato slices run on to the eggs which run onto the beans.  It tasted better than it looked.  Perhaps less runny beans or a plate with compartments?  Service was OK after a little bit of a shaky start.  I had to wait for the coffee but that was OK.  They just opened and they were brewing a fresh pot.  A good place to stop but I think it would be a better lunch stop than breakfast!

VD5UaZRubZfJbBhYhULFaQ.text: The breakfast burrito is out of site! Trainer's salad is also amazing for those looking to eat right and stay healthy, yet still enjoy a satisfying meal.

gM8PGl6LIP49yItBBNYHOQ.text: The meat was marinated so well. My friends had the adobo and they nearly shed tears of joy. The asada was delicious.

eJ6FirSF6_AePZZBcz8i9w.text: This place is a little gem. I had the pork Adobada Torta. Everything about it was delicious. I asked for some great salsa and was not disappointed. Phrank was extremely pleasant and attentive. Thanks for a wonderful lunch!

_4S6kSLED9TQSbZBfwiwTw.text: Here in Las Vegas with my husband for Vacation/Anniversary trip! Googled "best breakfast burritos in Las Vegas". This was a great find and exactly what we were looking for! Glad I listened to other Yelpers! Delicious carne asada breakfast burrito! Highly recommend!
