wJG_9kB_oxqOrAxZi3bqgg.text: Love the Chile Verde Burrito and the owner is super cool!!! Would highly recommend this place.

TDZfA6wLCp5WnbqXWi17sg.text: Wow. The hype is REAL. Thank you, yelpers, for leading me in the right direction. Went here for lunch and ordered the Adobada Torta. Not normally a fan of tortas (mexican sandwiches) but Phat Phrank's changed my mind. The meat was perfect (maybe a tad bit salty) but the sauce and veggies that came with it were the perfect compliment. Can't comment on the rest of the menu but TRY IT NOW. You won't be disappointed.

450tfMlrLOZX_Fzfq2E2Bg.text: Truly love the burritos here. The barbacoa I hope I spelled that right. Is my favorite!!! You can call in advance I think. Just an FYI it takes a little long, but it is worth the wait!!!!

rBQOWOu8tpBwQKyVDKGxSg.text: First time visit to Phat Phrank's, long time burrito eater.  First impressions was that no menu was posted and you can't see what they offer until you get to the counter.  I looked at their website in advance which has the menu as was very disappointed that the prices were vastly different and they told me that prices are subject to change.  I got what the cashier recommended which was the best seller, the chili verde burrito.  Also disappointed they charge $0.25 for water.  Burrito and a water was $10.25.   They appeared to be a popular location and the seating was full and the lines were fast.   The kitchen is viewable from the eating area and I would have preferred not to see where the magic happens.   Wasn't the best looking or operating kitchen I have seen.  Tapatio was on the table for use.  Parking was limited to a few spaces out front.  The burrito was large and served on plastic. It was incredibly salty and almost difficult to eat. Burrito places are a dime a dozen in Vegas and I'll probably be going elsewhere.

bwt-6xvUhgDpaJQH5vkFtg.text: I've gone on three separate occasions at different times and they are closed. Not sure what their hours are.

1O5xPo04BkqFB3xjPNZQCg.text: Holy smokes! This was the best barbacoa burrito I have ever had the pleasure of devouring. At one point I was 3/4 of the way done and stuffed but I just could not stop it was that damn good!!

ZZB0VBeTmQ79bE88r9lDGw.text: The food is good and fresh here, but it's more California, than Mexican so it loses a star on that basis.  It's also really clean and has a bright strip mall location.  I had a taco al pastor and a carne asada taco.  They were both very good and became much better with the addition of hot sauce and a squeeze of fresh lime.  The burrito with carne asada filling and the special pork sauce on top was good.  The pork was amazing, but the burrito itself was just OK.  Not bad, but I thought the flour tortilla got kind of soggy under the sauce.  Maybe I am just not a burrito fan.  I recommend the tacos, though I might ask them to hold the cabbage next time.

lp8AOVqYi3uo2Q6OB02M_g.text: Good service. Took a little while to get good but food was excellent. I would recommend the fish tacos and adobada torta

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tummy

8vZvwygGy0oS9g2UcnAkXA.text: Awesome spot. It might be the reason for all the traffic at the Decatur exit off of 215. Best fish tacos and the Adobada Torta is one of the best sandwiches in town!

TfKrIR4gvS-repAtGy5Xsw.text: Had a great experience here. Only problem is they might nor have enough tables when you dine. We had the fish tacos and it was to die

Z2XTLVaeT8_DOUohwHvR4A.text: The best in town. Makes me feel like I'm back at home in San Diego. Friendly staff, great service, amazing food! A must try!!

shVRXUZORdtpLGeyMwBTEA.text: Found this on Yelp and thought we'd give it a try. It was very good and the staff was helpful and friendly. We both Had the Chile Verde burrito at the recommendation of the woman who took our order. It was delicious!

5sZqyBfkQdyq_O2pAHTOKA.text: Best Torta I've ever had! I will be back for the Adobada Torta. I knew from the moment I walked in this is a legit taco shop because they had a memoir of Manuel from El Tapeyac ( East L.A. ).

frEdF63b_E5ehFACIbq2yw.text: Had the carne asada burrito with chili verde sauce. Just the right amount of fire. The man at the counter was very nice and stayed busy cleaning when not helping people. The cook brought our food directly to us and thanked us. So yummy, thanks guys!!!!! #supportlocal

pasc1NT58uy3Y54vYzdTEg.text: Bomb bomb bomb food. The guy (I'm assuming the owner) was super nice/conversational and made sure to check in on us. Their food was amazing. The sausage breakfast burrito is a must. Also tried to the carne asada fries, which were delicious. I actually don't even usually like green salsa and theirs was still so good. I don't have one bad thing to say about this place!

ziOe9g6M45lsOEgKQLsHPQ.text: We were on our way home from Vegas & we were craving Mexican food. Came across this place on yelp so we decided to stop by. I got the mama Maria's enchiladas because the fried egg on top sold me. They were really filling & the enchilada sauce was tasty also. The owner came to talk to us & was a very friendly man. Place is small but the options on the menu are just right.

SvCNX4bpUIoAjO7NfX-2aA.text: Service was awesome! We felt like we were right at home! Food was quick, fresh, and delicious! We ordered the chicken flautas and the fish taco combo. Both were delicious, but the real winner was the fish tacos! A must! We definitely are makings stop at this place every time we are in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish tacos combo plate!

VWzYZ1f95NAKjD9_iyO3Bw.text: 5 stars might seem way too much for a small strip mall restraint, but it is not the quality of the food, which is excellent, it is not the price, which is really low, it is the incredible customer service. Any moron can open a restraint and resell Sysco boxed crap and make a go of it, but this place is on a whole different level. Frank, his wife, daughter, grand sons, and other family members make nearly all the food items fresh. You always hear someone say that "this is the best whatever it is they are eating", but at Phat Phranks you really want to say it about everything you put in your mouth. They are open till 6 PM on every night but Thursday.  Go there on a Thursday night after 6 PM and see what the car clubs bring to his special late hours event.  Be sure to try the Churro.

lczKYOgeCh0pg9uNNb8k-A.text: I am a phan of Phat Phrank's. Sorry--couldn't resist!   I have been hearing about this place for a few months now and decided to give it a try thanks to my fellow yelpers. What I liked most about it was that it was different from the norm. For example, it is not a traditional sit down restaurant nor is it your average taqueria. There are a handful of tables and chairs that we were able to move around to accommodate our party of 4. However, the best thing about this place was the friendly environment Phrank creates in his restaurant. He is welcoming, and constantly checks on you to make sure your visit is going smoothly. I like that!  As far as the food in concerned, it was pretty good for the most part. My wife and I decided to share a variety of dishes, so we could sample the different flavors that were on the menu. We started off with the nachos, which came loaded with tender Chile Verde and cheese over the top of crispy tortilla chips. Good, but I forgot that I don't like cheese with pork. Something weird happens when the cheese mixes with the sauce from the meat. The result is a gelatin mixture of wet, sloppy, cheesy goo. Next time - no cheese please.   We also tried the carne asada burrito with rice inside. Tasty, but I had better versions in town -Los Tacos for example. The fish tacos I kept hearing so much about were "fishy", and disappointing. But hey- we are in Las Vegas! How fresh can the fish be? The star of the meal was the adobada taco that was seasoned well and went perfectly with the cabbage and hot sauce. Next time, I would order a handful of those and be just fine.   Prices are reasonable, as we spent 23.00 for all that food and a large soft drink. We will be back to visit Phrank and support his restaurant that he obviously cares so much about.

qcPA9Vi8-V4HAQoT3vZuHw.text: I came here on Sunday with my husband he had the regular Carne Asada and I had the breakfast Carne Asada. What's the difference you ask?. ..mine had eggs, and potatoes. The burrito was filled with seasoned tender meat, eggs, and potatoes. It had a good flavor to it but I'm super sensitive when it comes to salt ...it was a bit on the salty side for me. My husband loved his burrito he liked the fact that the meat was not hard and there where no pieces of fat in it. The service was outstanding you can tell Frank has a lot of heart and he put it in this place. Our cups never went empty and the service was very attentive. I would love to come back and sample some of their dishes that have chicken in it because I hear it's pretty " Phantastic"!

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Carne Asada

bdcKndw0w--HQWW11WH5qA.text: Great food and great service for under $10. I had the cheese enchiladas.. it came with rice and beans and a tiny salad and a soda. People came and refilled drinks and picked up our plates.. wasn't expecting this at all.

-DLSEUMNfqSlSIB4kcwzvg.text: The tacos are amazing. I am addicted to the carne asada tacos. They come with cabbage and cilantro. But all the other dishes I've tried have been good as well. The food isn't dripping with grease. The ingredients taste fresh. It almost seems like healthy Mexican food. :)

PLdogEnFMjN8UwoEIHdjAQ.text: I date a Mexican , her food was top notch until I came here . HOLY CRAP I'm in love with phat phrank's. Best torta ever! Yuuuuummmm. Seriously do your self a favor and come here to eat.

FNk3dPSlY6McXgCatQ8aXA.text: Awesome service. Phrank explained the menu to us.  The guacamole and chips are really good.  You can't go wrong with any of their plate dishes.  Drinks are free refills

HdE-hxALMsa94CD5EZDcGw.text: Phrickin' phantastic! Zooming down Decatur on our way to a meeting in Henderson, I spied the sign for Phat Phrank's and Not Your Average Deli. We pulled up, hopped out and started to peruse the offerings of each establishment when a young guy walked out of Phrank's and advised us: "The food here is phantastic." Well, maybe he said, "fantastic." Anyways, we were sold!  The interior is simple. Apparently, they're working on a music theme and accepting donations to deck the walls. We took notice of two violins hanging over the counter. We assumed Phrank was a virtuoso of sorts, but our vision was squashed when the lady behind the counter told us they were simply donated by customers.   Speaking of the lady behind the counter--she was a complete sweetheart! She was enthusiastic, helpful and sincere. I was curious about the tea selections, so she provided me with a sample. It was too sweet for my liking, but I appreciated the taste.  She recommended the Trainer Salad, and I had been eyeing it already, so my decision was easy.  The Trainer was a tasty, refreshing lunch. I loved the cabbage and cilantro additions. I also chowed down on the big, tender chunks of white meat chicken. Too often at a Mexican restaurant the chicken quality is, well, dicey, but Phrank does chicken right. They serve the salad with fresh salsas as dressing, and I happily dumped a healthy dose of the tomatillo offering on top. I must say that was a strong call on my part. Of course, it helped that the salsa was tangy and delicious. The salad also came with guac and beans, and both were equally yumalicious. My husband had some tacos, and I can report that there is a lotta of meat in those tortillas. Be careful or you might just end up phat yourself!

5mCV6n_gdTOhYcZ34PtK0w.text: One of my favorite places to go and get real authentic mexican food when im in the area.. Frank and his family are really nice and a group of amazing peroples.. will recommend to anyome that lives in vegas or not.

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The green chili chicken burrito... mmmmhmm soo good..

5GcWdkgHYBOxbTHARCB9og.text: I have always wanted to try Phat Phrank's but never "made the effort". All me...well come to find out, all this time, I had been depriving myself of amazing Mexican food!! Finally "made the effort" to park and go in. I know crazy right!? We were greeting by Frank himself and we let him choose our order! Didn't wait long at all and received our food! Unbelievable! It was so tasty and fresh! We have been back several times since and even bought a shirt! Keep up the fabulous work "Phrank"! We will set be back for more! Thank you!!

IVvRo7VujN2LMN9VgUAVAw.text: Went there for lunch. Ordered the carne asada burrito. Asked for it red wet. Was asked if I wanted hot or mild red, so I assumed we were good to go. Get the burrito, no red sauce. Asked for it and was told "I tried to get them to put it on, but they won't. It's like a $1.29". Soooo, they don't listen, screw up my order, then want to run my card again for $1.30? On top of that, the "carne asada" burrito is 75% rice and beans, and what meat is there is meh at best. I am totally cool with mistakes, they happen, but have decent enough customer service to just eat the dollar and fix what you should have done and charged in the first place. Honestly, even with that it probably wouldn't have been much better. With Robertos right up the street I have no need to go back, and you should go elsewhere as well.

_pVMdmhOSJkd3-mj-gJ6jQ.text: I've driven by this place countless times and finally stopped in today. I'm kicking myself that I didn't stop in before. Great food and impeccable service. I will for sure be back many times in the future.

uSBK7hMBrNkgNDuyQWTlag.text: Seriously I'm done eating for the next 24 hours lol the Chillie Verde Burrito is a must try!

DN6asUIv_irIFLmXO6saTw.text: I visited this place today just because it's by my job and I was a little tired of Popeyes's and sandwiches for lunch. I ordered the flautas and let me tell you they were bomb!!!! There is no Mexican place I've been to that actually makes them! Every time I see them on the menu at other places there just rolled tacos/taquitos, it seems no one knows what a flauta is....but this place does and they did an awesome job! The wait was not long, I went in around 11:00 and was out by 11:10. The reason I didn't give a full 5 stars is that the lady who took my order seemed a bit annoyed when I asked her a question, maybe she was just having a "day". Any ways this will be my go to spot for flautas, can't wait to try other things on their menu.

fb9AKSjp-WTmhXZFibieRQ.text: I feel like owning the owner of Phat Phrank an apology for not givn them a review sooner. The lady owner or manager was such a cool cat. I was just mentionin how tasty their Horchata r. Wish I did order a larger cup size. She immediately offer me a refill! She made my day even though it was a bad day for me at work! Anyway! After eatin here for couple months. I can safely guarantee u these place is more legit than most of the jewlery u find in Vegas' pawnshops! Their tacos, burritos, quesadillas r out of this world! I might not be an expert of Mexican foods. But I did ate at least hundreds or maybe a thousand meals of Mexican related dishes from the Mission district of SF, LA's famous Mexican food trucks n back street alleys food vendors n the Tijuana dirt cheap Mexican restaurants!

vCLP9QIjoLPNzqZh4T6xpA.text: The best tortas in Las Vegas, very addicted. This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurant in my side of town. The people there are awesome too.

G3UjKnNGKzQLmWGXY7C8zQ.text: Drove a long time to get here because of the super high yelp rating. But I don't think it should be that high review, at least for my first time experience.  We got the Carne asada plate, taste just average and the size is small. The inside is small and very simple but seems very busy during lunch time.  I don't think I will drive back here for lunch. bW-omfiGozb7bfgtjfotBQ.text: Definitely a good place to stop and have a quick bite. I got a Carne Asada plate that was decently sized with some nice soft corn tortillas. I really enjoyed the food and it wasn't very expensive. The lady that took my order was very polite and the food came out pretty quick. If your driving by ir want something quick stop here and eat.  You won't be dissapointed.

7CC9NRsGpCABQA_RWGztKw.text: Would have given this place a 5, but they unfortunately we're kind of rude this visit. Apparently I was rude by not honoring their no cell phone policy. Which they do have a sign posted near the register that I didn't see.   The problem I have with this is that there was no one behind me and I already ordered my food and was picking it up. Every situation is not the same, but the fact that Frank was so dead set on proving a point made it a bad experience this visit. He ignored me and took someone's order that came in after me. When I mentioned to one of the workers in the back that I was ready to pay for my order that was sitting right in the front she said you have to get in line. I said I was in line and that I came before the customer Frank was taking an order from. He then said no you weren't you were on your phone. He had a bad attitude about it and when I said you know its unfortunate that every time I've come here I've had a good experience except for this time. He then said no there's no problem. Well, apparently it was a problem and he made sure I knew about it.  But hey, great job at enforcing your policy I just won't be back.

Li5CiI-3u9nN6K0aHz57eQ.text: I am feeling frustrated!!! I ordered food during my lunch break and it took a rather long time and when I got the food I was pretty upset. I paid $9.00 and change for the carnitas plate and there was less then half an ounce of pork. Literally way more lettuce then meat. I don't eat a lot of food normally but this was a little ridiculous. I am so frustrated because it was so so so delicious. I don't usually even eat rice and beans but I tried them cuz I was so hungry and they were very good. So kinda sad it was so good but I wish there was at least an amount that would fill up a small child. I should of taken a picture but had to get back to work. Like I said food tasted really good but the amount was so small

C1FDOONl_B9lGZpYEE6WNw.text: Had Phat Franks for the first time just a few hours ago. Very impressed with the food and Frank.   He and his helper (didn't catch her name) are very cordial and really make an effort to offer exceptional service.   Ordered one carnitas and two chicken tacos. They were phenomenal! I love tacos and try to sample as many as possible. Frank does a great job. The meat is flavorful, moist and plentiful, the corn tortillas fresh and the toppings are near salad like proportions (cabbage, cilantro and onion). I opted for the spicy salsa (there is a mild, green and spicy) which had a nice kick to it. There is no salsa bar, your choice is added to the order.   The price, as I recall, is about $2.89 per taco. A little on the higher side, but they are worth it as the overall size and meat portion trumps the other tacos I've come across.  The place is also very clean and the food is made to order and prepared quickly.         Phat Frank's is simply PHantastic!

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Phat Frank&#39;s Tacos!!!!

iZ2m8Y0iYnCMoOs69Tpfew.text: The restaurant has a clean eclectic feel that is only really trying to convene the personality of the ownership. It isn't trying to be authentic Mexican food by any means, and if that is what you are looking for there are better options.  If you are looking for Mexican style food that tastes good, at a reasonable price this should do it for you. There is no Waiter service, but it doesn't quite feel like fast food (beyond the ordering process).   The staff is friendly and they appear to be treated well.

LRAhAFzFdFKQ2_Gls3-NHg.text: Solid 3.5 stars but the owner's friendly personality and great work ethic easily push this into 4 star territory for me.  We got the adobada torta and the carnitas burrito. The torta was great, and the bread was nice and toasty as mentioned many times here. The meat was very tender, and the green secret sauce oozed out the bottom. Only thing missing was some avocado.  The Burrito also had very tender meat, and the tortilla was the chewy kind that I love. It was a bit on the greasy side though (lots of cheese), and I wish it had some kind of texture contrast such as some crunch of lettuce or something. (Just beginning to think I'm not that into burritos.)  He offers three types of salsas. I think at least one should be more hot though. Like I said, Phrank is a hard working guy and really takes pride in his restaurant. He takes out the issue of LV Weekly that he was featured in a few months back and shows it to pretty much everyone that comes in. If I got in the Weekly I would too! :)  Other popular dishes that I will try next time include the chile verde burrito (featured in the Weekly) and the fish tacos.  FYI, they are located in the small plaza behind the Am/Pm. Turn in like you're going to Am/Pm and you'll see them there. It's a little hard to see the signage from the street until after you pass it.

sl_j-oD8ygRy_XOQkrKcXA.text: This place has AMAZING breakfast burritos.  Best I've had in years.  And the owner Frank is there every day. I am heading back tomorrow. That good!

KQc7tjcDWi09CPtJs3ffFQ.text: After reading all of the reviews I really wanted to try this place. I ordered my food in advance so I could pick it up. I ordered the fish taco, deep fried cod with a secret sauce and slaw on top of it.... It wasn't very flavorful.. just tasted like fried fish with sauce and slaw on it.... I guess I was expecting more because most of the reviews I've seen suggested that the food is full of flavor... it wasn't. I also had the churros everyone raves about... Very underwhelmed.... It just wasn't good to me. Maybe too Americanized...  The staff was very nice and the place is clean and decorated nice.

Gp7bp-9ZdfFG-YYoor8ZPg.text: Just stopped by and had the adobada torta. It doesn't taste like your traditional adobada but its phreaking good! My SO had a rice and bean burrito enchilada style and she was loving. Will definitely be back

0_n4GxFf2mmNTOyN1Jahvw.text: Not sure why the marks in this place are so high. The food does not have much flavor.  We had a carnitas torta and carnitas taco. The beans were tasty- liked that they were not pureed so much that you could tell they were beans.   The place is cute and staff is friendly.

L71Awo-fOIs1gZ64341S8g.text: I really wanted to like this place but it just didn't happen.  First of all the girl @ the counter was very rude..she was a larger woman and I was just coming from the gym & in my workout outfit. She kind of rolled her eyes at me. I asked for a side salad..got a "noooo". Not sure why I didnt leave at that point..I ordered the fish tacos, sauce on the side.  I got a very fried cod (not a fish I ever eat) square thing in a tortilla w loads of lettuce. The rice was not tasty and the beans were too fatty tasting. I ate a few bites and left.  I guess when I think of fish tacos I'm thinking grilled fish, fresh salsa white rice black beans type . Maybe I'm just too much of a health foodie for phat phrank.

pJrM4yAZo0Gs63D9UCyCSQ.text: My coworker and I stopped in today for lunch. The service was exceptional! Not only did they help us figure out what we should try, they came back throughout the meal to make sure that we were enjoying our food., which we did. We got the adobada torta and the fish tacos, both were so delicious that I could sit there and eat them all day. Both had such great flavors and every sauce (we tried them all) was awesome. The best part was, after we ate (way more than we should've) I didn't feel overfull or fat like I do after most of my Mexican food meals :) The ingredients were all super fresh and light. I will most definitely be back with friends. I only wish I had one closer to my house so that I could take my husband back for dinner tonight! I'll have to bring him soon! Thank you to everyone. I will most definitely be a phattie :)

OIuHVcXV7P5OjgctV6vYpA.text: If you want ambiance don't go here. If you want great food, immediately go here. There are only a few tables so it is jammed at lunch. I wish they had a bigger place but they are still in this small location. There is a small frame sign behind the register for "El Tepeyac" which is a long established restaurant in East Los Angeles and maybe the best Mexican restaurant in America. The food at Phat Franks reminds me a great deal of El Tepeyac. I can think of no greater endorsement I can give. The Chilean Verde burrito is the best I have ever had and because it is so great I won't try anything else. Family members have tried other items and rave about them. My son-in-law had a Carne Asada burrito during our last visit and loved it. I worked in East Los Angeles and became a connoisseur of Mexican food. I have found very few places in Vegas that are really good, but Phat Franks is great. Again, don't expect a fancy place. It is hidden in a little strip mall so it isn't easy to find. If you try it you will be hooked. I just wish they would move to a bigger location and move closer to my house so I don't have to drive ten miles to get there. But, it is worth the drive.

pz5dRiak2TbDR3a2tifFUA.text: I bought the Carne Asada Torta at Phat Phrank's and it was amazing. Everything tasted super fresh and flavorful. It's cafe style where you order at the counter, but the service was awesome. The owner came out and personally got us more drinks and stood and talked with us for a moment. The rest of the staff was super friendly and you can tell a lot of love is poured into this food. We were there celebrating a birthday so the owner brought out a dessert he called a Chimicheescake that was soooo good. A flaky shell filled with warm cream cheese drizzled with cinnamon sugar and honey. I will definitely be going back!

6GVSciEBw63xUUk3dwsHTA.text: I actually had received an email from Yelp yesterday with Phat Phrank's highlighted in it and so thought I would try it out for the first time since the ratings were so good.  Somewhat disappointed.....I don't think it is a 4.5 star rating, but if I was in the neighborhood and was hungry for Mexican Food I would stop. Certainly not worth a trip of about 6 miles from my home.  I ordered a chicken burrito.  Thought I would compare it to the chicken burrito I had the previous day at "Roberto's Tacos."  It was good, but not fabulous.  I had asked if they put cheese on their chicken burritos and I was told yes, but after eating the whole thing, I hadn't seen a sign of any cheese.  They do add rice and beans, which to me then makes it a combination burrito and I wanted chicken.  The chicken was all white meat, but not enough chicken for me and to much rice and beans.  It was bland tasting without adding any salsa or hot sauce.  The portion size was good, and the salsa was good, but would have tasted better on chips rather than the burrito.  The chicken burrito I had eaten at the "Roberto's" the day before was all chicken, no rice and beans and very tasty.  It was seasoned with some chiles and peppers and very good to eat without adding anything to it if you didn't want to.  Roberto's was definitely better when it came to the chicken burrito.  Phat Phrank's does not have a menu board and so you have to wait until you get up to the counter to look at the one menu they had available to order off of.  It didn't give you much time to make up your mind when there were people waiting in line behind you.  The employees were all very friendly and the facility was clean.  I will probably go back and try some other items, but not at the top of my list to run right back tomorrow.

jbLCKh9_Afh_JEMpT4ZdCQ.text: A lot of places talk the talk... They delivered !! The barbaco, adobada, and carnitias was tender, flavorful, and on point, great job !!in

DnRA0OnfUynnaL7hNgVuVw.text: We arrived in Vegas, sicker than either of us had ever been and beyond exhausted.  We woke up late, having not eaten a real meal in days.  So we relied on Yelp (thank you Yelp!) to find a restaurant close by.  All the reviews of Phat Phrank's are right on -- you will not be disappointed.  First, Frank greets you as if he just saw you yesterday and has known you for years.  He is so friendly, and funny, and welcoming.  As we told him at the end of our meal... we felt as though we were dinner guests in his home.  The food was just great!  We were both really hungry because we had been too sick to eat for days.  Phat Phranks was the place to be!  Portions were large, everything was homemade, and we left feeling full (but not painfully full) and energized.    Wonderful... thank you Frank & family!

McanZ9exRxKUGOKot8y_Qw.text: Wow. If you don't give this place five stars after eating here, your taste buds need adjusting. Ate at Phranks for the first time tonight and I plan on going back frequently. Best torta I've had in Vegas hands down (Adobada torta) and the friendliest service possible from the owner himself. I ordered over the phone for pickup and Phrank went over the menu with me, made recommendations and was very accommodating. I'll be back for sure!

BrpAOPvPrNOGfz76GEwvrQ.text: Huge fan of this place because the tacos are gigantic for the price, and extremely fresh and flavorful, with lots of nice fresh cabbage and cilantro.  Because this is so close to my house, I end up here instead of Del Taco or Chipolte when I want a quick fix.  It is much more healthy and flavorful in general than those establishments.  May I also point out that they do their own version of an Americanized hard crunchy taco that is also really delicious?  And the churros are the best I have ever had.  While by no means is this place authentically Mexican, not that I am an expert, I still think they put out some really tasty, great food.  I am looking forward to exploring most of the menu.

MY7fnX205bdlbzXlKw9zrQ.text: The customer service here almost tops the food, frank is just a cool dude all around and will lay the details out for you if your a first timer. I say go for the chicken torta with side beans and rice. You can't go wrong with anything here though honestly.

xr8bxD1zgd-Y209Jm9zMBg.text: Phat Franks have the best Mexican food and environment. .Outstanding staff and service

W-tALvO_LSr6rWwHbtazYQ.text: NOT OPEN ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY??!!    You have to be a bold restaurant to not be open on some busy eatin' out days.  I am going to rate this initially and will come back and revise.  I was so blinded by all the great reviews that I didn't seem to look at the hours.    All I can say is that when I finally eat here it better blow my mind!    To be continued........

bBJ_lqv4mMcJbSlr60FOCg.text: This place is pretty dang good. I would put it a few steps above Roberto's. Great Salsa and food is fresh and staff is friendly.

vhJTaUpdUJGtO5CXKojp2w.text: In all honesty, I stopped into this place only after learning the deli next door was no longer in business. So, I was expecting just an average Mexican joint and play it safe with a couple of a la cart tacos.  It was early in the lunch hour, so it looked a little quiet from the outside. As soon as I walked through the door, I was greeted by the entire staff! Nice! With this being my first visit, the friendly gentlemen behind the counter (who I connect the dots as Phrank) was quick to suggest some of their best dishes. I notice out of the corner of my eye a sign advertising their daily special as fish tacos with rice and beans. Done and done.   I have a seat and in no time one of their servers brings me out my drink and asks me if this was my first visit. "We hope you enjoy the food!" he says mentions that my lunch will be right out.   Meanwhile, the place is really starting to pick up! Construction workers, business men and a couple of families all seem to be regulars and strike up conversations with Phrank and even recognize each other as loyal fans of the food.  The fish tacos were incredible!  Good portion size and yummy, well seasoned rice (although still not as good as my mom's)!  I was in a bit of a hurry so I was in and out of there in no time, but it was probably a good thing as people were literally lined up for the next available table.  All in all, great experience, good food, terrific staff and close enough to the office it's a shame not to visit at least a few times a month.

miXJmvmpVRKM8FEjtu1i6Q.text: The tortas are amazing!!! It's not all bread like I have had at other places. The bread is thin and perfectly soft yet slightly crunchy.We also tried the chili verde and it was very good. They give you three small cups of salsa to try out; a green one, a smokey one, and a regular pico type one- they were all packed with flavor! Prices are very reasonable.

-48Wdinq1cfY3Jex0KpLfQ.text: This place gets packed during lunch time but so worth it. Everything on the menu is all amazing. Best desert is the the deep fried cheese cakes!!!

4Ld3GY4anhl9UquZGEHeHQ.text: Good but not quite 4.5 stars good.  I had a barbacoa taco and two chicken tacos.  My friend had two fish tacos.  Taste was good but other aspects lacked a bit.  The tortillas completely fell apart when picking them up. That's why a lot of places put two tortillas under the taco.  The meat was good quality - woo hoo!.  Flavor was good but there was some cabbag-y stuff in the tacos.  I've lived in Mexico and "ain't seen no cabbage in my tacos" before, but ok.  The owner was awesome.  Really liked him and his attitude.  So, I'd definitely recommend but go in expecting "good" or "really good" but not blow your mind amazing.

FZHeLENBBcpfLh_eTdOvCA.text: Decided to trust Yelp and check this place out. The owner was taking orders and was very nice. It is a pretty small place and it was packed and rightfully so because the food was great. Great service and friendly staff!

C4whMmyxSeWa01VWFjLMGA.text: The food here is pretty good... I had the asada tacos and they were good but a bit dry, my husband had the pork torta special (I could have the name totally wrong) and he said it was the absolute best he has ever had. I am disappointed because I ordered (and paid for) the beans and rice for both meals and never got them. I didn't realize it until after we left (my own fault) because I had two kids keeping my attention during the meal. I will be back and I hope to be able to update with a better review next time. The food and service was great I knocked the rating down because I didn't get all of the food I paid for and my asada tacos were a bit dry.

UElJbbaZluCKPeS1S8HO2w.text: Ok, so it hurts me to give 2 stars because Phrank was one heck of a guy. He greeted me immediately and was very social, I love these kind of people! I order and give him my debit card, he comments on my name, and from then on when he addressed me he called me by my name, I mean how nice is that? I ordered the trainer salad ( I really really really wanted the nachos, but summer is coming) when it was placed in front of me, it was different than what I expected, everything was separated, didn't look like a salad, oh well, my fault for not reading the menu. The hot sauce and the tomatillo sauce had decent flavor, but the more chicken I ate, I kept drinking more and more water. I found it to be very salty. My lips started getting that feeling when all your water in your body is being depleted. I'm sorry, wasn't a phan of the salad Phrank. I may return to try the fish tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trainer salad

BwEJjggR2Al_oYHvBzbRsQ.text: Worth the drive! I'm so glad I placed my phone order before I checked the cross streets, because I probably wouldn't have ordered it since I was coming from Fort Apache and Flamingo, but it only took a few minutes on the 215 to get there! And Phat Phrank's certainly exceeded my expectations! My husband and I ordered three burritos to share with our three kids (1, 3 & 6 years old) and the five of us couldn't finish them! My favorite was the Chile Verde (with green sauce, of course) and my husband's was the Barbacoa! We also got the Carne Asada with red sauce, which was very good, but I definitely prefer the green sauce. Oh! And we got an order of chips and salsa, also delicious! The salsa is very fresh and flavorful (we tried all three: hot, mild and green) and the chips are perfect! And the staff is friendly, both on the phone and in person! We'll absolutely be back!

nWwLVqRiHb_zTFB9eiK5xQ.text: The Mexican food here is amazing! Locals come find this little hole in the wall. The Tortas are off the chain!

jND-YXj3-aUJdbhmaFr22g.text: I love a good, clean breakfast burrito and they did not disappoint. I got the bacon breakfast burrito; it had eggs, cheese, bacon, and thinly sliced browned potatoes. I also got a side of the mild salsa which was so good... I'm enjoying the flavor even after I'm done! Friendly service, good pricing at $8 with tax, and a burrito that didn't feel greasy and heavy.

xKdZQvxU6shtLqvs5RdBOQ.text: Food is cooked fresh to order! The staff loves this place. Owner is super nice and his staff can get you whatever you need. I highly recommend the adobada torta. OMG so goooooooood

NmdTJHeCE8HlVLddBwKt1A.text: Love this fast casual Mexican food. We have been going here for years and The food is great every time, the staff is very nice, and it's really clean. Fish tacos are my favorite, but my husband is obsessed with the Tortas.

eovWqtJJIVhH1WQISmBaSQ.text: I'm not sure how this place got so many great reviews. It was ok. The "egg and potato" burritos were eggs and potato chips. The salsas were ok, the service was fine, the prices were good. It was ok all around. It has a cute name, but at least what we had was forgettable. I think with a little help it could be cute but as it is, it's just ok. It's never a good sign when you show up for breakfast and there's no one in the place. And for your whole breakfast it remains empty...

FRVYaEVpkd2ggO-RivF1NQ.text: The food was good for the price point, husband loved the barbacoa breakfast burrito so that's definitely a plus but the carne asada one left something to be desired. The customer service was lacking but that seems to be a common theme in these reviews, the ladies just seemed irritated that we were ordering..

90h7qhazsUOR7KxIKnpkNg.text: Ok. A step up from Roberto's.  Small portions. Have to ask for refills which is.  What's so funny Frank? Overcharging for your food? Or the lack luster of your establishment!

xQbTgWl2j10EV8pWOhm1jw.text: This is absolutely an amazing place to eat, the staff are nice and the food is great. I've tried multiple things and all of it was great. I highly recommend you to try it out.

0Bh-OlVfmubXv4irqBP8EQ.text: Great food and service. Adobada torta was amazing.

m_aYiO8YIDI3AcY1m-qj1g.text: Do not order with doordash. Their menu is not correct and the driver cannot see what you actually want, just what kind of meat. It's a headache and the staff here don't care. Order food elsewhere

wVBkYLHoGSv79aQZi2SRKQ.text: A little late on this post. Wish there was a location closer to me, food is on point and the owner is awesome when ordering.

TQwyp9ey0274MUwciRSNnA.text: 3 stars because their breakfast burrito was really tasty.  But, as what previous reviewers have said, this establishment is truly lacking in customer service.    I came to Las Vegas as a vacation for my birthday. While on the West Coast, I was definitely in the mood for a breakfast burrito. Found this place via Yelp and decided to try it out. I had the chicken, egg, and cheese breakfast burrito, with mild salsa and a side of fries. The chicken was flavored nicely but was a bit on the salty side.  Of the 3 women running the place at the time, only one was pleasant. The lady at the cash register acted as if it was an issue just for us to finalize what our order would be.  She was not very helpful in providing feedback on the menu when asked, and her tone of voice was not what you would think someone would give in a service based establishment. When asked for ketchup, I was directed to go get my own packets at the front of the restaurant. No napkins, no silverware.  It wasn't a horrible experience, but wasn't very welcoming either, which was a bit of a surprise being in a place that thrives off of tourism.

4C_V6AixIwIv75BzCtb-_w.text: Great Mexican food. We had the chicken enchiladas and the chicken taquitos plates which came with Mexican rice and refried beans. Under $9.00. The ingredients were fresh. Great place for lunch.

n5jtV35xD6tYLE0illvRWw.text: Love love love this place! And if you meet Frank, he's a super sweet guy. The food is delicious and always fresh. The employees are always nice and welcoming. And the pricing is good. Loyal customer!

grZ2h0FgZd6EHcbFrQGdDA.text: Great food and service. Easy lunch choice! Adobada is very popular, but my favorite is the New Mexico red chile. The breakfast burritos are freaking awesome too!

NTu2wFUMbnKqeswcNHpV0A.text: This was a great little place to have our favorite cuisine at! I ordered the Carne Asada Breakfast Burrito and my hubs got the Chorizo one, we were both stuffed and only ate half of it!!!  Will definitely be bringing family and friends back to this place!

WSgZr1gFUIOOex0s0NMBOg.text: Wow! Just wow! The most amazing torta I've ever had and awesome service. Definitely coming back here again.

J2hjh8YCnEw5SaDiXHm-aw.text: You were a HIT PHRANK!!!! Out of 40 employees not one complained and that's a plus for me!! I told them all where to come find you....Everyone loved your food and i loved how easy it was for me to get the order in....we will be back!!!!   This place is PHUCKEN AMAZING!!!!! The chili cheesecake is to die for..... it

KkfFpacpSaE_jExKFbVF_w.text: Owner was cashier!! Funny conversation. Good prices. Food was excellent. Small restaurant so good idea to get early for lunch!!!

9iewzlbbLJMXAaAyMLzLgw.text: As if they need anymore great reviews. This gringo loved the food. Chicken was delicious and tender and all white meat (which I love), carnitas, Barbacoa, it was all good. Some of the best rice and beans I've had, I don't usually eat the rice and beans but I couldn't stop. And the guacamole was so good too. The best part, the service. Even if the food was a 4, would still give a 5 star review because the service puts them over the top. It was the first visit for the kids and I but my husband used to to go often when he worked nearby, 9 years ago. The owner, Phrank, remembered him. 9 years! Everyone was so friendly and quick to accommodate. The place is small, so it gets packed at lunch but we found seating for 5 since the tables turn over pretty quickly. Phrank said they're going to start opening on Saturdays. So give them a try on a Saturday when the work lunch crowd isn't so big.

n35On9O5DGIMGocVmMKXww.text: Best. Mexican Food. In Las Vegas.  You will not be disappointment.

Y1hWH_Te9GtNWYTZ-BSaiQ.text: When I'm searching for a good place to eat and I notice it has 4&1/2 stars from 300+ reviewers, I expect it to be pretty good! My wife and I went here for lunch and noticed there were no menus. I had to stand in a line of 4 people just to get a menu since there was only one person at the front. Once I got the menu, we skimmed over it...Nothing really special caught our eyes so we ordered the carne asada fries and chicken soft tacos. The food took about 25 minutes to come out which I felt was too long. The lady next to me was upset because she ordered her food to go and they brought it out to her on a plate. When our food was brought to us I noticed all they had were cheap plastic forks to eat with, which I'm fine with if I was expecting to eat at a Robertos. The fries were very basic, nothing special at all. The chicken soft tacos literally ripped apart once I picked it up. The only good thing about this was the chicken. I could tell it was actual shredded chicken breast. All in all, if I wanted to eat at Robertos or faustos...I would eat at Robertos or faustos...not drive across town for this. I honestly don't see where the 4&1/2 stars came from.

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken soft tacos
Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne asada fries

v0hORIFCEpJV21Cdewe5yQ.text: After a night of drinking we needed some good Mexican food and wow did we come to the right place! Phat Phranks is an order at the counter, seat yourself kind of restaurant. We ordered the deluxe carne asada fries as an appetizer. These are a must try when you come here. Also the entire staff was nice and friendly along with the service being fast!

CktvWrEs8zQlWNlOI0r9Mg.text: I like taking my clients here for a quick lunch.  The burritos are good, and the chips & salsa app is pretty tasty.  I will be back.

6mipawhzEQzwS1reMPDSdQ.text: This place thoroughly deserves all five stars! I like to support local family owned businesses but these people also just happen to make the best Mexican food around.   I have been coming here for about two years and they never disappoint. Everything on the menu is delicious. They even have a healthy option which is usually a problem if you want Mexican food. "The Trainers Salad" is delicious for how good it is for you.   The fish tacos are to die for! I could go on and on but I must mention the ground beef "gringo style" tacos. Get them, that is all I have time for but everything there us delicious and it's all homemade and everyone is always friendly.   Go there and thank me later.

A0YrxMKuQJTschrwUAYtzg.text: At first thought Phat Phranks sounds like a hot dog joint but after you walk in it takes a left turn to Mexico!  Known for the Adobada Torta, I had to try it out.  I've had quite a few tortas in my time so i was expecting the usual with maybe a twist on the meat.  Y hole! Upon arrival, something is different here.  My bun is flattened and grilled, did somebody step on my samich?  Nope, this is part of what makes the difference of a great torta.  Some torta buns or bollilos  can be a bit fluffy so when eating you get a bit high ratio of bun to meat.  By flattening the torta, you get a more even playing field of meat, veggies n flavors.  Upon first bite, there's is a delicious mix of tasty, crunchity pork, cabbage, lettuce, cilantro, tomatoe, secret sauce and green onions give a lil flavor kick!    Choice of salsas: Mild-your standard mild mannered mix Hot-feisty n smokey with a blend of chili de arbol (type of chili used by real Mexicans)  Green-tangy mix of chilies, cilantro, onions, I'm green with envy!   I told Frank, Phrank? That this is one of the best tortas ever!  I'm not eating another torta in vegas ever again... He laughed, which seems to be his character, a jolly phellow who talks to all the patrons.  Go Raiders?  Based on the execution of the torta, I'd say they have a great venue here... Mexican food with a notch up level of creativity! Say goodbye ol Robert-O....  I'm looking forward to sampling some other delicacies soon.   Delicioso!

_A2q1qv2oFhGH8552sycOg.text: We were on our honeymoon in Las Vegas from Fresno and whenever we are out of town we like to try local restaurants. I saw all the good reviews on Yelp so we decided to try it Plus I looooove Mexican food! I ordered the fish tacos and let me say they were the BOMB!!! They give you a Big piece of fish. It was crunchy but not overbreaded. You can tell it was homemade and not just out of a bag. The beans and rice were flavorful and the secret sauce was so good! My husband had the carne asada torta and he enjoyed every minute of it. Phat Phranks is great!

AxgPRtoL1j3FGGJcsr4mUQ.text: Fantastic tacos! Especially love their Adobada: try it with white cheese. I don't understand the comments about the service. The staff couldn't be nicer.

Su-ZA4-50HNaYpe4_6aY_w.text: For the amount of food that you get, the price is not worth it. I went there on lunch break, ordered to go and when I got back to work I noticed the portion size and they even forgot my tortillas.  I called them about the tortillas but they wanted me to come back to get them....that was a no since I had to come back to work. I don't see the hype. Super disappointed, especially because I was really hungry and I heard good reviews about this place. I won't be going there again.

lTDOjkthZmPysoCCeZOHCg.text: This place is absolutely amazing ! They have the friendliest service I've had in Vegas . You absolutely have to try their Pozole Verde , it has the perfect spice to it ! We will definitely be visiting frequently !

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pozole Verde

hhHCYSyYocE4vuJiJCuy-g.text: Atmosphere and friendliness of shop and owner save this review from a 1 star rating. I ordered two burritos both either had too little food or the tortillas was way too big. I literally tore off between the two enough tortillas to make 2 big tacos. The potatoes inside the burritos were way over cooked, I would say burnt. I might try this place again but only because the owner was nice. The guacamole also had too much garlic and salt l, a little less and I wouldn't of even mentioned it.  For food I would recommend Don Tortaco if you want a breakfast burrito.  The hot salsa was delicious though and the chorizo was also perfect minus the tortillas and potato issues.

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Atmosphere makes the phat, phat.

-d2cat-rCqZXBKlWSWIRvQ.text: Late weekday takeout lunch at 2:30 brought me here after having this place bookmarked for a good 5 months.  I was sooo on the fence about getting a breakfast burrito based on Blair B's terrific review and since it was my first meal of the day.  In the end, I went with the carne asada and a couple of carnita tacos.  The carne asada was pretty good but the pork carnitas blew my mind.  Maybe it was due to my hangover that day I was ready to drive back and have a couple of more.  The pork was so juicy and well seasoned that, like a good movie, I didn't want it to end.    Phrank took my order and as everyone else mentions in their reviews was very hospitable.  He was also patient as I was the only one in the restaurant at the time looking at the menu for a while.  So many other things on the menu to try!  I would definitely frequent this place more if not for their hours but that's just the nature of their location.  I will be back for sure.

7QqaM2IdzqZmBHuGBa0ZvA.text: Exceptional place with great people and killer burritos. I placed a order for 5 bacon, 5 sausage, 5 chorizo and 5 ham breakfast burritos. My order was ready on time at 8:00 AM on 9/2/16 and all my customers loved it for my meeting. I'll certainly make this my go-to spot when I'm in Vegas again.

e3c93QerTZdPtgUD5zry0A.text: A word out to Phrank on the Fish taco, just love the light breading, thanks for coming out and saying hi. Very personal touch man!   Had the fish and steak taco combo, liked them both very much and the hot salsa is super good too.

bR9ZWa_w1K0c2xwif9CIaQ.text: Two words: Adobada Torta. If you have not tried Phat Phranks, it is imperative that you do so ASAP! The chile verde burrito is also wonderful - a little spice, and lots of flavor! The fish tacos are to die for, and if you like authentic Mexican So-Cal style, this is the place to go.   Besides having a small-town Restaraunt atmosphere in a big city, Frank seriously makes every guest feel welcome. If it isn't right, he will make it right immediately. It's always refreshing to see the owner working behind the counter, ensuring everything is just right for his guests.

Z31PiE8kTlmxheHbpQ-DoQ.text: If you've had Phranks, you get it. There's something about walking into the place and seeing the owner behind the counter taking your order every time. This place is Frank's passion and it shows. He has a tattoo of "Phat Phranks" for sobbing out loud. He loves it and he loves everyone that comes in.   As far as food. Get the Adobada Torta. It's no secret. You've heard about it for a reason and that's why you're reading these reviews.   Infamous "one-sentence review"? I wish Frank DIDN'T work so much in the place he takes so much pride in, so he'd be able to have a Harley ride with me.

JYub24R15tzZvOU3J2rm4w.text: I'd say 3.5 stars. My barbacoa torta was ok but my bf seemed to like his burrito since it was really meaty. Don't expect good service from the girl up front though, but go ahead and try the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House barbacoa torta. It was ok.
Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bf said this was 1 of top 3 burritos.

EbjxAbkuWbzZgM_-X4m0wA.text: This was my first time here on a recommendation and ordered 2 items.  Service was slow, no one at the register and only a handful of customers after the lunch rush. I mentioned that this was my first time.   The menu quoted one price and then they tell me that the prices are subject to change.  They charged me $2.00 more and all she kept saying was "we are getting new menus and the prices are subject to change" and she kept repeating this with an attitude.   Not a wise way to acquire new customers.

cHHFGRbfXtAGHVaCjWAH-w.text: Crazy amazing flavors in their food. Ordered carne tacos and they couldn't have been seasoned/cooked any better. Very fresh and delicious.

NuxPR0_Dd_o3EGzPAhyB2A.text: My only complaint... the place is packed all of the time.  That should tell you how good the food is.  Certainly not that rock-gut, chain style slop you get at a Roberto's or others of their kind.  Never had a bad meal here.

qrgnpt071OZpopJ5zl_ovg.text: Really good food, great owner.  They need to get whole wheat tortillas and add a baked/grilled fish taco option and then we get the fifth star.

XI2zV2x1ZU_vOqVMdMJ_UA.text: You know that weird hole in the middle of Las Vegas that you don't really go to unless you work there or are driving through it?  That's where Phat Phrank's is.  I didn't even know that Decatur and Sunset existed until I a lunch meeting one day.  I kind of thought it was...just desert.  The menu is pretty simple, as you pick your meat, and then you can have it on a plate with rice and beans, or in a burrito with all the guts nicely wrapped together.  I ordered a carnitas burrito and a drink.  The burrito itself was well made, but the taste was bland.  This may seem strange (especially with the health food nuts), but I thought the burrito was TOO dry because of the lack of oil and grease.  I guess you could compare it to a burger that's too lean; you gotta have some fat in a burger, and you gotta have some grease in Mexican food.  Can't fault the service, though; food came out fast and they came by checking on refills at least 3 times.  That, and we loitered for about 45 minutes after eating, and they seemed to have no problem with it.  For now, this place gets a solid 3 from me.  Maybe if I revisit, I will get a new combo in my burrito and see how that comes out.

KNA7iesK0hfRH5YbIOkLXg.text: What a great owner. Explained all the items on the menu. i went for the fish tacos. My wife got the asada torta. Both tasted amazing. I will be going back there often.

vUs0XuzID4IvbqE_ErovzA.text: The food is very good.  Tender pork and soft fresh flour tortillas.  The owner at the register is warm and inviting.  The place is clean and has a nice area to sit or takeout from.  I look forward to going back to try differnet iteams.  The verde burrito was very good.

VqweG6AGsFA-XvZu22AzqA.text: Made my way over to this little Mexican restaurant for lunch with the hubby and my 2 year old son. Where to start....the service was awesome and the food was amazing. Phrank was behind the counter and he took our order. He was very friendly and walked us through the menu. I ordered the fish tacos, hubby ordered a chicken and carnitas taco, and Phrank made a special order for our little guy: a cheese quesadilla with chicken. All the food was fresh, flavorful, and you get to pick from several different house made salsas. After the food came out, Phrank came over to our table to see how we were enjoying our food. Looking around, there were many regulars that Phrank knew by their first name. Overall, we had a wonderful lunch and will be back again to support Phrank and his family business. Phrank also asked us for our first names, which I found to be very gracious. Phat Phrank's rocks!!!

dRdv5hEUvgYHlW6wAKiYzg.text: Not sure why this place is rated so high. The food was so bland. I usually trust yelp. Not on this one. Yelpers got it wrong.  I wonder who wrote these reviews, family of the owner? I'd stay clear. I don't like Roberto's taco shop but Roberto's has more taste than this place.

Qmoxl4OyyCklv94Na6Ajhw.text: Phranks was the best food we had this weekend in Vegas.   FYI, the meal before Phrank's was at Mesa Grill....Bobby could learn a lot from Phrank.   Phrank himself was behind the counter.  Cheerful and genuinely interested in his customer's input, Phrank really wants you to enjoy his food.    I had a fish taco plate that rocked.  The fish was super-crispy on the outside and perfect on the inside.  The cabbage and creamy cilantro sauce were awesome.  Phrank let us try all his salsas and I would say his regular red was my fave...you must order the roasted jalapenos...he marinates them in some sort of lime concoction so they have a tasty spicy tang to them.  My wife had a torta adobada that I would say was a cross of a torta and a pulled pork sammie...different than tortas I have had in the past, but really good.

QY8x7qiH9Hm-Q8iCgFlQeQ.text: Wow, Phrank's is the real deal!  I found this place about a month ago. Thank you yelpers.  Man I'm so glad I found this hidden gem.  I've tried the fish tacos, chile verde nachos, chile relleno, carne asada and chile verde burrito.  This morning I tried the bacon egg and potato breakfast burrito.  Wow, it was so good that I had to write this review.  The owner Frank is really friendly, he makes it a point to talk to everyone and get to know them and make em' feel at home.  Only thng I miss when I come here is avocado, or guacamole. But do yourself a favor and find this place. You won't be sorry.

szDaM3BqMuEy7VniSnxJ9g.text: The torta sandwich was amazing. The bread was perfect. My only issue was with the nachos, they were kinda spicy but I'm a lil girl when it comes to spicy food so it won't bother most people

D3smyoeSVYgneuFva0T5Jw.text: IF you like great Mexican food you need to make your way here.  The place is small but the hospitality is only surpassed by the amazing food that has so much flavor it is crazy.  My coworker and I went for lunch yesterday and I am so glad we tried it.  Frank actually was the one who took our order.  My coworker and I are in Sales which means we are NOT shy people and love to talk so we asked Frank "What's the most popular items?"  He gave us a few things that are the biggest sellers and elected to finally choose a green burrito with some of the most flavorful pork ever.  As we were eating Frank came out and brought us a sample of his barbacoa.  OMG, off the hook.  We get to chatting and Frank asks where I am from to which I say "San Diego".  He then proceeds to tell me that the fish tacos are out of this world.  Crap, should I have ordered that?  (as I continue to devoure the best frigging burrioto I have had in town since moving back here.).  Ok, no worries, next trip its fish tacos.   All I can say is that I am not going anywhere else for Mexican.  This place rocks the house.  Robertos, Albertos, Don Juan DeMarco or whoever, has nothing on Phat Franks.  And to top it off, the prices for food are great.  I am so happy that it is a quick trip from the office for lunch.   THANK YOU Frank!  You are awesome and your food is equal to your hospitality.

d3cVuuGiLZHWBLe--B7ysg.text: The green sauce is top shelf.  Portion size needs a little work, but all in all it is solid!

GUrv-NhLX3qjrB6DMlNknw.text: We stopped in based on the reviews and were not disappointed. The Adobada tacos  and Fish Tacos were awesome.   The guacamole was so fresh and tasty I could have made a whole meal of it!  The owner Frank is a great guy!  He made our visit memorable.

OqUdbhSDVfz51wJ1BkISqw.text: Executive summary:  We stayed in Vegas for 12 days; we ate at Phrank's four times.  There's Mexican food that's good for a hangover.  There's Mexican food that's good for kids.  Then, there's Phrank's.  Phrank is a humble man, and he claims that it's tough for him to put his finger on what makes his family's place so awesome.  I'll try to lay it out for you:  1.  The meat is unbelievably well prepared.  The carnitas are the perfect mix of seasoned tender goodness with that bit of crispiness on the top.  The chicken was moist, plump, perfectly seasoned, and changed our lives.  If giving up all my worldly possessions would result in my being able to eat the barbacoa every day, I would seriously consider it.  2.  The menu is not the typical hundred item monster that you find at your standard taqueria.  Phrank and Phamily know what they're good at, and they stick to it.  3.  Service, service, service.  This family knows how to keep customers happy.

2SFHAzuD4NAIDGzcvjuO4g.text: my husband and i went here about a week ago. i ordered whatever special they had that day and he ordered a steak burrito. the chicken (something) special was passable... it was essentially a small piece of chicken inside a wrap and fried... bland and plain but OK. the beans i didnt touch since they didnt look fresh or good. and the rice just looked and tasted bad.... my husbands was much worse than mine, his looked like it was precooked i dont think i need to explain how a precooked steak burrito tastes lol.  gross.  the only thing i actually appreciated about the place is that the owner was there and did offer to refill our drinks.... overall though would not go back based on the food.

cg3d23BM5b7H6lzuu5TRYQ.text: Awesome locally owned Mexican joint. Food and service were equally amazing. You have to try this place.

bruMpq78gJGW1OaxXPihyQ.text: I was a little hesitant to check this place out, why? Because it is a Mexican restaurant named, 'Phat Phrank's'. That saying, 'don't judge a book by it's cover' stands True, as I was able to get over the name and try this place out.  Everything I have had is absolutely yum to the max! My favs:  *Chips and Guacamole* the best!  Cheese Enchiladas Bean, Rice and Cheese Burrito Bean Tostada  Phat Phrank's is super reasonable and they deliver with no minimum charge.

ZhM2uQudtMXIYbnz9jtuTA.text: Absolutely love this place!  I stopped in on my lunch break yesterday and had the carne asada torta and it was incredible, the service was the best I can recall in a long time and the price was not at all bad.  I went in again for lunch today and ordered the carne asada burrito.  Phrank warned me it wouldn't be as good as the torta, but I beg to differ!  I enjoyed the burrito twice as much and this is now one of my favorite spots in Las Vegas!

C8M6goyaiWHaF5Qw1ooG_g.text: Very, very good fish tacos.  The other tacos are quite good too, just not great.  Definitely a great place to grab lunch during the work week.

GAa1D_QTokJQCCy_Rw931g.text: Phat Phranks is a short drive from my house and have been meaning to try it for some time now. The  6am to 6pm hours made it very difficult for me to eat there. They really should change to 8a-8pm at the very least so people could try it out after work. I am not a good morning person so chances were slim me trying to before work and after work it is closed already. I am so glad I finally go to test out Phat Phranks. It is right off the 215 and decatur.   I had the breakfast burrtio with egg and cheese and a bean and cheese tostada. The breakfast burrito was excellent. The only one better in town is at Nordstrom Cafe but for the price and the flavors packed into it, this is a solid #2. The Tostada was good but nothing too special. The food gets 4 stars. Frank  was the one taking the order and ringing you up. The family is the ones cooking and serving and they were very friendly, attentive and you get the feeling you are in their home and not in their place of business. There are so many businesses in Las Vegas that need to take a lesson from Phat Phrank's and learn what real service is. So with good food and service as good as good as it gets, not to mention an indy family owned place Phrank's easily get's 5 stars in my book. Support it and do it regularly because places like this need our support to survive. They are a rarity in Las Vegas and I will be doing my part supporting Phrank so I have options other than chains to go to.

SME_0qrOcoKqhw9iFFGCqA.text: Summary based on 1 lunch: --good, varied Mexican style food --very friendly, helpful service --inexpensive --easy parking --clean bathroom  Stopped here based on Yelp reviews looking for something in between LAS and the industrial parks to the south.  It worked out fine and I'd come here again.

9jA04QhrLHrWRGTixBfvVg.text: Today was the first time eating here. Was great. I had the fish tacos, they were good size and very tasty. The cilantro sauce on the was bomb. The owner Frank is a very nice guy. He gave me and my wife many samples. I will be back

NOessaA5-e_Xs61TNuVbMA.text: The food was over priced for a low quality meal. The food was served room temperature with cold salsa which doesn't make sense. The guacamole was the best part but that was also overpriced. It definitely wasn't cooked fresh. The yelp reviews definitely don't make sense.  Definitely wasn't impressed.

JJ7wl3hhdREw4idZe18ytg.text: The owners are really friendly and super attentive. The food was very good fed 9 for $56 and EVERYONE was full and happy.  The food is very flavorful. Child friendly atmosphere. Come visit and order the chile verse nachos and killer fish tacos!

J75YbKAQS60hRYScqmF_Kg.text: Phat Phrank's has become a MUST do whenever I head to Vegas. I have tried many different items and have discovered that their ceviche is the absolute best that I've ever had! It has a pretty good kick (you can see the bits of chile!)   If you are there for breakfast, you have got to try the huevos divorciados! You get two eggs, one with red chile and one with green. It comes with rice and beans and is beyond delicious! I want to make the four hour drive just thinking about it!  My cousin ordered the carnitas torta, which she kindly let me try. I cannot wait to go back and order that!  If you are a fan of churros, they make amazing ones! They drizzle chocolate and caramel over them, making them better than any amusement park's!  All the rest of the reviews talk about their amazing service, and it's True! Frank, oh, excuse me, "Phrank," is super nice and makes you feel incredibly welcomed!  Add this place to your Vegas to do list!

bwsQ0c0vKPopIYEbeTVphw.text: Phat Phranks is great! Real authentic Mexican food. Frank runs the place and man is he friendly. They hold Cruise Nights and its fun to sit, eat great food and mingle with a great crowd. I come here often as I can with my family.

RsoyFqO8JVXyML9lSyuBSg.text: The best fish tacos in Vegas!! Seriously we've tried many! We also love the ground beef, simple but delicious

Ff4sAUrOszi6IvtAg0_9TA.text: Excellent food and great service. We're really glad we found this place. Tacos were very good and breakfast burrito was excellent.

I0a9ki-BzLgITIPA_xvoUg.text: Haven't had a bad meal yet and I have been more than once... in fact maybe once a week.  Everything from breakfast burritos to flautas... we love the whole menu.  While having an overstuffed burrito isn't for the lite eaters (they have fish tacos, salad and shrimp fajitas for you) the burritos are more than a mouthful.  Easily missed is the nachos, but don't skip them.  They are simple, but loaded and a meal all by themselves.  Everything is made to order and fresh - no fast food here just fast service with a smile.  Frank makes the place welcoming to all who enter and he makes sure you leave full.  I hear he even makes a great burger (the Ph. D burger)... I am sure I will have one soon.  You don't have to count your pennies to eat here either... probably the most affordable place in town and you will always get more than your monies worth.  Go for breakfast... where else can you get a 15 cent cup of coffee with 2 refills now a days and he opens the doors at 4am for you early risers or late night workers - now I just need to convince him to open on Sundays!

M807socL6mUu7y0qJDJSOw.text: I'm from Southern Cali so I know good Mexican when I taste it. I came here not expecting much but then I had their salsa with my tostada and I was confused. I thought I was in Vegas, not back home in Cali. I have to give credit to taco shops that have not just salsa that has good heat, but salsa that actually had good flavor. zvEV3w1qebX8hf80CbWsJQ.text: I would question the veracity of the rating of this place.  The food and service do not match the ratings.  The food was pretty mediocre and overpriced for what they served.  Just typical mexican food.  The service left much to be desired.  They forgot part of our order.  No apologies whatsoever.

493013SEabZJeASu2T_LJw.text: Two words: Phuck yeah!!  Phrank himself took our order which consisted of a carne asada tostada for me and the chile verde nachos for my husband. A lady, who I'm assuming was Mrs. Phrank, cooked and then delivered our phood to our table, which was a nice touch. My tostada was double-layered with the refried beans being between the two tostada shells and the rest of the toppings on top. The carne asada was tender and tasty, and the serving was just enough to make a meal of. My husband's nachos were piled high with chile verde which tasted like it had been marinating and cooking for hours - like something they would serve at their own table at home. Phrank came out a little while later to see how we were doing and to deliver samples of the beef barbacoa, which was also top-notch. Phrank (who is a bit of a jokester) asked our names and shook our hands as we were leaving. Excellent phood, great prices and REALLY nice people. I phoresee becoming a regular in my phuture!!

os4-n-mOg5K_o0j3Yphnog.text: This place rocks the chimichangas outta me.  It's great food, great prices, and in an odd location (imo).  The portions are GIANOURMOUS!  Overall, great stop for some tacos.

Nr_V_xaz-RBsSxWZsrFEQQ.text: Phat Franks definitely deserves 5 stars for service and the food isn't too bad itself. I tried the carne asada breakfast burrito and I have to say I really like how they cooked the breakfast potatoes in the burrito, definitely a nice change of pace. The carne asada meat was seasoned to perfection and tasted like most fresh carne asada meats. The tortilla wasn't as good as Fausto's but the breakfast filling inside could give any any Fausto's/Robertos burrito a run for their money if not better.           My only complaint with this place is that I have actually been here several times only to realize they were closed. They're only open from 6am-6pm, which means its never open for dinnertime, or at least my dinnertime. 2nd they're not open weekends which is primetime burrito hour. That means no love from Phat Frank's on picnic Saturdays or hangover Sundays for some people. Ah well, all in all a good place.

LWYSvHbCx4i1VBerOHkl9Q.text: Stopped here with my family on our last trip to Vegas and we were very pleased with both the service and the food.The fish tacos were absolutely awesome!They were very flavorful.We also ordered the carne asada fries.They were the best! You've got to try this place! You won't be disappointed.

Mn76xeDhTB4QMqgQVZVqtA.text: Had a burrito here, with tamarindo beverage.  The food and beverage is excellent.  Location is a bit far that is why I only rate it with 4 stars.  Hope they open one close to home

mJz17RHa71kSt8I0wmnA3A.text: Yes, they have the perfect fish taco and that's why they get a 5 star. Absolutely wonderful. These are the fish tacos I've been searching for....lightly battered with the white cream sauce and they are big. The owner is super nice, but even if he was a jerk, I'd still go back for the damn fish tacos.

Cnq5tCyyTtJPFTwS4HbQIQ.text: Meeting new yelp friends is a great way of finding out about new places to eat. A friend came back to town, from Reno, to prep for his wedding and had some time to kill. He asked for Mexican food, I thought this was the perfect opportunity to try this place out.  After a few days of eating poorly; I was in much need of a salad, but still wanted to try something more traditional, and got a taco as well. The trainer's salad contained huge, moist chunks of white chicken breast. The two generous scoops of guacamole, a mound of cabbage, cilantro, and beans makes for a filling meal. The green salsa dressing was not too flavorful, but the pile of limes can fix that. The carnitas taco was the size of two tacos. It was like a mini salad to accompany my entree. The hot red salsa did not deliver. The thing about Pat Phrank's is that it is not your typical Mexican joint. It is not super greasy and is not overly seasoned. My two friends got burritos and they both were unimpressed. The lack of contrasting textures and temperatures does not help. Each burrito comes with your choice of meat, then beans and rice. All of the ingredients are hot and soft, the addition of guac, sour cream, or lettuce would give it the additional omph.   The service is the main reason this place gets four stars. The staff are stellar. The food comes out fast and they are attentive. During our meal, we had someone checking up on us for refills and if we needed anything more. After we finished we lingered around for 45 minutes and no one made us feel uncomfortable or rushed us out.

nFRSDjQOu4IaXlU0EUsXbQ.text: I don't know how often you check your reviews but I have to share my experience. I had my first brain surgery on July 10 and lost my sense of taste and smell from the traumatic brain injury and subsequent infection. When I was released from the hospital the second time we visited your establishment s few times as I tried to resume a "normal" life but nothing has really tasted like much for the last two months. I've been able to taste "sweet" and "salt" when there are chemicals like msg involved but food and drinks have basically tasted no better than dirt. I had another surgery last Thursday, this time to remove the infected piece of skull and clean out the YUCK from my brain. Friday morning I had black coffee and for the first time I could taste food again and that coffee was fantastic. I stayed in that hospital until yesterday morning and the normally bland hospital food was wonderful. The only thing I could think to do when leaving the hospital yesterday was to visit PHAT Phranks and test out my new taste buds but unfortunately time prevented that from occurring. Today I waited patiently until we could visit and I just finished my first green Chile smothered burrito. OH MY GOD!  I WANT TO CRY :) THANK YOU SO MUCH! It was a long two months without taste buds. I still can't smell anything- that may be a few months or never until that comes back but there were indications early today that it's returning slowly. THE BEST THING I'VE PUT IN MY MOUTH ON OVER TWO MONTHS!  I can't come back on the same schedule I once visited you guys but I will definitely be looking forward to my next visit. You guys are always so nice to me and my family and the food is delicious. Thank you again. I even think the twelve year old decided today he loved that green Chile burrito which is saying a lot considering he usually thinks ketchup is too spicy :)

rRZdiTGGisWpmES8roxEgQ.text: Maybe the adobada was not the proper choice for a first Phrank's experience. It was okay but not spectacular. The beans were quite garlicky but not bad. The rice was just blah. Now for the excellent guacamole-- it was fresh and flavorful!! It gave me hope that maybe I should give Phrank's another try on another day somewhere in the future.

q9UCK9AMmRZVXrVO2ubtGQ.text: Las Vegas is overrun with celebrity chefs -- Bobby Flay, Joel Robuchon, and Jose Andres all come to mind -- but my favorite Las Vegas chef these days is Frank Miranda, of Phat Phrank's fame (phame?).  Frank is running one of the best hidden spots in town.  I'd been there once before, but I recently visited again to try Frank's famous ceviche.  And it was just as outstanding as I'd been told.  I don't know how he finds such fresh fish in the middle of the desert.  Clearly Frank is a miracle worker.  The other highlight was tasting Frank's chimi cheesecake.  A tortilla stuffed with cream cheese, deep-fried, and then coated with generous cinnamon sugar and caramel?  Um, yes please!  Frank's little restaurant is a total gem.  So here's my tip to Californians driving up the northbound 15 to kick off a Vegas  weekend: A couple miles before you reach the Strip, make a little detour onto the westbound 215, and drive one exit to Decatur Blvd.  Phat Phrank's will be right there, waiting to fill your belly with delicious Mexican-American fare that's made with love.  (It's cheap too, leaving that many more benjamins in your wallet available for squandering at the casino.)

nCVoBWmhbF3O1BD4E4rHjQ.text: Possibly the best Mexican food in Vegas! I don't know how anyone could give Phat Phranks less than 4 stars.   The adobada torta is seriously amazing. They are mostly roberto's or roberto's quality, but this place exceeded my expectations. I'll be coming back.

I enjoyed my meal, but I don't think I'll be visiting again. For the price I can get a larger meal elsewhere

lEqn0bcG3-sNEXrzUK-VDw.text: My favorite Mexican spot in Las Vegas!! All of their food is outstanding. Being recently diagnosed with celiac disease I now have to eliminate gluten. I was so bummed. KgyOk9FmOMjqk4xPPU46Cg.text: Ok this is my 3rd and final review and what was once 4 stars is now 1. I love this places food but after today I'm done trying to support your business. I came in today 12/15 to order 1 plate and the lady tells me I'm sorry i just want you to know your order won't be ready for at least 30 minutes, we have a big catering order and our grill is full. Wow, so you filled up your entire grill and didn't allow for walk in customers to come in and be served in a decent timely manner. The place was empty. I purposely came at 2:30 because you guys are slowed down by then after lunch rush. I seriously liked your food enough to keep coming back despite your lack of hours, and then this. Good luck, I'm sure I'm not the only disappointed customer.   UPDATED REVIEW: I've never seen a restaurant only open Monday through Friday. First you were closed on Sundays, now on Saturdays. As popular as you are, you should not be closed on a Saturday. Disappointed customer   Finally got to try this place out. Price is RIGHT!! Food is great and horchata is so good. By no means is this authentic Mexican food, but it is yummy and that's all that matters. Even my 4 year old stuffed herself! Customer service is great and the restaurant was well kept.
