XADtysOUqTIG9C4pVKMQgA.text: Based on the service alone 5 stars !! Frank is such a nice guy and the food was great ! My wife had the Beef Enchiladas with ground beef and a fried egg that was cooked perfectly!! I had the Fish tacos and they were amazing other than the tortilla falling apart ( recommend two tortillas) the beans and rice were good!! The HOT SAUCE was  just the way I like it !!   Everything was great and glad we came in !! Looking forward to trying the Chili Verde Burrito next time we are in !!   By the way the chips are made in house and everything is fresh and made to order !! Pretty Hot and Tasty!!

20GzerEQgQQbI9XOViEJxg.text: If you are in the mood for some excellent and fast Mexican food, find your way to Phat Phrank's.  The burritos are amazing, the meat seasoned perfectly and the homemade chips and salsa are a must.   The restaurant doesn't have much seating and the lunch rush could have you waiting, but it is totally worth it.

rREL2TcvVSK_u0Xbtqq7aA.text: I work down the street & I frequent them for breakfast time.  Food: 5/5. Delicious, fresh. I love their salsas & guacamole. Their meats are seasoned well. The quality of the food is always consistent.  Customer Service: 2/5. C'mon ladies, cheer up! Smile, be friendly! You are the face of the company & your demeanor is what leaves the lasting impression, aside from the food of course.   I get my food to go, but even then they're not the friendliest over the phone & when you go to pay for your order. I rarely get a smile & a hello.

pcbppOqpKih3_M4cnV7igQ.text: Stopped for breakfast before leaving Vegas. This food was better than our $140 meal the night before. If I ever came back to Vegas, this is where you'll find me. The barbacoa was out of this world. Fiance had egg and bacon burrito and he was a happy camper. Just because we were happy, we had to get a torta de Carne asaa for the road; 4 hours later, completely satisfied.

TANqu-VR4z-2yfpa1_c8tA.text: I was curious to try this restaurant after such good reviews. They have several good options available on the menu. However, I was taken aback with the cleanliness and atmosphere of the restaurant. The menus looked so dirty and disgusting that it was  gross to touch them.  The atmosphere was boring and the chairs were uncomfortable. The quality of the service was very average and unmemorable.   Our meals were nicely presentable and looked appealing. The problem is that the food did not taste very fresh. I ordered a torta Adovada and the pork was crunchy and over cooked. It felt like the pork has been cooked for a long time and reheated. We had the same issue with our burrito. The tortilla was so soggy that it was hard to enjoy.  I can see why some people like it as their salsas are good and give the food a good taste. However, the overall experience was more disappointing than agreeable.

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Barbacoa  torta
Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile verde burrito

fsuT8Eqh4EClxbEC_OeDyw.text: This place is not what I was expecting, but delicious. I ordered the Asada torta and it was delicious. The meat was seasoned just right, and the bread was delicious. My sister ordered the trainer salad and the chicken was moist and seasoned perfectly as well. I can around noon and it was very crowded, I ordered ahead and the wait time was about 35 minutes so I recommend planning ahead before getting there.

UhIjo7hKcpjdlvSWrAIxrQ.text: Phat Frank's serves a Very Generous and Delicious portion of Quality food!  I left Full and Happy!  Had the Chili Verde Burrito!  One of the Best Burritos I have ever Enjoyed!    Frank is also an Excellent Host and is a Pleasure to talk to and he goes the Extra Mile to make sure you are Satisfied.  I will definitely be back!!!

L4V-_rbKIhsMMdGPFqQoNg.text: We stopped here on a recommendation by a friend on our way out of vegas, best decision ever. Hands down they hand one of the best tortas I've ever had. It's honestly such a hidden gem. I can't wait to go back.

VFIvDSCGweIYey6s7POCCw.text: My wife and I had lunch here in October 2018.  We were first time visitors to Las Vegas and we searched on the internet for some Mexican lunch food convenient to where we were traveling in town.  We got lucky:  this place is great!  The food was excellent -- nothin fancy, just basic good Mexican food.  I like enchiladas and I was pleased that I could order one or two or three enchiladas on the plate.  Basically you create your own platter.  I liked the refried beans (not an upscale recipe, just delicious and just the way I like). My wife had carnitas and she was happy.  Highly recommended.

EO6QLvEP9FH2m0PmE2beRA.text: We landed in Las Vegas and started driving towards our hotel in rush hour traffic. Being pregnant and hungry, my goal was to find a place to eat. Fast. We happened upon Phat Phrank's and walked in just as they were closing. Frank, the owner, offered to serve us anyway, so I ordered the trainer salad (with a lot of modifications) and my husband ordered three different flavors of tacos. The service was excellent, the food arrived quickly, and everything was delicious. We enjoyed the food and the service so well that we would have come back for breakfast, but it would have taken 20+ minutes and I needed to be somewhere at 8am. We'll definitely head back to Phat Phrank's the next time we're in Vegas.

yXZDQvDm8JuE5CjgYVIQTg.text: Try the barbacoa taco much better than the carne asada taco.  The owners are there so they care... how refreshing.

KfgCGw2h9goLVrfuDpqo-w.text: REAL Mexican food in Las Vegas!  Love it!!

vB0Qsh3ierASO3-t3_RQcg.text: I've only tried the carnitas burrito, which turned out to be disappointing.  It was stuffed full of pork, but not much else.  It was also bland and dry.  However, the owner, Frank, and his staff create a very friendly and inviting atmosphere.  It is apparent that he cares about the restaurant and his customers.  Again, I have only tried the one item, so this review is purely based on that alone.  It is definitely possible that the other menu items are much better.

G9GSGuupxtvkrkGDNXn0nw.text: I am not a Mexican food aficianado; however, Phat Phrank's has made a believer out of me.  Have been there several times and I love that the quality and taste of the food is always consistent.  This is not the case with many restaurants and the number one reason I don't return.  The flautas rock, the breakfast burritos are huge, tasty and filling and the menudo is top notch.  AND, the staff is so friendly and welcoming.  We have a winner here and I highly recommend you make a trip to PP's and check it out.  You won't be sorry.

NNU7kwTdACl8HDqPmfxpog.text: If you want the menu on the wall, this is NOT a place for you. Go to Roberto's or Felipito's (both equally nasty) for that because Phat Phranks is way to CLEAN & CLASSY for you to appreciate it. Seriously!  CLEAN menus are on the CLEAN counter for you to peruse prior to ordering.   CLEAN utensils are on the wall in dispensers for you to take from. It's not a free for all where grubby people with their grubby hands are fondeling the utensils.   CLEAN tables await you.   Food is FRESH...you can taste the difference...and made to order. Not greasy. No "fat only" steak burritos here. Chicken burritos are made from the breast, not from various chicken parts lying around. Green sauce has bits of pork in it.   The owner & all the staff are friendly. Your order is brought to your table once ready whether its dine in or take away.  Prices are reasonable.   Different clientele frequents this hidden gem at Sunset & Decatur doors down from the AMPM & Cafe Berlin. If you're sick of nasty Mexican food from these other joints, try this place. The cleanliness alone will blow your mind.

KFZemR5t1wD5EpzMYiYQlA.text: This place is amazingly good. Kind of mom and pop place. Very small. There are only very few tables and they are packed usually during lunch hours. Come early or a bit later will usually do the trick :) but you have to try their Adobada Torta. It's amazing. So good! And their churros. YUM! Mr. Phrank also very nice and gave a free dessert to my friend when I took her there for her birthday lunch. The dessert given was like cream cheese filled tortilla, deep fried, and drizzled with caramel sauce. Wow.

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The delicious adobada torta!!! So yummy. And look at that amazing Cherri&#39;s

LyMx5fDx2iPfE-uUgwIhkw.text: Real good Mexican food. The place is small and gets packed quick around lunch time, but after eating the food I see why. Frank the owner actually takes time out to speak to all of his customers. I recommend the carne asada tacos and the green sauce is real good. I will be back real soon.

G_qgDkm_2Lpc67ZunwtPiw.text: Delicious!   Drove by with my work husband on the way to a morning biz mtg and enjoyed a fabulous breakfast burrito and huevos rancheros. Nice people, great food!

jlzLlHAXYwphR8A89PQFfw.text: Amazing service!  We got the barbacoa breakfast burrito and a torta. Definitely the best breakfast burrito I've ever had and the torta was delicious great flavors and the sauce on it was amazing! Definitely coming back every time we're in Vegas!

mnVeOdW6rZ-piaxn7iGlOQ.text: This place is really good. I ordered the Carne Asada Torta and a Bean Tostata. The Torta had plenty of juice tender steak, torta roll was grilled in butter, the sauce was great and had tins of vegies on it. I actually ate the sandwich open face because there was so much everything going one. Wonderful stuff.  The bean tosta was large and topped with veggies...very creamy beans. I tried all 3 salsas and the pass perfecty. Not watery, nice and thick with great heat. If you are looking for a nice little spot off of 215 to grab a bite and go north, south east or west. They are very well located.  You will find a winner!

ifUdXxqVnhFQcXRyZByimg.text: Finally found a hearty Mexican restaurant worth eating at! You can tell the food is made fresh and the place is clean

u0NdRrdzfnR8Bbr3d5POWw.text: Meh. Lots of small annoyances and not much good to tall about.  Parking lot is very cramped and congeated. But worse yet, the spaces are all mini spaces. If you drive an suv, you're almost touching both lines simultaneously. I have a small car and had to squeeze out of it.  Not enough space in the dining room, it was packed for lunch. The lady at the counter just kinda looked at me instead of greeting. Then barely holds her hand out to return my card, I had to lean over the entire counter to get it back. I say thank you, she says nothing at all.  Pork carnitas plate. It was decent, kinda small. Took 25 minutes to come out. 25 minutes. Horrible.  When they deliver your food, they don't say anything. Just drop it off. You then have to get up, find your way to the fork and napkin dispensers and get your own stuff.  All in all, the food was okay, but I won't be back. Way too many inconveniences and lack of pleasant service attitude

opSk3d22fLziYQyLcjtsgA.text: Really good tacos! They are huge! The carnitas tacos are my favorite. It's a small place and gets very busy at lunch time (because it's so good obviously)

ypWshACoaNEGR1Jb28sXSg.text: Stopped here on our way back to SLC from SoCal hoping to have good Mexican food based on all the great reviews on Yelp. Don't even bother with this place! The food is tasteless! Bland! Now I understand why the cashier was so insistent that I get salsa with my food! What a waste of time and money! Also, the cashier was not friendly at all. Bad attitude! And when my  husband, who is a Central American native, asked for a carne asada burrito using the appropriate Spanish pronunciation she corrected him with her English pronunciation. Skip this place!

fSJ1gVeV4v6hY5fGVS58BA.text: Came back quite a few times after writing my last review and I haven't been beyond satisfied every single time. My boyfriend and I come here whenever we are on this side of town and we always get extra salsa to take home. He usually get the carne Asada burrito. I usually get the taco combo either carnitas or carne Asada. Always delicious. Going to venture out and try the chile verde burrito next time since it is what they are known for! Customer service is always great, the girls always joke around with me because of the smell I bring in from work (similar to something you might smell a few doors down) I smell amazing. Can't wait to go back to the south side of town to come here again. Yummm!

snA4CuCIDM-KNQHkU09MLQ.text: So I've been to Phat Phrank's a couple times over the last year. Admittedly, my first time there I wasn't totally blown away. Don't get me wrong - I did think the food was fantastic, but I distinctly remember thinking it was an easy 4* place, but not really deserving of the big 5*.  Somehow, though, every time I've visited since - no matter how little time has passed since my last trip there - I take my first bite and always wind up thinking to myself, "wow, this is even better than I remembered". I don't know how they do it, whether it's the fresh ingredients, top notch execution, or the little touches they add to the preparation that just give the food here that wonderful delightfulness that foodies always seek.  So yeah, the tortas (either adobado or carnitas, depending on my mood) have basically reached comfort food status in my book. Order some beans, rice, and sour cream add-ons as supplements, and life is very good when I visit Phat Phrank's.

eRhBgIHJg83CClOEO5IOag.text: My go to spot for all things mexican food. Have been coming here since their grand opening. Frank is a genuine awesome man that greets you when you order. Try the nachos. No try the carnitas torta. No try the tostada. No try the breakfast burrito. All i can say is youll be back for more. Awesome awesome food!

tmDo6AiUuqiAafhpIITwSw.text: SOLID, better than a lot of the other "local Vegas" places you can go..     You know it's going to be good when the owner is still active in the restaurant.   He was working the register and really wanted to serve clients right.   We talked a bit about Wahoos, his goal of having a restaurant in every state, not selling out (but that's okay... ), wanting to be private like In-N-Out..... anyhow about the food  I had the CARNITAS TORTA.   It was very well executed.   One of the best mexican-american tortas that I've ever had.    Loved that they used fresh ingredients like first generation mexican but tasted americanized in a very good way.   Reminds me to an mexican version of Jack Urban Eats (Sacramento) and a similar quality to Guisados (East LA).

-oDpet39cQtnTmH3_HYKzA.text: Fist time here.  Decided to try a Torta  Carne Asada .  Kinda hard to drop the ball on that.   Impressed with how good it tasted .  I will definitely be back to try other stuff.    Hopefully then we can get this to 5stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qDgm0EMDgTTWhFfcTSebVQ.text: I order a salad after my cousin. 3 people after me order. My cousin gets his food. Then after 15 mins everyone else that was after me gets their order. Hm forgetful much? Even asked if my food was coming out and didn't appreciate it when the cashier said yes and still people getting their orders besides me. Didn't even apologize. First and last I go here. Definitely not worth your time.

d0QWDsGY2wodevjWCBpnAQ.text: I love Phat Phranks! Their food is always delicious and fresh... they even make their guacamole to order!!! Hands down the best chorizo burrito I have ever had in my life, their carne asada is always tender and never chewy, and like I said before their guacamole is always made fresh, as you order it. The restraunt is always clean and neat and the staff were soooo nice the first time I came in and remeber you so quickly, it's like you're instant family. Love this place!

_NkXKHRbsLaGpo3yVOX_4g.text: I was visiting a client down the street and found this on my Yelp App. Located in a odd spot and smaller I was greeting by Phrank the owner who is from Redlands CA. Phrank took the took the time taking orders personally and even came out to the dinning area and made sure everyone was happy! Now that's service.   After placing my order with Phrank at the counter my food arrived within minutes is seemed like. I saw good reviews for the fish tacos and went with the fish taco combo plate. Tacos were yummy, sizable pieces of deep fried fish with cabbage and a light white sauce. I added some salsa which gave my tacos a nice kick. The beans and rice were also good.   Phat Phank's has been here two years and it's nice to see a non big box place chain do well. I'm looking forward to coming back and trying the tacos and burritos - prices are reasonable and service is great.

Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish taco combo

A0JXfOj4IkJrjoxrPGmq8A.text: Tried this place today as I recently began working in the area and drove by it a couple times. I was not disappointed. Had the Carne Asada burrito and it was hands down the best quick-serve type burrito I've had in time that I can remember. The Carne Asada was amongst the best (if not the best!) I've ever had, and the beans and cheese supplemented wonderfully. I tried their hottest salsa, it was delicious with just the right amount of heat. The burrito was comparable in size to a Chipotle burrito, but much better. The building itself is a smaller, diner type place. If you happen to be in this part of Vegas, I definitely recommend giving this place a try. Very convenient and the price is right.

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada burrito

ybvhlFBOYqHsS3KSJor3qg.text: This place is really good!! It exceeded my expectation as far as what I heard. I really love little family owned joints like this just because I feel as though the workers care a little more about the food and over all its a more homey feel. No commercial franchise nonsense. The tacos i had were amazing, i had a bite of my friends red chile burrito... amazing. The salsa was awesome. I can't wait to go back :)

a6F8bIQg2lBL0cOPowadQg.text: Here's the thing, the food is great, I mean literally one of the best breakfast burritos in vegas....... but..... by no means is a potato egg cheese and bacon breakfast burrito worth $8.00!!! I mean really? Another price increase? If making this burrito cost that much I feel you are doing something wrong. I have literally been coming to this place from they day they opened their doors. Sadly unless I win powerball.... my blue collar self will have to eat somewhere else.   Love the Food, No where worth the price they are charging for specific items. Lunch is a better value I guess.   Update!!!! I got a better Job and can now afford the best breakfast burrito in town without feeling broke after eating it!   Phat Phranks is, and will still be my go to for breakfast!  ( The Tortas are amazing too!)

bpAFZjQEV0qiM0pAra61Kg.text: Not bad. Not bad at all. I got the two taco combo with Carne Asada and a Fish Taco. Rice was delicious. Beans were overly salty. Tacos were delicious.   Only improvement would be frying the taco shell to give it some structure.   Bottom line: I'll come back for the tacos.

JOpkCcKuNACHSdDf4D-Xdg.text: The carne asada fries I got from Phat Phrank's were super tasty. Good portion size and the toppings were delicious. But this review is more for Frank than the food. I walked in and he greeted me with a smile. We had a nice conversation about marriage and how to keep it going and he gave me some sound advice. Thanks Frank,   - Codi from San Diego!

t3zWQKqf1BqXAAKMQGgA9Q.text: While driving around I happened to see Phat Phrank's. Immediately looked online to get some info about it. All I can say is, it makes justice to all the reviews. I ordered one of their specialties the Adobada Torta. The roasted pork was so tender and juicy. If I had the chance to change something was the level of spiciness. Definitely overpowered the flavor of the meat. However, I found it delicious since I gratefully had a big cup of delicious Horchata!   Service was good and the place is sparkling clean!   Definitely a restaurant I would visit again if visiting Las Vegas some day!

2f5ML2qQ_oZG4X1p7A5ArQ.text: Great food, I tried the signature torta and fish tacos. The torta was interesting because the bread is flat but also crispy and delicious. It didn't get soggy like most tortas and the flavor is on point. The fish tacos are cooked to perfection, crispy and flaky in the center drizzled with a house aoli and topped with loads of cabbage and green onions. Both meals where ruffly $10 and well worth it. Great lunch spot with a great menu and I like there personal flare and touch on the items I tried. I'll be back for sure and don't hesitate to try this place if you're in the area.

thnIUrwTwcQzk_bMnJyoQg.text: Another great meal made fresh by the hands of a mom and pop operation. With all the great Mexican food all over Vegas I appreciate how Phrank's is a taste of it's own. My torta and tostada along with their house-made salsa were completely delicious. I need to eat here more often and I recommend you do too.

Best fish tacos I've had here in Vegas! Frank the owner has the best attitude and is so friendly and inviting while his daughter is back there cooking her butt off! I'd highly recommend the green salsa it's a lil spicy but so flavorful! Also the torta is soooo yummy! Can't wait to go back and try more of this menu!

CQz1nkcuTPH9cOtRb61ATw.text: Walked into a lonely Phat Phrank's and who was there to take my order? Yup, phat frank himself. Since it was my first time in, i would start off with a carne asada burrito and test the waters. The guacamole was so cold, that it cooled the whole burrito! I can forgive that usually. But the meat. The meat looked like it was being held in a too hot steam table for most of the day. It was 2 pm when I walked in. It had Too much gristle, and looked like it's bought pre cubed. The meat looked like over cooked ground beef.  In short, at least for this visit... I would have to say a poor attempt at Robertos. And Robertos is , well, you know!  I gave it a 2 star, because phat frank was polite and welcoming. Sorry frank , will not be coming back in.

3S1jwbLNk_2XMWcSevvJnw.text: Was so excited to give this place a try after hearing from my husband and 2 other people how great it was, but... yelp and google say their open until 9pm drove across the city, got to the restaurant at 8:05pm to see the doors locked and lights off. Their sign at restaurant says open until 7pm but everything online says 9pm. Now we're off find something else, so disappointed.   After getting a message back this morning from the restaurant, claiming they were in fact open, it will not allow me to reply back. The door we're locked, so I am not sure how they were open. I would've really loved to try the food and not gone looking for something else.

YQRhZSrvmWgm5IEl5j16pQ.text: So me and my boyfriend were searching for breakfast burritos on our way back to Los Angeles and stumbled along Phat Pranks. We purchased a chorizo and a ham burrito and they were sooooooo goood!!! The salsa verde and roja were so well accompanied with the burritos! Definitely cannot wait to go back to Las Vegas in December to eat another burrito. Kinda wish they added beans or queso fresco but that's just personal preference. Keep up the great work!

mDE1CmoPFSc11LcF9__gxg.text: Stopped by on way home, got a couple things to share!   A Carne Asada Torta, which was fantastic, great meat and flavor. Tried it with both red and green salsas.  Like them both.   They also had Pozole on special, not sure if it was just today or on specific days, but it's great! Lots of corn and some meat, we have some left, so maybe there's lots more meat at bottom. Threw some cilantro and lime juice on it too.   I don't live close to this place, but I will definitely be back to try other stuff. Skip Roberto's and other mid-type Mexican food if you're in the area and go here instead.

Zm-Y4Ja3GBQsuFroPh5JcA.text: Great Mexican option if you're in the neighborhood. The service is friendly, the food is amazing, and the price point is decent at the ~$10 range.  I recommend the fish tacos, with a side of chips and green salsa. The tacos have a small brick of ridiculously crispy fish and topped with a small pile of cabbage and their own "secret" sauce. I love to pile loads of their green salsa and hot sauce onto it to add extra flavor and heat. My only gripe is that the tortilla falls apart under all that weight, and I have to finish off the meal with a fork. If you come with a pal, get the side of chips and green salsa with extra chips if you like heat and you're extra hungry. The chips are perfectly thin, crispy, and addictive.  Overall, definitely recommend Phat Phrank's. The only time disappointment and Phat Phrank's go together is when I'm craving fish tacos for dinner and realize they're closed.

Iqw_rSVxANdhU-1vN8ichw.text: Nice Taco shops by Decatur and 215 Clean place I order enchilada with cheese and chicken, Fish Taco and Chimi cheese cake for desert my friend did not warn me that the chimi will be very hot so becareful when you try to down it in one bite cause its really hot give it time to cool down its a rolled chorus with cheese in the middle with caramel toppings that why I got excited wrong move but it was good.
