XQKARkYheofNKEpHgKzqiA.text: OMG I totally love this place. Their food is authentic and it tastes like one that your grandma would cook. Staff is friendly and music is great. I love the chile verde pork plate... hmmmm makes me want to go there right now.

aOu3N3yQfC56XDHQVvGVqg.text: My first time here was today. Will so be returning for the adobada torta!  I don't know about the other choices but I'm so glad I picked this item for lunch today. Everything about the torta was perfection and abundant!  I was greeted and, my order taken by Phrank himself. Big friendly smile and very helpful. 5 stars for the torta but overall 4 stars because the lemonade listed on the menu is some weird flavored Kool-Aid drink that is not lemonade, big difference.  I can't wait to go back ! So super yummy

S4JcU8i62ZoMIhm1z5SNpg.text: Saw some super great reviews for this place. And since Mexican food is one of my passions in life I was excited to try it out!  The set up was very casual - Staff was friendly and laid back. I ordered a simple Bean Tostada and a Carne Asada Taco. The meat on the taco was very tasty. The rich and savory meat paired well with the soft tortilla and cabbage on top. The tostada had a small layer of beans toped with lettuce, cheese and tomato. Super simple (which I enjoy), but it came out pretty cold.   The prices here are great. Less than $3 for each of these menu items. I would like to come back and try a full burrito and see how the tasty meat and so-so beans hold up next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LG4mdohvXF7NOoGfCfSzQA.text: Uh.... wow. Phat Phrank is a genius. We dropped in to grab a quick lunch off the strip. I am so excited to go back I can't handle it. Phrank was manning the register and I had no idea what to order. I asked him for his top two recommendations. There are some articles on the wall next to the counter and they each had 1 dish pictured.   I went with the Adobada Torta. It took a few minutes to make and was totally worth it. The sandwich explodes with flavor. I have no clue what marinade is used but it is mind blowing. The bread was toasted perfectly and it help back the fresh cut lettuce and cilantro beautifully. My mouth is watering thinking about that sandwich. If he was open on Sunday's I would be there right now.  You rock Phrank!

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The wet burrito is the bomb!
Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Even the chips are awesome!
Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tacos with beans and rice.

qe9H2oqLPcfnYF4aPSzfIw.text: Great chorizo breakfast burrito! Frank is a great host and the food is worth the drive no matter where you're coming from!

ApZb2I_8pCmrku4JONzVow.text: After reading many other reviews, and needing to get some really decent Mexican grinds going on, I suggested this location to my former boss and coworker who is moving out of state.  Upon entering we were warmly greeted by Frank, who reminded me of my best friend's family and all of her uncles who warmly greet you and treat you like a compadre even though its your first meeting.  I observed him warmly greeting his regulars by name.  Frank kindly explained to us that you order at the counter and then they bring the order(s) to your table.  The food is brought out quickly once the order is placed.  There were a lot of choices and really hard to decide but ultimately we both ordered the chile verde combo plate (rice, beans and tortillas) with a med. drink that was this week's special for $7.89 each.  The combo plate was excellent and reminded me of eating at my best friend's house who are Hispanic, so I grew up eating the "good stuff".  Frank also explained and presented to us 4 small cups of different types of salsas, pico de gallo, I think a tomatillo sauce all which tasted fresh and yummy!!  My tablemate took the 2 milder sauces and I took the two others.  The red sauce was pleasantly hot and was very tasty.  I liked the green sauce also.  Frank and his family who were also are servers made sure are drinks were refilled and never made us feel unwelcomed as we sat for close to 3.5 hours at a table talking.  We only wished he served cocktails, so we could at least pay for our extended stay. Frank did mention he may be in the process of obtaining his liquor license to serve beer and wine.  It sounded like he may also open on Saturdays again when he gets this license and Sunset Road opens up.  Let's hope so and because its hard for me to get to this place on the weekdays.  Oh yeah, Frank also provided a sample of his barbacoa which was succulent and tasty.  he described a sandwich they make, and that may be my next choice.

3TmdMf-f2WnEfvPdCnoqJQ.text: This place is great!  We stumbled across this gem as we were starting the trip back home from Las Vegas.  Yelp gave this place good reviews so we decided to give it a shot.  When you walk in you will realize that it doesn't feel like your typical Mexican joint.  There is no mariachi music playing and no Mexican flags on the walls.  Instead there are musical instruments mounted as decorations and pleasantly soft background music.  The restaurant itself is in a little shopping plaza by a gas station.  It has a clean, newly remodeled feel to it.  Enough with the atmosphere... We went to the counter to place our orders and had the privilege to meet Phrank the owner.  He was a super friendly guy and welcoming.  I ordered the shredded beef and my wife had a vege burrito.  Everything tasted fresh and had nice, balanced flavors.  My burrito was a nice size and not overly huge like some places serve.  I will definitely make this a recurring stop for future Vegas trips.

Bb3BlKvQJ3UKPW2CP7wEcw.text: Famished from an afternoon of shopping, we took a turn into this lot on Decatur, and headed for the deli. To our surprise, there were three fast casual choices in this restaurant row. Since all the menus were posted in the windows, we surveyed our options. We decided on trying something new and patronized Phat Phranks.  Although the name sounds like a hot dog stand to me, it's actually Mexican food.  The restaurant has a strange hodge podge of decor. It's Asian/musical? But spotless, clean and cute nonetheless.  The man at the counter could not have been more welcoming and polite. I assume this was Phrank, as he was featured in pictures on the wall. He asked if we had been before an then walked us through the menu.  After a tantalizing description, we both settled on a carnitas and Carne asada torta. The sandwiches were awesome!! Soft bread griddled crisp and filled with flavorful, tender meat, crisp, fresh shredded cabbage, cilantro, and onion.  The bread was smeared with a refreshing white creamy sauce.  Phrank had explained they use the same stuff on their fish tacos.  The sandwiches are served with lime wedges and 4 types of fresh salsa.  All had great flavor.  We decided we preferred the carne asada slightly more than the carnitas but loved both. The menu included lots of choices for tacos, burritos, tortas, nachos, salad, flautas and so on.  We wereso happy when we left and spent $16 for lunch for two with two drinks.   Phrank even stopped by our table 3 times to check on our level of happiness.  He offered more salsa, and refilled our drinks!   Bottom line - the food rocks! The service will blow your expectations out of the water! I can't wait to go back!

cHtu5nr7PVY8TS_PtyggFw.text: Hey Las Vegas Latinos! From one Latino to another...Phat Phranks is by far the BEST Mexican food in town!

W8Zv0Ory3CbH5ALwal6Yhw.text: Chorizo and Eggs Burrito freaking amazing!!!! Nuff Said

nIy4KfqOd9aVW9C0DwMfwA.text: Delicious mexican food!  Chili relleno and taquitos were fantastic.  Frank is super friendly.  I will definitely be back to try more of the items on the menu.  Love locally owned businesses.

7lHSyxEW3XvtcIiP8luKVw.text: So I stopped at Phat Phrank's for a breakfast burrito.  I've eaten there in the past and it was good, plus I figured how hard is it to make a breakfast burrito.  So I order the bacon breakfast burrito (3 to be exact), menu says potatoes, bacon and cheese.  Ok, cool.... First, they didn't have any pico de gallo, what mexican restaurant doesn't have pico?  Ok whatever, so I get the burrito and open it, ugh, it was nothing but 3 slices of greasy bacon, cheese and I think I counted 4 small pieces of potato.  It needed potato to soak up all the GREASE!  I would have gotten better at Roberto's.  I can't believe someone would serve a greasy mess wrapped inside a tortilla.  Almost $20.00 for 3 burritos!  Never again sorry.

f7z686_dS-9Ox4qV_wbvfg.text: I have lived in La Vegas since 1994 and I have NEVER had a fish taco like Phat Pranks.  Awesome, fresh food, not greasy.   Frank works behind the counter and greets people with hospitality that is unheard of in Las Vegas.  The tortas are also delish.   Prices are great, you can get  lunch for about $7-$10.  Give it a try, I have added Phat Phranks to my list of yumminess.

iwmCL_GwaNockyS5EiW5NA.text: This place is just ok. I'd stop by again if I was in the area maybe, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here. They didn't melt the cheese on our nachos and we had to walk through a cloud of several employees smoke when we walked out. I don't know why places don't realize that employees should smoke out back.

DOcxz3WVPY2Dpm7I5lEObQ.text: This is truly good Mexican food - their tacos are light and delicious , lots of meat and extremely good flavor.  There Barbacoa anything is great, and their chicken is all white meat and flavorful.  One thing better than their food is their service.  The owner has been there every time I stop by, with the family cooking in the kitchen.  This is a place I will gladly go to and eat to support a working family, and eat their amazing food in return.

w6-_-q-pi7OCORFekOy2NQ.text: My favorite place ever! I go almost everyday on my lunch break. All of the staff is always so warm and inviting, they welcome you in with a huge smile. Their food is AMAZING! The adodada ( seasoned pork) is to die for! YOU NEED TO EAT HERE! :)

moi3u0fzbqtQxOpcuk6uQA.text: Red chile and deep fried jalapenos are yummy.

PKKLhjB8c0tovq53zNEufw.text: My wife read about Phrank's in a magazine on a recent trip to LV and insisted we try it. Am I glad she did! Her fish tacos were excellent, but my Adobado torte was spectacular, one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. Had a nice chat with Phrank too as there was no one else in the place. Highly recommended.

51GA_PHgV3G19WBh2ZlkvA.text: Phat Phranks treats you like family...or maybe I should say Phamily!  They provide friendly service, great home cooking, and good prices.  Frank makes it a point to know your name and remembers you; not too many places can do that after one visit. I had one of the best pork tacos I have ever tasted.  The salsas are wonderful, my favorite is the verde salsa. Everything I have tried has been very good (fish tacos, enchiladas, burrito, chips, and tostados.)  I can't wait to go back and try the breakfast burrito and green chile burrito.  Give it a try, you will be glad you did.

uIlpboENGRda3eZdprjDlw.text: Hungry and off the beaten path, found Phrank and ate delicious authentic Mexican food. Nice family. Great service. Yum! (Not the healthiest, but it is called Phat Phrank's.)

qpXnNGEhbxQxSgT8iQuGmQ.text: First time I stopped there was after 6 pm on a Friday. I didn't realize they closed at 6 pm on Friday. Went back the next week for lunch and had a chicken burrito. Nothing terribly adventurous but good quality food at the right price. Service was exceptional. They do most of their business for breakfast so I must return

zeLRcW47tD2qEZib8V5Lzw.text: been to phat phranks twice. i eat a alot of food so ive tried all the tacos and a carne asada tostada. everything was good. the fish tacos are definitely my favorite though. my least favorite is the slow cooked pork taco. the meat was too dry for me. food is definitely good but a overpriced a taco is $3 and a fish taco is $5 like i said i eat alot so i usually order about 5 tacos and bill ends up being $20.

gRxNz09XXTp_KQ4U-h4C4g.text: I had Phat Phranks for the first time last night with one of my girl friends. We were both craving some great mexican food and I told her we should try this place because I always see it on my way to the gym and I thought the name was great! We both had the chicken burrito, which was REALLY good!! The salsa was yummy and they gave us a sample of their barbacoa (delicious!). "Phrank" himself was sooo nice and very engaging. He was telling us about their food, how they prepare it, and how bomb their bfast burritos are. What made this place stand out from the many other similar resturants, besides their food, was the service we received. Both my friend and I are in the hospitality industry for high end hotels, and we were both blown away by the personal service we received. We intend on going back quite often :)

Nbh_4zeddg-hAVDZFp0wGA.text: Had a sausage breakfast burrito today and it hit the spot this morning.  The burrito was huge and will cure anyone's hunger pangs.

0iC0D5dL5W-g4p1xiODC-g.text: OMG!! Love me some Phat Phranks!!! Although I have the same thing every time I go I still love it. I always order the barbacoa (dont know if this is spelled right) burrito. The meat is amazingly seasoned/marinated! Pure perfection!! Sometimes I change it up and make it wet and it is just as delicious. Frank recently added on a desert and OMG is it to die for. I think he calls it a Chimichurro?? But it is amazing. I recommend this place to anyone. Oh and Frank is the most awesome owner ever. He is personable and is very welcoming to all his customers!

8eD6cfdeDK3pRpg6wcDZVQ.text: For a cheap local quick mexican place, this place is the ticket. I've been back here almost weekly since I started working in the area and am slowly making my way through the menu. One thing that really stood out to me is how moist the rice is. It is perhaps the best mexican rice I've had at any sort of local mexican place like this.  Make sure to try the enchiladas :)

YpZm8lZgJmkFZ5G44OWGCQ.text: About a week ago I left San Diego to ride in the desert for a few days.  I was using Vegas as my launching point for Utah and Az, and it wasnt a couple of day before I started craving machaca (I AM from SD afterall) for breakfast.   I wasn't expecting anything on the strip so I began exploring the adjacent ave's. I passed on the first taco-joint that I came across to not sell myself short.  This was fortunate because 10 minutes later (unheard of in So-Cal) I found this little desert rose.  I was apprehensive because it was in a strip mall and I found the name with the "ph" somewhat unappealing. Not judging a book by its' cover, I gave it a shot.   I feel compelled to INSIST that Phrank's is a stop if you are in the area.  I was taken in warmly by the proprietor and made to feel that my gamble was in fact just another pre-conceived notion DYING to be dispelled. Though machaca wasnt on the menu, the suggestion of the huevos racheros with the salsa verde was so good it'll make you wanna slap yo mamma! I found the portions satisfying and it was nice to respond with a genuine compliment when asked how I liked my breakfast.  I had to add NOTHING to my dish! No Tapatio, sal, NADA!  I told him as much and he took the remark in stride.   Realistically, I spoke with Phrank at length about food, the Hoover Dam, and bikes and he is simply a genuine man/small business owner who deserves the reviews that I see to the right of my screen,  I probably would have returned to this place even if the food was two grades lower than I found it to be.  Again, I am born and raised in San Diego (Northern Mexico) so I have paid my dues running the gamut of tacos de perro in Tijuas to my Abuelitas Sunday meals.  This place is legit!

Wz9xuTPBGT3SilOMot5guQ.text: Went back w a friend/colleague. Got the chic salad. It was better than my last visit w the burrito escapade but still darn expensive for what you get. I understand they are close to the corporate parks so can get away with lack of taste and overpricing themselves than in other possible locations, but maybe they are taking it a bit too far.

nQhnihhFjgpTH9X3B4xJCw.text: I can't tell you hope great it is to get high quality meats from a taco shop. Healthy, tasty food cooked fresh. I eat here several times a week and have my entire office hooked on Franks. Do yourself a favor and visit Phat Franks. The chicken is my favorite

SUh-AEthAfhcCtH8serIiQ.text: Our lunch group tried Phat Phranks (Fat Franks) today. It was awesome Mexican food and very close to what I have been used to eating in California. There were 10 of us and everyone except one person loved their lunch. The service was fast and continuous with drink refills. The owner came out and talked to everyone at least once during our stay. He also spoke to each person as they ordered. Very personable. Many said they would go again. I had the Chili Verde Burrito and it was huge (enough for two) with a small side of salad and iced tea for $10.26 with tax. Reasonable prices.  The chili verde was spicy but not overly done. Next time I will order the Chili Verde plate which is smaller. We will go again.

bUxdYHU5qFNuPz1rZLLOUg.text: My wife and I recently tried Phab Phranks after reading reviews on yelp. All I can say is it was excellent from the food to the customer service. I tried the carne asada torte and it was delicious!! We loved it so much we went back the next day and I tried the chile relleno burrito and all I can say is YUMMY!!! I am telling all my friends, family and co workers about this gem in the desert!! Also reasonably priced for such quality!!

TMb3_ZB9HBdsyFFb0ExUjw.text: Stumbled upon this place while getting gas on the way back to the airport. What great post-hiking trip fare! Fish tacos and burritos plus some amazing homemade hot sauces. Phrank is the nicest guy I've talked to in a long time and he and his wife whip up some mean fare. My new go-to Mexican when I'm in Vegas!

sfjUtT6fbAV3TCHsxQSrbg.text: Phat Phrank's not so Phabulous. I had the red chili burrito and my wife had a craniates and a barbacoa  taco. The red chili burrito was very bland and the barbacoa taco fell apart before she could eat it. With two drinks the bill was more than $19.00. Won't be going back.

d2NIaBfP_yl1IT_9P8jSvQ.text: Ok, so I never met the owner, have no past with him, yet from the first day I started dining at Phranks restaurant, he has done NOTHING but made me feel like I have known him all along. Get here before the lunch rush because it gets absolutely packed, and for all the right reasons. Phrank isn't just any ordinary restaurant owner as you will see him at the register himself, ensuring that all his customers receive the satisfaction they deserve. The food you ask? I come from California and lived in Las Vegas for three years looking forward to every trip back home for some decent Mexican food, and when I met Phat Phranks, it was love at first burrito.

Z6pQgRhxw33BEqYyrKrSzA.text: ADOBADA TORTA!! One of the best sandwiches in the country!!!

qQvF94x2xoUMbn3CQ06cpQ.text: It's my second time and I really love the Adobada Torta. Friendly staff, reasonable price, I will go more.

fyU6k3pnMbEHD6CW2r2iCQ.text: Stopped in and had the fish Tacos, absolutely killer. I'm in from out of town for the next few months and will be making this my regular lunch spot,

CgQSpOkepfE1N80JSrFgTQ.text: I Have gone here many times, nothing but A+ food and service. Frank is an amazing person he greets most by name and can even remember what you usually order. He interacts with everyone and makes sure everything comes out aces, which it always does. The Adobada torta and Flautas are my personal favorite. The chicken in the flautas is so tender and juicy and packed with flavor. Everyone needs to experience this amazing restaurant. Very accessible as well, since it is right off the 215 freeway on S. Decatur and W Sunset.

FsCU50J8vvytGrgtqdGtAw.text: Below average Mexican food. Food tasted rushed and bland. Lacked traditional mexican culture in the food. Honestly felt like I could make there food myself. Even down the the coffee I ordered tasted real cheap. First time here. Maybe ordered the wrong food on menu. But dont see myself going here again especially with it out of the way location.

4f0d1Z2LoTlt03MKfoVKwg.text: Frank is one of the coolest restaurant operators around.  In his case, good dude = good food.  There are a few standout items on the menu: 1) the adobada torta - everything about this sandwich is just about perfect; 2) huevos rancheros (green) - the chile verde is awesome and the homemade potato chips are addictive; 3) fish tacos - they get the deep fried fish just right, the breading is nice and light and the taco is dressed up the way it should be. Hit it with lime and mild, medium or hot salsa to your taste and these are about as good as you'll find north of San Diego; 4) the smothered chile verde burrito - this thing is huge and rivals the best chile verde burrito in town (found at Frank & Fina's).  Everything else on the menu is pretty standard Mexican fare.  The service is great with the exception of the line that can get backed up at lunch if Frank is not at the counter.  For some reason the rest of the staff can't enter your order quite as quickly.  Even still, the wait is never too long and definitely worth it.

4rpBJz4UU00w5ReldBEAaw.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE! Have been eating here since they opened & will continue! Best mexican food ever, the green salsa is to die for!

oLvarX4i37ZOeytW4ZNDEg.text: Love, love, love Phat Phrank's!!!!!  Frank is awesome, and I absolutely love their food!  I have tried various menu items, and they have all been amazing!  It's a ways from my house, but I will travel out of my way to go there because the food is great, and the staff is very friendly!

0fJa_K12CpUrz7OXPb0_3Q.text: Really enjoyed the food and the story behind this place!  I will be eating here again for sure!

Pe884xsWcwHw7Xz_3fh2Kw.text: Ordered the much yelped fish tacos. It truly is good. Next time I go to Vegas, will definitely return to Phat Phranks!

FtQw0z5aAfppcR19NwgYKQ.text: If you want a surprise of a place to eat you must try Phat Phrank's...had the carne asada red-wet burrito and it was to die for and it was so big I had the other half for breakfast...we also had the carne asada fries which are life changing be sure to get them deluxe...the drinks are huge and they even wanted to refill them before I left be sure to try the lemonade it really hits the spot

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. carne asada red-wet burrito
Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deluxe Carne Asada Fries

X6M3c4pMCoXLcleLX3Ce4w.text: Called to see if they had Chileaquiles and they didn't have it on the menu but they made it for me anyways! And let me tell you, I've had it all over the world and this is my favorite place to get it now! DELISH!!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chileaquiles. Special order. Not on the menu

GT9df7wYrtHomZUYjM7N3w.text: Came back 6 months later as I wanted a breakfast burrito. Called once again and the lady said 30 minutes which was completely fine. When I arrived to pay for my food she screamed out the window "I told it was 30 minutes". Am I not aloud to come beforehand? Also they charge for water here which is a little ridiculous too.  I'm still in shock at this terrible service with such a great product

irOjAr1RMNziztB2V_AtRQ.text: Ordered the pork chili verde wet burrito,  its insane how good this is, don't sleep on that burrito. Melts in your mouth.  There a picture of it on the wall above the cashier  where u pay , just point to the picture and say "I want that" thank me later.  Oh and eat it right away don't drive all the way home you want this hot and drenched in that wet green sauce.  Just take one bite of it while there at least, and then drive home with the rest , lol no joke.

CApDVuNN8fNvqHWPSqwVbQ.text: Tortilla is homemade and amazing. More of a to go location, but there are a dozen or tables. Sausage is amazing and the home made salsas are a special treat. You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon burrito. Phat Phranks

iVGSXbsWdKW5Tjr6eQH4Tg.text: Love Love Love Phat Phrank's!!!! One of the best burritos I have EVER had!  The Chili Verde Burrito...... you really must try this fabulous creation. It is amazing!!!! My husband had the breakfast burrito with bacon and he said his was really good. I will def be back, the problem...... I don't know if I can go and try anything else.....the chili verde burrito was just that good!

kmcUCAPldgEtIDigPZXj6A.text: I love Phat Phranks! My favorite is the carne Asada breakfast burrito and the fish tacos! The fish tacos are big fillets of cod that are battered and deep fried to perfection. Ive never have a bad meal here and the staff are always super friendly!

Me3TYemdPupvi3hz_dzA6g.text: Fish tacos, fish tacos, did I mention fish tacos. Everything fresh and reasonably priced. I'll definitely become a regular here. Oh wait....I am!

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish taco special w/drink$10 &amp; worth every penny!!

UgmzdvQKlHBFfb7kE5w2fw.text: Every time my family comes West, we search for some great Mexican food options. Especially breakfast burritos! This morning we ordered 1 Chorizo, 2 Bacon and 2 Bacon with added beans. Burritos were FANTASTIC! You could taste that they were made to order. Burritos had ingredients in every bite and held together to the end. My husband loved the mild salsa and my daughter & I ate the hot sauce until our noses ran. Assuming Frank took my order, he was SO nice and personable! Love that this is a family owned and operated business as my husband and I are small business owners. We love to support local when we can. Hoping we can get back over again before our vacation is over!

ZlW7YPOutnA7ojDd0jH8TA.text: All I can say ...... da bomb.  Chile relleno burrito, breakfast burritos & even chips & salsa!! Can't wait to bring the family here. Thanks Phrank!!!

H-EFj3rW4FJi-BKsoUQJ1w.text: I would give Frank and the food 5 stars but the girls there, I believe his daughters are so rude and nasty. They were nasty to me once and I almost didn't return, I did however return and dealt w Frank and as always fabulous. I even recommended the place to a few people and they've all said the same thing, the girls are a little rough. It's truly unfortunate because the food is great frank is so cool but the girls are an absolute repellant, and I believe they are part owners as well.

vfn9hDeG___JprVdICmljg.text: The food was so good!! I'll say it's one of the best Mexican food I've had in Vegas! The owner was there at the register, super nice guy, came around and made sure everything was good. Talked to his guests.  I just hope they add more parking to that complex, it was pretty small when we went.  We will definitely be back though!! Loved it!

moDlnlgAiuMfpvVF-4v0mw.text: Came here because of a classmates recommendation. Ordered the barbacoa burrito.  Pros-speedy service, flavorful burrito.  I recommend the mild sauce.  A great mom&pop store (5 stars).  Will go to again.    Cons- the spicy sauce is very, very spicy.  I wish there was a scale from 1 to 10 for more options instead of only 1 option.  However, I was impressed with their level of spice.  (4.5 stars)

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Barbacoa burrito.

n24ymf8YP7JpCtIxifCbfg.text: Extremely mediocre. Nothing compares to the Mexican food in SoCal .  Had the carne meat plate. Greasy beans. Small portions. Why is the carne asada chopped up??  Do they know how authentic Mexican food should look. Not worth my drive.

NnKBvBcxLxUxAcsmdF3f1A.text: The service, food, portion size, and dining area are all perfectly average (mediocre even)...which is what makes the well above average prices so hard to swallow.

jzIsWLcW0E7wFdS57pRhVw.text: Hands down! Food took me back to going to my grandmas house! Best food ever!!   The chili verde nachos are the bomb!

Jyz-cUwJi7aZP-bgILj1cw.text: Really good food! Green chili burrito and adobado torta are a must have. Food is made from scratch reminded me of home cooking.

7B0iJau0JtqOXSGshhG9zw.text: The Carne Asada Tostada was DELICIOUS and the staff is very friendly. Awesome family owned restaurant!

i5d4UufGYf4XljTCRNPrFw.text: Came here for a brunch with friends!  I love trying everyone's Adobada / Al Pastor, so when I saw it in Torta form here, I had to have it!  Adobada Torta ($7.39): Braised Pork, Cheese, Cabbage, Lettuce, Tomato, Onion, Cilantro & Secret Sauce. This was GREAT! The bread is very thin, crispy and has a butter toast like flavor!  The adobada is thin, has lots of flavor and is cooked right.  This is one of the better tortas I've had in town actually!    Eva went with the Carne Asada Breakfast Burrito ($5.99): Grilled Steak, Eggs, Potatoes & Cheese. Good breakfast burrito here! Price and portion is fair too.  I'd come back for the Torta alone!  But chances are, I will try something new to see if there are any other surprises to be had :)

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos Divorciados ($6.99) with Red and Green Sauces. Could use some plating help...it all ran together and looked like slop.
Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada Plate ($7.89). Good portions, well seasoned beef.
Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobada Torta ($7.39): Braised Pork, Cheese, Cabbage, Lettuce, Tomato, Onion, Cilantro &amp; Secret Sauce. AWESOME!  Great bread!

snNzBV9DPhQkryAvGfPfGw.text: A place worth driving to! Their fish tacos are incredible and their tortas are pretty awesome too. Don't miss this spot if you are in the area.

Br4s9AHHPaJTE0--wYrZqQ.text: I love this place! The food is authentic and they always remember my name when I come in. I always get the barbacoa burrito and its never failed me! They are famous for their Chile Verde burrito..so I'll have to try that soon!

Zw1EMXCOVJBBaddk0qjI9A.text: We have been customers of phat pranks since he opened.  Great food great prices, and a great family run business. We are definitely PHATIES

qMsmuPdTR2MXdsLKsUjwrA.text: I'm not a big fan of Mexican food, but I had a light lunch and wanted a heavier early dinner. Thought this would be a good chance to check this place out, I've had it bookmarked for awhile but it's 6pm closing time doesn't really work with my schedule.   Frank (or should I spell it Phrank?) was super duper friendly, and there were no issues with customizing my carne asada burrito to exclude rice. I don't like the trend now that bigger is better with burritos, with places using 3+ tortillas. My meal was normal sized, and stuffed just enough to make me full without pwning my face. Speaking of stuffing, it was back to basics with meat, beans, and cheese. The meat was the star, well seasoned and plentiful with each bite. Presentation was simple, but really there isn't much you can do to pretty up a burrito in general.   I also got to try their green and spicy sauces. The green had a nice tang with a medium spiciness. I kinda wish the hot sauce was even more spicy, but that might just be the masochist in me talking.   Phrank's feels like a good place for down-to-earth-fill-you-up meal. I won't be able to do any late night taco runs here if I get the munchies, but I think I could swing by to grab a breakfast burrito before work.

_OdwIxNrn-RJr94DWvi6AA.text: Great food, great service with good prices. We had a group of four. We shared the chile verde nachos and had the carnitas enchiladas, chicken enchiladas, chile verde burrito and green wet barbacoa burrito. Everything was great. The staff was very nice and helpful. We'll definitely go back.

2iybl0nvLQWydtjTPAIXLQ.text: We made a point to eat here multiple times on our business trip to Vegas. Ate here for dinner and breakfast multiple times it was affordable the service was incredible and the food aMazing! Great home cooked taste!

KRtN3z7G1Fjx8KewSsK87g.text: Phat Phrank's serves high-quality, consistent Mexican food. It's a wonderful place for lunch, but expect to be weighed down a bit afterwards :)  Their nachos are a smokin' deal, although they lack all the 'fixin's'. But man, they don't skimp on the shredded pork - so good. Their tortas are delish. I was skeptical at first b/c I feel like I'm usually less impressed with sandwiches, but this isn't a boring sandwich at all.  So much flavor. The breakfast burritos have excellent texture with the addition of the crispy potato bits. Way better than Roberto's IMHO.  And Phrank is a sweetheart. You can tell he's proud when you come back again and again.

YzMiAwUDekP1jJvtK4xq0w.text: The owner is so friendly! He walks around to make sure everything is good. He has a hands-on management approach. The food is great. The service is great too!

ev9x4GCWdPvOhSwyPcTYzA.text: After reading all the rave reviews here on Yelp my husband and I just had to check this place out! It definitely didn't disappoint!  We had the fish tacos which by far were the best I'd ever had! The fish was fresh and the "secret sauce" they put on it was delish! As we were about to leave we were asked how everything was from who we believe was the owner - he was friendly and suggested other items for when we return - great customer service! If you're looking for traditional Mexican food, definitely check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy fish tacos!

j8M5ct5JGG8bU1QW0J6dKA.text: Usually I run a mile when faced with inexpensive Mexican food, but the overall rating on Yelp for Phat Phrank's convinced me to give it a try. I'm glad I did.  This is good, honest Mexican fare at a really respectable price. It won't burn a hole in your wallet and it's also not as unpredictable as the stuff served up and places like Roberto's, Don Tortaco, Cafe Rio, and others. Everything has the feel of being freshly prepared rather than slopped together out of vats and it tastes just as good. I really appreciated the texture of the tortillas which were warm and satisfying, dense and chewy enough so they don't split open in your hands, but not gluey and overwhelming, either.  The man himself, Frank, is among the most welcoming proprietors I have encountered anywhere in the Las Vegas valley. He took a genuine interest in me and my wife and remembered my name upon my next visit - admittedly this was the very next day, but that should stand as testimony to the impact of his hospitality and cooking.  This isn't one of those fancy, designer Mexican restaurants, and should not be held up against that sort of establishment - these two sub-categories of Mexican cuisine can barely even be considered the same type of food. For what he is aiming for, Frank scores a bullseye. He deserves his high Yelp rating.

umdaLQy8X4zPrpw9TYSAqg.text: I looooooove this place!!! It's fast Mexican food, but not your typical fast food. Everything is made to order an delicious every time.....and the staff...the best!!

bJQ-cl0VoAP5qIzh6ZpUTQ.text: Love this place!  Best chicken burrito I've had in Las Vegas.  I haven't tried anything else yet because I can't steer myself away.  Did have the chips and salsa, which were very good.  Love the medium salsa.  Place is small and packed during lunch, so go early.  Service has always been great.  Only thing I don't like is, that the fountain machine is behind the counter, so you have to ask for refills, but they've always been quick.

iIHtrmq8_OckRv1KCXiCPQ.text: My boyfriend and I stopped in for lunch. The service was shockingly friendly. Phrank was cheerful and pleasant. The prices are awesome. We filled our bellies under twenty bucks! The only down side is the food is simple and plain. I had the chicken tacos combo and my boyfriend had a wet red sauce burrito. Neither had much taste at all, which was disappointing because it looked so yummy and the service/environment was five stars easily. Please Phrank you have an awesome set up! Don't let the bland bandit get you.

lDczNkqkqJw-1mw_YhGiOw.text: I had Phat Phranks appetizer nachos and I was extremely satisfied. I really enjoy a good chili verde where I can find it. I was in the mood for nachos but little did I know that had chili verde and melted cheese?   It smelled delicious, a bit soggy but that was my fault for taking my time picking up the food. It I waited a lil longer it would of become chilequiles! I will try to visit once a week. This week I been here twice and both times I enjoyed the food!

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nachos

ES5diP_IDpPjFLgJqmDVAw.text: Came from LA to Vegas and we wanted Mexican food. Yelped it and came here. Great tortas,  burritos and taquitos. The beans didn't taste homemade.

5vKWCcIZ9sdZaeHArvzJpg.text: Real Mexican food, that tastes great and gives you what you pay for. Chili verde burrito was awesome, would recommend this place to anyone looking for some great Mexican food. Service was awesome too!!

4Ld7sbYIce68eLQ6ekG-6g.text: I had to renew my sheriffs card and decided to stop somewhere quick on my way. I saw Phat Phranks and remembered reading about it in the weekly. It was delicious! The service was great, everyone was very nice. They were helping the woman in front of me with directions, but didn't make me wait to take my order too. I got the carnitas (pork) taco plate- the carnitas was flavorful and moist. The tortillas were piping hot. Very satisfying meal. I will definitely stop in the next time I am over here!

2oCIWA0k-UWxoGcaiAOykw.text: We come here every time we r in Vegas. I have yet to finish a meal despite the delicious factor

HPIetw76vl1SeRKkK8nJcQ.text: Had the pleasure of eating here last week and will definitely be back when I'm in town. It's a small place with big flavor. I had the green chili burrito,  one of the best I've had!  My friend ordered the cheescake chimichangas for dessert and those too were awesome!  Frank was very nice and friendly. Only downside is you may over indulge ;)

9Mo0-1-3YtLWUysI93qvLg.text: Stumbled upon this place today and was pleased at how awesome the food was! Ordered the torta and a fish taco and both were awesome. Also, the owner is a Ravens Football Fan!! Go Ravens!

YKzwiGlRVcVu8uPae9Vjbw.text: I drive by this place everyday, had to give it a try! I came in for take out Saturday afternoon, was happy I did, very friendly and helpful service.  I had a chicken burrito with guac, very tasty.  Chimi Cheesecake for dessert was amazing!! Will definitely be back on my lunch breaks!

44VSOtNFFAphp_-F0mJaxw.text: They are terrible say until 3pm on a Saturday and it wasn't even 1:30 and they locked door as we walked up what a terrible way to run something and get a first time customer to never return and write a bad review.

32pquF5ldcmVnxajb1O9Tg.text: I was craving Mexican food so I decided to try phat phranks. I thought the food was overpriced and extremely bland. I got the chicken burrito and chips and guacamole, chicken had absolutely no favor. Tasted like someone boiled it with no seasoning or anything and shredded it then placed it in a tortilla. Then the chips and guacamole, this is the first time I've ever had gross guacamole from a Mexican restaurant. Tasted like plain smashed up avocado, I was expected to bite in avocado goodness with tomato, onion, like juice, salt, and maybe cilantro.. But nope bland disappointment. It's right across the street from my job and I will not go there again. It was busy when I went but I'm guessing those people lack tastebuds.

89PC3HPZ7YwhXOwO6fsnqw.text: I have come here once a week for the past 6 months, however I have reached my breaking point and will probably not be coming back. This isn't a one time bad experience but a 6 month string of some of the rudest employees. Phrank is the only employee who doesn't make you feel like you are doing them a disservice by being there. It's sad because the food is great but I'm not going to put up being treated poorly just for being a customer.

l9KszMnYRiSooIppH7lRoQ.text: While getting ready to check out of our hotel we searched for restaurants in the area with top ratings and this was on the list. Awesome food and fresh! To be honest the best food we had all weekend long in Vegas! Guacamole was fresh no artificial taste. The red hot salsa definitely on point. As far as food goes we order Chile relleno plate (good in flavor), adobado wet burrito (very filling and great for the price), and the adobado torta (to die for.... fresh...best recommendation ever). We even got free refills. Great service, clean place,  and Frank himself if awesome great personality. These phatties loved this place :) we shall indeed return...hoping to try the green salsa (they were out :/)

NBh0jNgn-FC_jYbEec1RGg.text: My husband and I are always looking for some yummy huevos rancheros.    Very good!   The chunks of pork melted in your mouth.  The owners daughter served us and was super friendly.    She even recommended some of her own favorite places for great Mexican.   Fast service and the place was super clean.   We will be back for sure!

FN-mUk8-CIUc1vR5bgiiEg.text: For having 'Phat' in the name, their portions were kind of on the opposite side of the scale. At least for the adobada torta I ordered and devoured in point four seconds. It was a very good quality sandwich, don't get me wrong. The bread was nicely pressed and the meat was nicely seasoned, it's just for the price, it left me wanting more. The torta itself was just a little over half the size of a regular torta that you would find in any taco spot and it didn't come with any chips or anything that would substantiate the experience to equal something that felt like a full meal. I would say that this place has potential but as for now, Phat Phrank's is a misnomer and is very misleading to us hungry lunch patrons. But then again, maybe Phrank stay's Phat because he keeps the other half of our meals for himself.

ceph-c1DP36YZluJ3tM0FA.text: a suburban strip mall mexican place, with amazing food, only thing wrong with this place is they need more seats!

bt1YQk8bRXHo1tsrEL8Viw.text: First, a place owned and operated by an American can not be authentic and it's not! It is what most refer to as Tex-Mex.  I am getting more and more disappointed with the stacked Yelp deck and not being able to count on the slew of reviews that are more often than not bought through services.  Considering the amount of reviews this restaurant has and considering the reality that it is no where near to the best "authentic" Mexican food and also not deserving of a $ rating, it's reasonable to assume that the majority of reviews here are bought and paid for.    I'm an Engineer married to a Latino. I live here in LV, CA and Texas.  My wife wanted to leave the minute she saw the menu and realized it wasn't authentic Mexican food. However, I hate leaving so we went ahead and ordered.  I got five street tacos on special for 7.45 plus tax and my wife had the Breakfast Chorizo Burrito for about $5.50 plus tax. So our total bill with tax was about $14.50.  The street tacos had about 1 tablespoon of meat...yes that's correct, one bite of food for about $1.50 and that's a supposed "special" price. My wife's burrito was larger but again not much meat and all eggs. Considering that you can get a Carne Asada burrito packed with meat and no eggs at almost any Mexican joint for the same price, again the price of $5.50 was way too high for a breakfast burrito. It should have cost no more than $3.99 because again it was mostly eggs.  It would have taken a third meal to fill two people up  because their portions are so small. In fact, after eating here we had to go to another restaurant to eat again. So if you factor in another meal around $7.00 now you are at $21 for two people...hardly what I would call $. It never ceases to amaze me how reviewers rate base on the price of an item instead of what you get for the price. Hence, if they charge only $1.50 for a taco and all other restaurants are charging $3.00 but the $1.50 taco only gives you one bite compared to the $3 taco that gives you 8 bites, the $3 taco is a better deal.   The taste of the food was OK for Tex-Mex but nowhere near the taste of "authentic" Mexican food and when you get down to it nowhere near the best Tex-Mex.  I rate the value at $$ and the food at three stars as any legitimate, unbiased, review probably would. Also, the atmosphere had loud American music and was not at all conducive to an authentic Mexican establishment. And, I'm being extremely kind with a three star rating as we WILL NOT be returning which in all actuality makes it a two-star establishment.

6G0UW5gW2DRk-tch5Zw3Hw.text: Well, this has just become my phavorite place for tacos. I live in Henderson and I drive here for the cuisine. Frank is the one who takes your order, and sometimes brings it out to you. I love that. He is friendly and the place is inviting. He isn't a musician, but he loves music. His shop reflects his passion.    I ordered every taco on the menu to try. The best one is the adobada taco. A close second is the barbacoa. The meat is good quality but it's the simplicity of the taco that I love. Cilantro and some cabbage. Nice touch.   Props to Phabulous Phat Phrank and his great taco shop. I would recommend this place to anyone that would like to have their mind blown while eating some good phreaking tacos.  Note+++++ Phrank's hours of operation are limited. It's basically lunch and bkfast only. Call before you show up to check if they're open.

uOUJ2st7k0rOqoaVJPWDRg.text: Very disappointed--not sure how this place gets such high ratings. I'm used to the yummy Mexican food from SoCal and this place is now added to my list of blah Mexican food in Vegas.  I ordered the chili verde burrito (because I love tomatillo), but unfortunately the whole thing just tasted like rice and beans. I barely tasted the pork and chili verde. The older lady who took my order was nice, but the younger lady who packed and gave it to me obviously doesn't care about customer service. I specifically asked for hot sauce, good thing I checked my bag before leaving because they didn't pack any. Anyways, hot sauce aside, I didn't enjoy my chili verde because I didn't taste any chili verde, it just tasted like a bean and rice burrito.

SCvFR8AWI-2qO5b-8jaMkA.text: Delicious authentic Mexican food! Family owned, comfortable feel. The decor was music themed which I love.   I ordered the Barbacoa taco plate. It was delicious, perfectly spiced, and  just enough food portions. The one critique I would give is that the beans were not my favorite.   I would definitely recommend if you are looking for your Mexican fix!! :)

gIltFABAfHjqcrT6pDVl3g.text: I really wish I could give this more stars, because the food is Very good and the staff is friendly. As a matter of fact, the Adobada burrito is probably one of the best I've ever had. However, the last 2 times I tried to go here, they had all the chairs on top of the tables. What's up with that? The sign may say "open" but chairs on top of tables says closed to me. Sorry, but even if you are open, I'm not interested in sitting among a bunch of tables with chairs on them. Please keep the chairs on the floor during business hours. I would love to eat your delicious food again!

GuxFZ74g4znUa5p5X_mWdg.text: I lived in Las Vegas for a few years and was never satisfied with any burritos I tried...Until I found Phrank's!    THE BEST BURRITO IN TOWN!  At least out of the places I tried...All the meats are heavenly!! The green salsa is so good and thick it almost reminded me of something you would get at an Indian restaurant. Really good.  I only tried burritos there the few times I went. These are really big burritos with rice & beans.  But it is done to perfection!!! I wish Phrank a long and wildly successful career!  Thank you!!

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. OH GOD YES!
Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful Big Burrito!!!!

zAFbr9zcGvoAq1QkK9x2MQ.text: Had a late lunch around 3-4ish. Got a couple carnita tacos. Like the taste and cooked very well. And I like the toppings; cabbage, pico de gallo with a lime wedge. Get the red sauce if you like spicy.

MUGC9llT4VQyigIz5fh7Zw.text: Fresh.  This is honestly some of the best Mexican style food I have had around here.  It isn't greasy, you don't feel 500lbs after eating it; unless of course you eat more than your stomach can handle.    I got the chicken burrito, and Frank recommended I get the green sauce to go with it.  It was great!   I like that the owner works in the store, I think that shows hard work and dedication.  Not to mention he is really nice, and that was how I knew he was the owner.    The location is in an awkward, but smart, spot.  However, do not let that veer you from this delicious place!    If you go once, I can assure you, you will go back again.

GqfNDwZfHT1nGgCx6RJHSg.text: Digging it , went in really quick wanted to try something new , very tasty reminded me of smothered (wet) burritos back in Colorado , I had the pork chili verde, if you eat pork I would recommend it , guy who helped me was very nice , food was made very quickly but well , everything was good , if you want a step up from something like Robertos or anything like that this is a good option for sure . Prices are fare as well .

_L_MWsalh8AtU1rK763avA.text: Tried the taco plate yesterday which had rice and beans. Very flavorful. It was so good that we got breakfast there as well. A hidden gem that you need to try.

JF17FUfXwwbP9T2uNfzKYg.text: Just ate their for the second time. I've never been a fan of fish tacos in the past, but these are actually worth it. Portions aren't big, but that's probably for the best.   The two times I've been, the staff manning the counter haven't been too personable, but that's often the way it goes and it wasn't so bad as to majorly affect my rating. This time either the manager or the owner took the time to chat with me as I was heading out the door, so that customer service did a good job counterbalancing anything else.   Definitely try the fish tacos, you'd be surprised!

d6RKYF9H1avqV31_Up_lyQ.text: Definitely a favorite of mine on the Westcyde. Just off the 215 on Decatur. Phrank the owner and the crew are very welcoming.   So far, I've had the carne asada burrito, asada breakfast burrito, churizo breakfast burrito, and the fish taco.   Everyone of these items were good. The ones that stood out were the breakfast burritos. They put fried tater chips in with all the breakfast goodies (egg, cheese, whatever is your poison). The TATER CHIPS SETS IT OFF SUN!   It's difficult for me to get here sometimes cause they're only open on the weekdays. I found out the hard way.   Phat Phrank's... EYE LIKA CHU PEOPLES!!!

5aavdhS8HvOxyCdsjC91oQ.text: FIVE stars. Why? Two words: FISH TACOS. Also, three more words: PERSONABLE, FRIENDLY OWNER.   I didn't think this place was open after 6pm, which is part of the reason why I haven't tried their food yet. However, we left Halloween Mart, drove by, and the lights were on and the OPEN sign was lit up! SCORE.   Apparently, on THURSDAYS they are open until 9pm because they recently started having some type of car meet up in the parking lot.   NOW. THE FOOD. The inside is nothing special - not much atmosphere or ambiance. We took a look at the menu and the man behind the counter, who I assume is the owner, came over to us with a huge smile and said, "HOW CAN I HELP YOU LADIES?"  We told him we were first timers. He explained how a few of the menu items are cooked and told us what his favorites were. As soon as he said FISH TACOS, my eyes lit up. I ordered one fish taco and one adobada taco with rice and beans. My girlfriend ordered one carne asada taco and one adobada taco - TO GO. While we were waiting, the same nice man came and chatted with us for a while, asking us where we were from and he actually engaged in some awesome and genuinely friendly conversation. I was very impressed with his hospitality!   Our food was ready in a few minutes and as soon as I got home, I took one bite into that fried, crispy, juicy, flaky, white fish topped with lettuce and cilantro and a creamy sauce, and I just about died right then and there. Died with pleasure of course. :) Honestly, probably the second best fish taco I have ever had in my entire life, and I don't play around when it comes to fish tacos.   The adobada meat was slightly dry and lacked a bit in flavor. The beans and rice were amazing. i can't quite put my finger on the spice/flavor that made them taste different, but there's definitely something special about them.   Regardless, I cannot give less than 5 stars because of the beautiful explosion of taste that came out of that fish taco. I will be back!

aIoI4WtOSy2z-Yy_VigIlA.text: Breakfast burrito.... enough said!   Had i known about this place sooner i would have been several times over, and likely 5-8 lbs heavier as well. I crave a good breakfast burrito on cheat days and my Yelp app told me to run here. Glad i did as the $6 sausage breakfast burrito is just what i needed. Not too much potato like most, lots of sausage, and surprisingly not too greasy either. This was perfect for me. The pricing is good for the food offered, the dining area was clean, but the person who took my order could use to learn to smile a little. All in all... i will be back for another burrito without doubt.

7Dmktuy9R5hWhqA2oRfGEA.text: This place is some really good mexican food. I am from Socal so I know my mexican food very well. His tortas are a must and most assuredly the best in town.

L86v3aQwUgQelFjXRjUK2Q.text: I went for the first time yesterday afternoon , and the customer service was great, as well as the food. The carne asada torta was amazing! I took one to go as well and it was just as good the next day! Definitely will be going back!

mL4a8Qz_CFaSNrQWVA8Ayg.text: Location, service and staff were great.  Unfortunately the food was not.  The cheese enchiladas had very little flavor and no discernible cheese.  My colleague had the same response to her food.

VXNja4RtqCZMV0Gk0AUxBw.text: Was looking for a good breakfast place off the strip for some good affordable food and Phat Phranks fit the bill. Great burritos, good salsa and fantastic service. The owner really cares about his customers. He checked up with us half way through the meal to make sure everything was good. You could tell he was genuine and it wasn't just going through the motions. Was impressed by the food too. The breakfast burritos have some fried crispy potato slices that give a good crunch. Loved it.   Bottom line: great breakfast alternative to over priced places on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne asada breakfast burrito. Fantastic

XkHnMJputWKnwxuKhI7G5g.text: This place makes me happy! I come here every week because I'm obsessed! I always request cabbage in my tacos because it's awesome. My fav go to is the fish taco, chicken taco, and ground beef taco. The staff is always friendly. This literally is the best taco place in Vegas! I hope they open up more locations...Rainbow & 215 please :)

viq8dCtHeKNxnk9lYo_enA.text: This place is it! Awesome chili verde...well awesome everything! They have the best hot sauce. Great flavor and just the right amount of kick. Perfect!

1qZW5rWNdKdHvoo3yihi5w.text: Whoa...........who knew about this?   Unassuming little place on a side street behind a Popeye's Chicken.   The owner is a great guy running one very little Mexican restaurant that is cranking out some top notch food.     I had the Chile Verde burrito and it was fabulous.  A pile of tender pork inside with rice/beans then covered with even more pork on the outside.  Another in my party enjoyed the torta and would order it again.  Fresh food made with love and passion.   Everyone working there is hustling but with a smile on their face.   Great to see a locally owned place doing well and the food is definitely first on the priority list here.   We will be back!

k71CLQUsTsDnGBrf9ca8nw.text: We visited Phat Phrank's today for lunch and I cannot wait to come back. We ordered the adobada torta and adobada tacos. The adobada pork is so tender and full of flavor. It is braised and then put on the flat top until it is nice and crispy. The torta sandwhiches comes with lettuce, Pico de Gallo and this amazing crema sauce with your choice of salsa. Phrank's has been in the area since 2009 and it is deliciously good food. Everything is made from scratch. We tried the chimi-cheesecake for dessert. It is a flour tortilla stuffed with a flavored cream cheese, rolled and deep fried. Then they roll it in cinnamon sugar and drizzle with caramel sauce. I am so full and so happy. Phrank is a great guy with a big heart amazing recipes. Once you try Phat Phrank's you will be a repeat customer!!

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake chimichuri!

-qFEE_aSVbrLG3lWS1QRsw.text: this is a must stop on your way out of vegas but know that they are for some reason CLOSED ON SUNDAYS. such a bummer to drive out there and see they are closed, I bet they are missing out on a ton of business. probably the best breakfast burrito ive ever had. they slice up the potatoes real thin so they get nice and crispy before going into the burrito, and the burrito itself is grilled to perfection. gets lots of salsa on the side and maybe even two burritos, so you can have a second one two hours into that terrible drive back to LA ha

WxjJ6nhDejeyTg9e4ojqgg.text: Clean, classy atmosphere and super friendly staff. I've been wanting to try this place since I moved to Spring Valley. Got the deluxe carne asada fries to start, and they were delicious! The fries were crisp, which I find rare for carne asada fries and the flavor was out of this world.   I got a chile verde burrito and my fiance got a red chile burrito, wet red. Both burritos were huge, like Chipotle-sized. The chile verde had great flavor and the perfect amount of spice. The red was almost too spicy (my fiance doused it in sour cream), but the meat was delicious. We also tried all 3 salsas, green, mild, and hot. All were AWESOME. This place is a major threat to our diet plans, as I'm sure we'll be back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deluxe carne asada fries

r63svPepsxgavKREouKCyw.text: Ordered the flautas as a recommendation of the guy taking the orders. Was not happy that I had to wait almost 30 minutes for the food. The guacamole didn't taste good. The prices were a little high.

ksVkaG8MeMSFrJOZBtDndQ.text: All I can say is WOW! This place is amazing. I had the pork chili Verde burrito and an adobado taco for dinner, the food is amazing. I can't wait to go back and try their breakfast items.

_bIYfKPutxf83dmK93PU8g.text: Best Green chili in Las Vegas. I drive from North Las Vegas to get the Green chili burrito

macjZU8On75UHJcZ53gOdQ.text: As a local, these are the best tacos in Las Vegas. Our favorite is the barbacoa and fish, AMAZING. Also, the refried beans are delicious, usually I never eat refried beans but Phranks are smooth and fresh. Phrank himself is a warm, sincere person who cares about the individual's experience. We've brought our family, friends, and out of towner's here and they all love it. If you are a taco connoisseur, this is the place for you.

HKgH3_MF8Dx5xHD5OEI-IQ.text: Phat Phrank's makes yummy Mexican food!!!  Its really hard to find high quality Mexican food off the strip these days.  Luckily, I found hidden jewel at a locally owned family restaurant.  The food is made fresh to order and delicious. You have to try the fish tacos it's the best in town!!!! If you love barbacoa like I do, the Catota Roll is amazing and full of flavor. Breakfast burritos are fabulous, so much better than Robertos.   Frank is a nice and friendly guy!!  i could tell he loves to deliver on food that makes people happy.  I'll definitely be back!!!

oBprks9EygXsLbvVL-hpMA.text: Wow! Finally Mexican food that taste like home (Los Angeles). A friend brought a sample of the chicken burrito and i just had to come here with my wife. The place doesn't feel or look like Mexican so i was a bit thrown off, but because that sample was so good i had to go in and eat in. I ordered the chicken burrito with the green sauce. The burrito was fresh tasting all the way through. The green sauce was just as fresh and spicy the way i like it. I've tried at least 20 Mexican restaurant here in Vegas and they should be happy i didn't write a review because a lot of people would stop going. I definitely be coming here when i have the taste for Mexican food. A New Orleans jazz atmosphere threw me off. Chairs were a bit rocky, but not where i was uncomfortable. Some calming music in the background. Customer service was perfect and they even asked about our food and explained the menu with great patience. I can call this place as my favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas finally.

_6N7EpIYWz6tsZK3ECSWiQ.text: Delicious! I went in with a craving for Mexican food and was pleasantly surprised with how good the food was.  Chips and salsa is made in house.  My suggestion get the mild and ask for a sample of hot to add a little heat for your taste buds.  The mild has chunks and fresh cilantro the hot is smooth but just hot not tasty.  I asked what was good and was suggested to try the most popular burrito.  It is a wet green chili burrito. Conveniently, there is picture on the wall next to the register!  I will definitely go back to this place....highly recommend Phat Phranks.  Even during lunchtime rush, ordered to-go and I was back in the car in less than 10mins.

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great burrito...

I0XYbVvvGfGr37TSvMdToA.text: I have been driving past Phat Frank's for the two years we've lived in Las Vegas, and last evening we stopped in for dinner. We had the carnitas tacos, which were generous and fresh, and chili verde, with iced tea. The vegetables are plentiful and so crisp! Seasoning is great! The staff are very welcoming snd attentive. My husband ate some great churros for dessert. I am looking forward to coming back and trying other dishes for we both were impressed and very satisfied!!

srileQapawPttEyNZUuHqg.text: Food is pretty damn good. Customer service is pretty bad so I just take my food to go.

Febsk4f0bY1uc8B9iAEkWA.text: Was craving a torta, and decided to come in after reading reviews on their Adobada Torta. Walked in on a Friday afternoon, wasn't too busy, so after my to-go order was placed, I received my torta pretty quickly, within about 5-8 minutes. Service was friendly and fast. The torta itself was AMAZING! I went to a different spot and the torta didn't compare to the Adobada torta. The only reason I'm giving this review 4 stars instead of 5 is because the torta was a bit too greasy, wish the meat was patted down a bit to cut out the grease before it was placed on the bread. I'm not a fan of the higher price tag of a little over 8 dollars, but compared to the torta I had from somewhere else for 2 bucks less, this one is worth the price tag. I recommended this for pork lovers (like myself) who want a delicious flavorful torta.  The green sauce goes perfect with it too!

IEWCSlDYL2LywcZqcY4JSg.text: Loveeee staff is super sweet and food is bomb. If you have tapatio on your counters, you're def a 10 star in my book. Seriously so good tho, pricing is amazing and the food is genuine and delicious

0FuLp5j8-uLpnSaiu6qufA.text: Cool hip spot. Great tacos! Love the artwork on the walls and menu

uelEEvh8bcAkgMHgtj4DYg.text: Oh Phrank, I've got the hots for you!  My hubby tried Phat Phrank's last week with some coworkers and has been raving about the fish tacos every day since then.  I wanted in on the action, so when he had the opportunity to go out for lunch again, I met him there and had a great lunch.  The restaurant itself is in a small strip mall with a couple of other food places.  It is kind of hard to see from the street, so keep that in mind when you venture over here.  Once you find Phrank's, your happy tummy time begins!  You walk in the door and can smell the lovely Tex-Mex aromas swirling around the place.  Your mouth starts watering immediately and you get excited for the food to come.  Yummmm.    Phat Phrank's is a small place though, with about 6 tables.  We got there and there was only 1 table open.  My hubby grabbed it while I waited in the really long line.  Within 2 minutes, the line was actually out of the door with people waiting.  Luckily the line moves pretty fast.  The food also comes out pretty quickly too, so there is a nice flow to the place.  After looking at the menu, I was torn between the carne asada and the pork chili verde plates.  I asked the one and only Phrank, who was working the counter, and he told me to go for the chili verde.  I trusted him and went with the verde.  Boy, was I happy with my choice!  The pork chili verde was so tender and tasty.  It had so many layers of flavor that it made you eat slowly to savor each bite.  Delish!  My hubby went for the fish tacos again.  He is addicted to fish tacos and gets them everywhere we go.  He says these are the best in town, hands down.  He really has tried dozens and dozens, so I trust him on fish tacos.  I was going to try a bite, but by the time I asked for one, he had already devoured them.  You snooze you lose, I guess.  The hot sauce here is really great good too.  I recommend the hot hot sauce.  It is super flavorful without being completely mouth burning.  It has some great depth to it and I had to ask for a second serving because it was that good!  The plates came with the main entree, as well as refried beans, Mexican rice, and homemade tortillas.  Now no one tell my Grandma, but the beans and tortillas were better than hers!  I have NEVER said that before because hers are the best of the best!  The beans from Phrank's were simply perfect and I could have eaten a whole pot of them them.  The flour tortillas tasted just like my grandma's homemade ones.    The tortillas were just AWESOME.    If you have never had a homemade tortilla, you are missing out.  Luckily you can go to Phrank's and get some right now!

photos.caption: Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Always get at least 2 hot hot sauces because it tastes amazing!
Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada fries with sour cream and extra hot hot sauce!

M1-k1M1igjdg-TcJfbAI7g.text: Food that we received was ok but not great or even correct and some of it was missing.  Disappointing. I order a lot for meetings so the orders are large. I don't recommend ordering from them if you have more than a few items as it will be wrong or just not included.  Also who runs out of guacamole at 11 am?

cLKDAyBHAXzMabLuOcJK-w.text: Oh goodness. I don't think I've found a Mexican establishment that has gotten me 100% of the way until Phat Phrank came into my life. Except for maybe Chipotle but come on now, Chipotle doesn't count. Chipotle is like the unwanted child. BUT ANYWAYS ..   My friend and I decided to try this place after I did some yelping around. Saw this, was on edge a bit because I don't normally go for Mexican but then saw the amazing reviews ...so we just had to give it a go. Let me tell you, no regrets.  The guy who took our orders, whom I assume to be none other than the owner himself, was very nice. My friend ordered the Fish Taco Combo with hot sauce, which was their special for the day while I ordered the flautas. Phrank then suggested that the green sauce goes great with the flautas so I took his suggestion and went with that. He even asked us if it was our first time and that we should try his breakfast items and tortas next. Thumbs up. I liked how he tries to get to know you just a little bit.   When our food came, it looked delicious. My friend loved his fish tacos. And my flautas! My goodness! They were so good. The chicken was moist had good flavor while the outside was crispy but not burnt. The green sauce that Phrank suggested went WONDERFUL with the flautas. I was so happy and in foodie heaven. However, I wasn't a big fan of the guac that came with it because it just tasted weird to me. It was salty .. hum. Anyways, both of our orders came with rice and beans, which were also very good. So when you order your food, eat them fresh!!!  After we were done with our food, we wanted to try their churros. We've seen some of the pictures on yelp and we just HAD to. Though, when we did try it, we were a bit disappointed. It wasn't as light as we would've thought. It was actually quite dense and kind of hard. Also, amazingly sweet. If you're not really a sweets person, I don't recommend it just because it's sweet upon sweet due to the chocolate, caramel, and vanilla sauces they drip over the churros. I almost couldn't handle it.   Service was good too. Phrank checked up on us about twice throughout our meal and was also checked up on twice by another employee on drink refills.   All in all. Amazing. Would definitely return to try their breakfast items next time :)

Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9K9w9sCsS9S9Mn_vknQ3RA.text: I decided to come to Phat Phrank's based on their high star rating and was disappointed. I gave this place 3 stars because I can't give it 2.5 The food was decent, but their service and their prices were not great. I ordered the Taco Combo which was $7.99 (not bad); I got the adobada and carne asada. The tacos were good, their salsa was good, but the rice and beans were pretty mediocre. The rice looked fluffy, but there were a few undercooked, crunchy grains. The beans tasted a little like they were from a can. I also ordered their chips and guacamole, which were pretty good, but not worth $5. I also got a large horchata for almost $3, which would've been okay if it didn't taste like the powdered stuff you get from the Latin market. Lastly, the lady who took my order was NOT friendly at all. She seemed like she was annoyed and like she didn't want to be there. For the tacos, she asked if I wanted mild, medium, or hot salsa, but she didn't elaborate on what types (red or green), and I totally didn't feel welcomed to ask. I wasn't greeted, thanked, or asked anything other than what I was ordering and that was because I walked up to the counter. All in all, the food was not bad; I'd eat their tacos again. Their decor was pretty cool too. However, my lunch experience was NOT worth the $20 I spent.

Photo of Phat Phrank's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 Taco meal, carne asada and adobada

gk4xfxPHNvv3mIBTIajPiw.text: As usual, I ended up coming here based on the bookmark part of the Yelp phone app. I bookmarked this place awhile back because of all the check ins from my Yelp friends and couldn't help but notice the four and a half star rating. Judging by the name, you wouldn't think it was a Mexican joint.  As soon as I walk in I am greeted by Frank (or should I say Phrank?) himself and asked if it was my first time. I guess me looking for some kind of menu on the wall gave it away. He directed me to the menus on the counter. He briefed me on some of the popular items that people get. The thing that stood out to me was that anything on the menu whether it was breakfast or lunch was available all day. That's a major plus if you ask me because who doesn't want a breakfast burrito for lunch sometimes?  Anyways, I went with the Adobada Burrito because im trying to cut down on red meat so pork is the next best alternative. The burrito itself had shredded chunks of tender pork mixed with some rice and beans. The pork itself was a bit salty but was still edible especially with the green, red, and spicy red sauces that came with it. All were excellent when you pour some on the burrito.  Based on the menu, I will definitely be back to try some of the others that people have mentioned. The only thing that I find negative might be the hours. 8 am to 5 pm. So if I wanted to take my fam for dinner, it wont work. I guess based on the location, they are only busy during the morning til late afternoon. I guess you cant have everything.

rkchVysEN69Ch2Y_-cDYvg.text: Place is great Tex/Mex style food. Walking in I was greeted by an older Mexican man whom I think is the notorious "phat Phrank" he was so funny and welcoming , reminded me of my own family. The wait time was extremely long but then again we went around lunch time but man it was worth the wait! It is a couple of bucks over priced but we had just landed in Vegas we were craving Mexican and this place popped up woth good reviews so we had to try it. I ordered the tostada with pork Adoboada I think that's how u pronounce it lol it was excellent!!!! Will def be back!

4cmhcdQ0IJTdgqzT64_j_g.text: Experience:  Went with friends about 1:00 on a Thursday. I had never been here and the name alone intrigues me.   Facility: It is a very small place located in a strip mall. There are tables and chairs for about 20 folks. I was pretty impressed with the fork, spoon, and knife dispensers. Such a sanitary way to get your plastic ware!  It's a fast food type feel, but they bring the food to your table.   Service:  I went to the counter and a very personable, nice guy greeted me. Even though there was a few people behind me, he took the time to talk to me. At the end of my order, he asked my name, and introduced himself...turns out it was Frank, the owner. What a nice guy!!!!!  The rest of the staff were friendly and attentive too. Although you order at the counter, they bring the food to you, and even bring your drink out first. Also, they will refill your drink too. I just realized I didn't leave a tip on the table!!!  Man!  Well, I did drop some in the tip bucket up front when I ordered, so I hope they all share that. Sorry guys, next time I will tip for the great table service too!!!!  Food:  I ordered the Carnitas plate with a side of hot sauce and fried jalapenos. The Carnitas (3.5/5) were good. I liked the beans and rice with a touch of salad on my plate too. The homemade flour tortillas (5/5) were so good! The fried jalapenos (2.5/5) were actually grilled (or fried) and marinated. It's not that I didn't like them, but I just prefer the natural flavor of either a fresh or plain grilled jalapeno. Frank came by and I mentioned my preference, and he immediately exchanged them for fresh jalapenos. Yum! This topped my meal off perfectly.   Overall:  I'm a fan. I like the food, I liked the service, and Frank was a real gem. Too bad it's not close to my house, but I will be back.

_rdWajY3KFdb_Fc91N70Hg.text: If you're from SoCal, you're able to recognize good Mexican food when you come across it.  Phat Franks did not disappoint.  Ordered an asada burrito, an asada plate, the catota torta, and each of the desserts. Everything was spot on. My only criticism would be of the barbacoa, as it was a tad too salty for my taste buds.  I had to add extra hot sauce on it in order to soften some of the saltiness.  We had to take most of the food to go because the portions are generous.  Didn't mind that at all. We'll definitely be visiting this place again whenever we're in Vegas.

InADZhAyO6WYb31vzfJJMA.text: It wasn't anything special or out of this world delicious. I ordered a carne asada burrito. The portion was pretty, big definitely couldn't finish on my own. I could buy the same burrito at Roberto's and in fact I'd rather go to Tacos Mexico because their burritos are so much better, more flavor more quality! Wouldn't really recommend this place unless you're looking for average food.

INY1GYTj4N0zqwoOG80tZg.text: Phrank and his family make this place amazing!! Not only is the service awesome, the food is amazing as well. The Mama Marias enchiladas with an egg are a must have if you're eating at Phat Phranks!! Also, the Carne Asada breakfast burrito, Fish tacos and barbacoa plates are also to die for!! L6yOkCXFNbzSAxhOIYqR2Q.text: I'm a fan! The service was great- the man running the business (is his name actually Phrank?) was great and took the time to chat with me. The prices are all very reasonable and the food is delicious as well! I had the fish tacos place which comes with rice and beans and is enough for a meal, but I indulged my sweet tooth and went for the chimi cheesecake as well. The fish on the tacos is breaded lightly and the sauce on them is delicious. The salsa was fresh and had a very small kick (I went for the mild). The chimi cheesecake was also good- very sweet and very filling, the serving size is good for 2.  I will definitely be coming back here!

UleEd1QCUu6ihlVbHo317A.text: The family is awesome. Frank is an amazing guy. He's always happy to see you and goes beyond to help you have a great lunch. I work at the Innevation center across the 215 and Decatur and we eat here once a week. It's just good food at a great price. There are some moments when we have a bit of a wait time. That usually means that they are busy. And busy usually means good.   The ADOBADA Torta is just amazing. That's all I order.

0hJj8ln5NNpju9c_8qHhAg.text: After picking my fiancee up in the morning, we took a quick look for some off-Strip food joints that were serving breakfast, and we ended up at Phat Phrank's on a Friday morning. At 10 AM in the morning or so, it was pretty empty, so we were able to order right away, and our food came our relatively quickly (around 5 minutes or so after we placed the order). I went with the barbacoa breakfast platter, while my fiancee went with the huevos rancheros. Both were really good - the barbacoa was cooked enough so that it shredded easily, and it really goes well with solidly-done scrambled eggs. I do say I wish I could have combined it with the huevos rancheros' pepper sauce, which added a real nice kick to her dish and made the dish flavors much more vibrant. While I like the idea of the thinly-sliced fried potatoes (they sure looked like plantain chips, but they definitely tasted like potatoes), they're a bit on the light side. Given the rest of the meal is relatively hearty, I think a bigger serving, or adding a side of Mexican-style rice, would have been a better way to round out the dish.  I'd like to come back sometime to try the regular offerings, but breakfast on its own was okay. It's better than your average breakfast, but I've had better Mexican-inspired breakfast dishes at other places.

BsG-2f4nXZZmTiGxtPmY0A.text: ABSOLUTELY HANDS Down THE BEST!! The abodaca pork is to die for!! LOVE IT IN A TORTA! And the owner Frank is the nicest man ever! Always makes a point to come say hi & see how food was and he remembers his customers! Love this place!! We always bring friends from out of town to try it and our local foodie friends are new converts to Phat Franks! Their tortilla chips are the freshest hottest  yummiest ever! YOU Will NOT ME DISAPPOINTED! Try Phat Frank's!!
