WBKWNTey4b0Ggocqj34EZw.text: Very nice little place! Gets very busy around lunch time. Frank and his staff have always been very nice and treated us all well. My personal favorites there are the Adobada Torta and the Ceviche. So good and everything is very reasonably priced! I can't say enough good things about this place. Only complaint is they are only open during limited hours. It is understandable considering they are small and their primary business is the other businesses around them. So, I can't fault them for that.

Xx5iZEAEJOcQi7zaYVC4sA.text: Phat Phrank's has been on my 'To Do List' for a very long time. I had a meeting on the other side of town and had to pass by the Decatur & 215 exit on the way home around lunchtime, so I decided to finally give Phat Phrank's a try. Since I'm on my Lent 'No Meat' diet, I was browsing the menu for Meatless items. The man behind the register asked me if he could help out....I told him my situation and he was very happy to help me decide what to get. He suggested a Cheese Enchilada ($6.99). yelp.com/biz_photos/dJF4... I went with his suggestion and also added a Bean & Cheese Burrito ($4.29) for good measure.....ha! yelp.com/biz_photos/dJF4... He chatted me up while ringing up my order and I discovered he was Phrank, the owner. He's such a cool guy. He's from So Cal and we were talking a bit about the State as I'm also a So Cal transplant.....although I left many years before he did. After a few minutes he brought out my order. I was pleased to see that the Cheese Enchilada also came with a side of Rice & Beans....although it meant that I ordered too much food. Sometimes my stomach tricks me into these situations. Oh well. I went for the Cheese Enchilada first....and yum! It was very, very good. I'm glad Phrank suggested it to me. Next up was the Burrito.....unfortunately, after all of the flavor from the Enchilada, the Burrito tasted just OK. For a Bean Burrito though, it was solid. Next time I'm going to order just one or the other. I'll have to come back after Lent so I can try out some of the other signature dishes. If they're as good as the Cheese Enchilada, I'll be back a lot. Return Factor - 97%

f2Lw5O7gEzSxbdRxydZv2g.text: Visited Phat Phrank's today after hearing some good reviews. I ordered the 5 Carne Asada St Tacos for $9.99. Right off the bat, I assumed they would be small, but when my order came out, they were teeny! 5 tiny double tortilla tacos with just cilantro and onions and salsa. There was absolutely nothing to them and certainly not worth $2 a piece. I've had better flavor at the 65 cent taco joints. My husband ordered the deluxe fries which were also nothing special the portion was also skimpy. I wouldn't recommend. The service was mediocre, I didn't feel welcome and the atmosphere was odd for a Mexican place. We left hungry and disappointed.

P7Tywf6RQs-ANlMpi2kKYQ.text: I recommend Phat Phrank's to anyone who asks about good Mexican food in Las Vegas.  I've tried almost everything on the menu and nothing has disappointed me.  My favorites are the fish tacos (best I've had), pork green chile, and the Barbacoa but everything has been excellent.  Great choices in salsa too. The restaurant is clean and Phrank is always welcoming.  The service is not fast because this is not fast food!  Also, the price is slightly higher than their competition but I'll pay a $1 more for better food any day.  If you ask, "What did you not like?"  I would have to say I don't like the forks and knife self service dispenser but that's just being picky.   Overall, 5 stars for food, service, cleanliness, and overall experience over 20 visits.  Thanks Phrank!

hJqk37XcesYMoHPIR-qQNA.text: I LOVE Phat Phrank's food - it really is great BUT after my experience today I don't think I will go back there. I went in there and ordered 4 breakfast burritos, 2 orders of chips and guacamole and one large drink. It was $53. The lady had this nasty attitude to begin with. She seemed very inconvenienced that I was there when they had only one customer and then myself. There was some sort of worker there - construction or maybe like a utility worker but the lady was talking to him like it was a personal conversation and when I got there he was in the kitchen. Anyway I was very nice and waited for my food since it seemed like she was the only one working. When she gave me my food she handed me a menu and said here is a menu so next time you can call in ahead  and then proceeded to say oh and by the way anything over $50 we are supposed to add an automatic 15% gratuity to it !  umm no!! If I were dining in maybe but not for a take out order !! You're out of your freaking mind!! The whole time the lady's attitude sucked as well.

RObTpnFLAVy7-Bx3fx7YCw.text: Delicious Mexican food. I got the cheese enchiladas with red and green sauce. Everything here was delicious. The wait staff was extremely nice, asked how the food was & was friendly. Would totally recommend if you are in the area. Thanks again for the amazing service.

z3Im_YUIzkrceMeD_mxYgw.text: Excellent! Another bookmark down.  This review is long overdue. I had lunch here almost a month ago and I could not stop raving about it to coworkers when I got back. The experience is still fresh in my mind. I had the daily special Fish Tacos, but I asked for flour tortillas instead of corn. Everything was made fresh, and the slaw on my tacos was TO DIE FOR. The creamy sauce was perfectly seasoned and the fish was fresh and tasty. The rice wasn't mushy - it was cooked perfectly. My husband had a chicken burrito and he could not get over the salsa - he said it was the best salsa he had in his life.  Nestled behind a gas station and some heavy road construction, Phat Phrank's is a jewel in the rough. It's perfect for a power lunch, or maybe picking some to-go food when you just don't feel like cooking.   As I sat there one random Friday afternoon, I had seen people from all walks of life come in and out happy. There were suits, construction workers, Louis Vuitton ladies, and families either dining in or picking up to go orders.  Frank was there during my visit and couldn't have been nicer. He made sure to talk to every customer and made sure everyone was enjoying their meal. He's super helpful when you're trying to figure out what you should order. I asked him why they weren't open on weekends and he had said they were once, but business wasn't worth a 7 day schedule. He did say once the construction on sunset was completed, they would definitely be open Saturdays again.   Fresh food, great service, reasonable pricing - this place is an easy 5 stars. As the unfortunate duchess of a certain Roberto's, I can proudly tell you that this place is definitely worth stopping by and checking it out !

F5aCnGxcY5a1YV2uPFGh8w.text: I'm probably not the first to say this, but I'm a phan (get it, phan, Phat Phranks?)....in any case, I considered rating this as 5 stars, but it didn't quite get me over the top, but 4 was close......I got just a regular old carnitas burrito...just a few simple ingredients, and yet it was jam packed with flavor......I'll be back, and maybe I'll try something a little more exotic that makes me upgrade them to 5 stars. Can't wait to try that churro!

JUwOJRNpDnSmHtMmj-7TOg.text: Some of the best mexican food I have ever tried. Delicious seasoning, amazing staff and customer service.

8C1RQyLFsa8SD-kBefFISg.text: This place has the best Mexican food ever!!! Very authentic, reminds me of home. I got the carne asada burrito, as well as the churros! Very good highly recommend this place. Family owned, and very friendly everyone is so kind and treats you with the best of the best customer service!

GkiOho5T5ROdBDfnagRh1g.text: Holy smokes this place is delicious! I had the barbacoa plate while my husband had the chicken burrito. I can't express enough how good it was. Extremely friendly staff made us feel right at home. Will 100% be back.

nZeYZLdsfeHpBwHJqj4-Iw.text: Great place! I used to work at the cab company. I'd come here like every other day. Awesome food! Awesome Service.  Way better then that burger joint next door.  My go-to for Mexican.

ElVqk0wiXBcqdkdCZP_5bg.text: If you lower your expectations, it is not a bad strip mall mexcian fast food joint. It is just not all that good either. Guy at the counter was friendly and brought us a water with our soda. Nice of him to go out of his way for us. Just hoped for more flvor in food. The rice and beans were cold so that food not help. NOT a 4.5 star Yelp place but better than a two star-barely.

w61-crcm88ldRQb9aUTxow.text: We just got back from Mexico Friday and decided we needed to re-live it on Monday.  Our traveling buddys had been telling us about Phrank's during the trip so we met up with them for lunch....  oh my gosh, delicious!  I had the Divorced Eggs (I can't do the Spanish justice) and my husband had an Adobada Burrito which rivaled our favorite in Albuquerque.  Well worth the drive from Hendertuckey.  We will be back and telling others as well.  And as a bonus, the service was very friendly.

3xcW_uXat1dwH_k-3IIFCg.text: The food is REALLY good! However, their service is really off! Not just once but several visits. And whatever you do, do NOT sit/lean on their counters!!!

JkuyQyuFDMBc6rjMc45hdQ.text: Honestly can say not sure what all the hype is. Maybe i need to try the tacos everyone is talking about because the enchaladas are a big miss

GLlZtg5BforZiEg542iiKA.text: This was my second time eating here and I had to yelp it. First the service is genuinely warm and welcoming, like you're part of the family. You're greeted right away usually by the owner Frank himself. You can tell he takes pride in his restaurant and it really shows in the food. Amazing mexican food! This time around I had the Chile Verde burrito. The pork was tender and flavor packed. Not greasy or fatty like at some places, just the perfect balance. I would highly recommend this place if you're looking for some great authentic mexican cooking! Also they are now open on Saturday's.

P5VZX-mA4uWbOrIhCOzcUw.text: This is my first time here and I will Definitely be back!!! The food is great, I had the Carne Asada Torta, and the service was down home friendly.  You will not be disappointed!!!

6m9ubTncbk7GXUMfcyuDUw.text: My boyfriend and I were searching for some authentic Mexican food in the south west area....came across phat phranks, and although it's not so much a "restaurant" the food was still delicious. They have yummy home made salsa and a pretty big selection of food to pick from. We will definitely be back!!! The desserts also looked really good, but we didn't get to try them.

2Q9mAK3VQFsZSfhsz_083w.text: We stopped in a little after 6pm and were the only ones in the place (it's more of a breakfast and lunch spot from what I gather).  The owner greeted us and was very friendly to my wife and I, explaining some menu items and pointing us to some of the more popular items.  My wife got the fish tacos and was very pleased with them.  I got the Chile Verde Pork burrito, which was massive, had plenty of meat inside and tons of flavor.  Each dish comes with his three salsas, a mild and hot red and a verde.  I'm a big fan of verde (green) salsa, and his was excellent.  We're from out of town, but if I am ever in Las Vegas again, I would definitely come back.

wT0RbvzgRmUYfXsfrRrF_g.text: First time here, and it was enjoyable. Employees were very friendly and they had some really nice music playing. I'm only putting 4 stars cuz they only had one table for 4 and the rest were tables for 2, which is understandable, just kind of annoying.

qRhwUWXLjmXHEA9Dp_SarA.text: The hype is True! I was wary for ages: 5 stars? Isn't it just a glorified Roberto's?  Nope, nope, nope, and I'm saying that as someone who likes several styles of Mexican cuisine, but not usually this type of down-home fare.   The bean and cheese burrito is already calling me, and it's only 8 a.m. as I type this. The beans have a savoury nomness (that word was overdue in the making) and the cheese is a swirl of hot comfort.   The bean tostada may as well be rebranded as a mini-salad, the toppings are so fresh and lovely.   Even my orange Fanta seemed to have extra fizz. The pretty decor (check out those high ceilings and the violin near the front) convinced me to stay and have our first PP meal there instead of taking it home.   But where Phat Phrank glows is with the ten-star service. We've enjoyed some excellent service lately, but owner Frank sets the bar out of reach of most mortals.   I'm still more into "fussy" Mexican, and Phat Phrank's doesn't offer my beloved potato taco, but I'll be back... again and again.

N9O4XlJxavtTD5lg3zejEg.text: The food here is amazing! I came here on lunch with my boss and had the Adobada Torta, their signature sandwich. I have had nothing tastier in even the most expensive sit down Mexican restaurants. Frank knocked it out if the park on this one! the flavors are incredible! between the secret sauce and the carmalized meat its just surging with flavor. I'm soo impressed that I signed up for a yelp account just to write this post. Frank's is one of those small hometown gems, family run that is just so lovable. Thanks for the great food, you have a customer for life!!!

IAp7OEh4OPW0HROred_5YA.text: Wow! The BEST fish tacos are located right here at Phat Phranks! The customer service was great too, worth mentioning!

L8OFnovRRbDJMSriJD3JJQ.text: So good! We just hit town and hadn't eaten anything but pretzels since 2 am ET. A quick Yelp search later & we found Phat Phranks. It's in an unassuming strip of stores/restaurants but don't let that stop you. It's a tiny place but clean and the food- wow! A gentleman I assume was Phrank welcomed us and proceeded to explain the menu, ordering, & specialties. So helpful and friendly! I went with the Adobada torta. Crispy seasoned pork- just the right amount of slow burn. Hubs had a carne asada burrito which he described as awesome. Kids had carne asada fries, carne asada tostada, & carne asada plate. All devoured in no time. (Meat eaters- what can I say?) We arrived early for lunch- 11:30 local time- and were alone initially. By the time we left people were lined up waiting on a table. Well worth it in our opinion. Heading out of town on a road trip but will definitely be hitting Phranks again before we fly out!

8qucSFJZzRo_0-tiq7tMfQ.text: Just landed in Vegas and wanted to try a local Mexican restaurant.   Found Phat Phranks on Yelp.  Awesome food and fantastic service.  Highly recommend stopping by and grabbing a freshly made meal!

IS5SN2XPOsVHuUC3xbXryw.text: When reading one of Vegas's local magazine, I happened across a food review that touted Phat Phrank's as having the best Mexican food in Las Vegas.  In my youth, consumption of Mexican food in Vegas was usually only done after indulging of some non-alcoholic Roy Rogers and Shirley Temples on the Strip (extra grenadine of course :P ). In those days, I would be willing to wager that you could have fried a shoe and it probably would have tasted good to me.   But this article indicated that Phat Phrank's was pretty darn good and I was craving some carne asada so...   I arrived at about 12 pm on a Thursday and the place was hopping. A line of about 7 people quickly formed, which gave me some time to peruse a laminated menu for what I wanted to eat. I settled on a carne asada burrito with a drink for about 7 dollars. Frank gave me a number, and told me to pick a seat and they would bring my food out to me. About 3-4 minutes passed and a reasonable sized carne asada burrito was delivered to me.   Stand by for carne asada burrito dissection...  Tortilla - This was ok - had the consistency of a whole wheat tortilla (a bit harder).    Carne Asada - While this was seasoned appropriately, I was a bit disappointed at how much of the Carne was too fat to eat...I'm used to a little bit here and there, but about a 1/4 of my burrito was annoyingly fatty.   Beans - Beans were flavor-fully non-offensive and didn't take away from the meat thankfully.   So all in all, Phat Phranks's was Phrankly ok. The reviews on Yelp make me think that maybe that was just a bad burrito day for Frank and his family. Unfortunately, I have yet to try Mexican food outside of California that is worth a repeat trip, but I'm willing to go back to Phrank's and try something else next time I am in Vegas to see if I feel any differently.

IBwwlKmrgRBIxEq7XdgFLg.text: Moving to Vegas from Southern California left us us wanting for good local Mexican food. We found Phrank's a while ago and it's now our go-to spot. Everything I've had here is excellent and the staff is friendly and actually cares that you're happy. HIGHLY recommended.

4u-EVTff87Mi8XSaGfkVhg.text: They have the BEST tasting breakfast burrito in all of Las Vegas! It has the perfect flavor and seasoning!! YUMMY YUM YUM!!!
